prompt:
Some people say that the best way to improv public health by increasing sports facility, others however say that they would have little affect on public health and other majors are required. 
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Numerous persons think that developing sports centres promotes the well-being of the community, while others believe that they affect rarely public health. The following essay will discuss both points of view. 

On the one hand, a significant number of individuals report that the health care sector will be improved by creating more training business. In other words, the government guide people to perform sports by building areas for the play, which help them to have better fitness level in parallel to their cardio-pulmonary system activation. Moreover, training activities strengthen the muscles that decrease the pain related to musculoskeletal injuries. To elucidate, I had back pain when I was a student, however since I started to do daily sports classes my illness had stopped. Thus, rising the sports facilities regulate public health.

On the other hand, a huge number of humans claim that building sports facilities has a minor effect on the health of society. This means, providing health-related awareness through advertisements, flash reports and messages in order to give tips about eating healthy foods. Furthermore, substitute the sedentary lifestyle with a more active and functional attitude. As reported in a study conducted by McGill University in the year 2012, the outcome measures of the functional behaviour reflect positively the public health. Therefore, public health requires multiple various steps.

To conclude, some people think that increasing the number of sports courses improves  public health. According to my mindset, I totally agree that numerous factors such as a healthy diet and an active lifestyle combined with the creation of training facilities promote  public health.
evaluation:

The essay adequately addresses the given task by discussing both viewpoints on the impact of sports facilities on public health. The candidate provides relevant ideas and supports them with arguments. However, the essay lacks a clear thesis statement and fails to fully explore the opposing viewpoint. The essay also fails to provide specific evidence to support the claims made.

The essay contains a variety of sentence structures, but there are several grammatical errors. The candidate makes mistakes with verb forms, subject-verb agreement, and punctuation.

**Suggested Band Score: 6.0**

prompt:
Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate.
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
In the present age, whether museums serve best as entertainment centers or whether they are best left as places of education has sparked much debate. In this essay I will present both views and shall state my opinion as well.

Firstly, entertaining museums are more monetarily successful. Strictly speaking, if an attraction is more geared towards amusing its visitors instead of teaching them it will be more popular. This is just a fact of nature, because learning new information is much more difficult when compared to entertainment, which requires no thought. Larger profits mean a larger influence, economically and socially, which are all huge feathers in amusing museums’ cap. So, pleasurable museums continuously earn more than scholarly ones and thus, have more options, more influence and have a greater impact on the economy.

	Secondly, uninformative museums can become relevant more frequently and stay so longer. Museums which are delightful and enjoyable can change their programs and exhibits, while solemn and academic institutions cannot afford to do it frequently, if at all. Because education is not their main priority, delightful museums can create new, spectacular exhibits without worrying about changing or losing their educational value. This is a huge benefit, which allows for these establishments to stay relevant and attract new customers more easily. Once a person has been to an instructional museum, they have little to no incentive to return, which reduces the amount of customers that this kind of museum can take in. The harm of this effect is opposite to the benefits of a bigger profit. Henceforth, amusing museums receive more return customers and thus, larger profits than academic museums.

	However, enlightening museums are more beneficial to society. This kind of museum’s purpose is to preserve past artifacts and to teach willing people their history and importance. This is important because the past must be preserved and museums can be host to direct sources, from which history is told today. Museums come in many different form factors, but their main goal is the same: to inform the public through various means. Museums don’t need to be entertaining to serve this purpose, because there are other places to seek amusement. Were museums to abandon their mission in order to seek a larger profit, they would lose their purpose and niche, while gaining significant competition in the entertainment industry. Museums can be entertaining and informative at the same time, but the biggest advantage can only come if the main goal of the institution is educational. Whereas recreational museums do not serve such a grand purpose, only enriching local culture at best and being a run-of-the-mill place to have fun at worst.
evaluation:

The essay effectively addresses the given task by presenting both views on the purpose of museums and providing the writer's opinion. All aspects of the task have been adequately covered and supported with relevant arguments. The essay is well-organized and coherent, with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.

- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 4.5

The essay demonstrates a good range and accuracy of vocabulary. The writer uses a variety of words to express their ideas clearly and concisely. There are a few minor mistakes in vocabulary, such as "uninformative" museums instead of "non-educational" museums. However, these mistakes do not significantly affect the overall quality of the essay.
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 4.0

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
The essay is generally grammatically accurate, but there are a few minor errors, such as "This is important because the past must be preserved and museums can be host to direct sources, from which history is told today." The sentence should be "This is important because the past must be preserved, and museums can house direct sources from which history is told today." prompt: People nowadays tend to have children at older ages. Do the advantages of this outweighs the disadvantages.
essay:
Recently, there is a general preference among  individuals concerning having children at mature times. Although, this will make one to be knowledgeable about two people coming together as one and  be ready to bear any consequences that might arise. But, having the chance of being pregnant and giving delivery without complication is more beneficial. This essay will be explained further in the subsequent paragraphs with examples and a logical conclusion drawn.

Firstly, getting to have offspring in the  later years makes one  have adequate knowledge about the  kids and the process involved thereby getting ready to carter any issue that might arise. For instance, a neighbour of mine once told me that she faced a lot of challenges when she was in the early stage of her pregnancy from her friends and her spouse's friends. She was able to conquer the obstacles because she attended awaiting mother's seminar for 5 months which resulted in her lateness to bear issues. In addition, being mature before one starts giving childbirth will allow the person to be ready to bear any concerns in the long run. 

However, female folks' tendency of getting pregnant in advance period is limited. This is because the hormonal cycle terminates as one is getting older. For instance, my friend that joined her partner 5 years ago is still battling to  miss her period due to an imbalance of hormones which resulted in infertility. Furthermore, giving delivery in old age might lead to  birth complications since the  energy needed for the process of pushing declines as one is ageing. 

To conclude, despite the majority deciding to have babies in their later period so as to have an understanding of raising children and plan to bear the predicaments  in the home,  being able to be with the  child after many years and to be born without dangers are more advantageous.

prompt: Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own or experience.
essay:
Some people believe that we could live in an unpredictable environment that results from global warming, whereas others argue that we should find a way to prevent climate change. I totally agree with the latter statement. In this essay, I will give reasons to support my opinion, including examples from my experience.

Firstly, not only humans but also animals cannot survive in a harsh environment. Therefore, I think finding a way to live with it is wasting our time. In contrast, we should encourage communities to prevent climate change. For example, due to global warming, the weather is getting hotter. Consequently, some people in Africa are suffering from it, and some of them died because they could not bear the weather. Another good example is that one cannot live without animals and plants. If the ecosystem of plants is destroyed, it will affect animals. Unfortunately, humankind will get a negative impact as well.

Secondly, even if protecting the environment requires huge efforts from communities globally, it will lead to a powerful impact and a last longer solution. For instance, dwellers in Australia are confronting with bushfires every year. Australia alone could not prevent this problem, as global warming needs cooperation from everyone. In addition, rising of the weather one degree Celsius may cause some animals extinctions. Nevertheless, societies could stop this issue by paying more attention to adjusting the way of living now, such as eliminating using plastic bags, reducing gas, etc.

In conclusion, people should immediately start to prevent climate change from today, since it will worsen in the future. Besides, I firmly agree that people should stop doing harmful things to nature because this is the only way to live longer.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has effectively addressed the given task by providing a clear stance on the issue and supporting it with relevant arguments and examples.
- The candidate has adequately covered all aspects of the task, including the pros and cons of both preventing climate change and adapting to it.

prompt: Only government action can solve housing shortages in big cities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
With the economic development, an increasing number of population flooding into big cities to pursue their dreams. A large number of them are suffering from housing scarcity due to the ever-accelerated housing price. Some believe that this problem can be only solved by government interruptions. To my mind, authority plays a role in tackle this problem, while there are still other alternatives that can be applied. 

First, The real estate developers should transform their strategies by building more economically affordable houses rather than the luxurious villa which is out of ordinary community’s financial ability. By doing so, a majority of folk could afford the expenditure on houses with the help of banks or make use of the government policies.  

Another effective way is that people should abandon their traditional thinking believing that a property is the only symbol of success or home. The mass media have the duty to alter the public’s mode of thinking. If people cannot own their property in a short time, renting a house for a short time to raise money for the future house investment could also be a plausible solution. 

Indeed, government can serve as a deterrent in restraining those real estate developers from inflating the house price as their wishes. However, a large proportion of citizens in big cities are still experiencing home scarcity due to the inequity of wealth allocation. The wealthy group or speculators still have access to buy a house prior to those common house buyers. only when house speculations is limited can the ordinary people have an opportunity to pay a house. 

To conclude, I believe that it is superficial to draw a conclusion that the house shortages can be solved rely solely on the government policies. Actually, house developers, government, and the public should made joint effort on this issue.
evaluation:

- The essay adequately addresses the given task and presents a clear stance on the issue.

prompt: Environmental damage is a problem in most countries. What factors damage the environment and who should take responsibility?
essay:
In recent years, environmental pollution has become one of the most severe problems that the human race has to face due to the hazardous impacts that this phenomenon can have on people, society as well as the ecosystem. A mass array of elements relating to industrial manufacture and deforestation are believed to be the prominent reasons for the increasing issue of environmental contamination. Therefore, in order to successfully address this predicament, it is necessary for the government, industrial firms and individuals to put in a large amount of effort.

 To commence, one of the predominant factors of pollution is the tremendous amount of industrial waste discharged into the environment by factories. One good illustration of this is the hazardous effects that industrial effluents can have on bodies of water such as lakes, rivers and the ocean. This is due to the fact these aforementioned effluents have not gone through proper treatment, meaning they still remain incredibly toxic, which can result in the contamination of water and the demise of many aquatic lives. In addition, it appears environmental damage can also be attributed to deforestation. To be more specific, the act of removing forests and jungles in order to make room for agriculture and infrastructure can be detrimental to a myriad of fauna and flora species, as a result of their habitats being wiped out. This may lead  to an imbalance in the ecosystem as a whole.

 Therefore, the authority, industrial firms as well as individuals should take appropriate measures in order to tackle this predicament. First of all, the government should promulgate decrees that prohibit contaminated material from being dumped into the environment and encourage manufactories to find an alternative to dispose of their waste, which can greatly alleviate the number of contaminants released. Furthermore, policymakers should enact laws that force manufactories to thoroughly treat their waste before discharging them. While the impacts might be smaller in comparison to the aforementioned remedies, each individual can help to ameliorate the situation by performing simple daily activities, for instance, recycling plastic bottles or planting more trees around neighbourhoods.

 In conclusion, it is evidenced that aspects associated with industrial manufacture and deforestation can be detrimental to the environment. As a consequence, it would be advisable for the authority, corporations as well as citizens to conduct practical measures in order to improve this situation.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate effectively addresses the given task by identifying the factors that damage the environment (industrial waste and deforestation) and discussing the responsibilities of the government, industries, and individuals in mitigating environmental damage.
- The ideas are presented in a clear, relevant, and coherent manner, addressing all aspects of the task.
- The arguments are adequately supported with examples and explanations.
- The candidate demonstrates a good understanding of the topic and fulfills the requirements of the task.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 8

## Coherence and Cohesion:
- The essay is well-organized, with clear transitions between sentences and paragraphs.
- Connecting words and phrases are used effectively to maintain a smooth progression of ideas.
- The logical sequence and arrangement of information contribute to the overall coherence of the text.
- The essay has a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion, which enhance its structural integrity.
- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 8

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The candidate demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, using a variety of words and phrases to express ideas effectively.
- Some minor inaccuracies in vocabulary usage are noted, such as "mass array" instead of "multitude" and "detrimental" instead of "harmful."
- The vocabulary is generally appropriate for the given context.
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 7.5

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
- The candidate demonstrates a variety of sentence structures, including complex and compound sentences.

prompt: Films and computer games containing violence are popular. Some people say they have negative effect on society and should be banned. Others say they are just harmless relaxation. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
It has utterly been claimed that computer games and films which consists of violence are extremely well-known. A plethora of individuals opine that films and computer games have a great number of detrimental impacts on community, so they ought to be restricted; however, an overwhelming majority of people deem that they are innocuous and assist persons to relax.
On the one hand, I understand why a vast majority of people support the opinion that violent movies and games are harmless. The proponents of the notion ensure a variety of points to elaborate their standpoint. First and foremost, in today’s world, people are overloaded with their work, and they also have hectic schedules; therefore, having worked, they are more likely to being interested in crime films and violent games in order to relax and refresh their mind. The second point to note is that according to the researchers of Baku State University, watching criminal films and playing violent games cannot negatively affect individuals since people could hardly remember and repeat these kinds of acts in their real lives.  
Nevertheless, I would side with those who argue that violent films and games should be banned. The primary reason why I think that these types of games and films ought to be forbidden is because they fundamentally consist of violence which can have a huge number of adverse influences on individuals especially immature people. To be more specific, children basically want to repeat and illustrate these actions which they observed, due to this reason that if adolescences watch pornographic films or violent games, they detrimentally affect teenagers’ psychology. Furthermore, these games and films may increase crime rate in the future. In other words, nowadays having observed these movies and games, people may start to practice in their real lives which they noticed, as a result of which in the future individuals tend to commit a crime more than at present.
By way of conclusion, there are certain justifications for the former statement, albeit I am of the opinion that violent movies and computer games should be banned. I recommend that especially immature people should not be interested in these kinds of films and games.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
The essay effectively addresses the task by discussing both views on the impact of violent films and computer games on society and providing a clear opinion. The candidate has adequately covered all aspects of the task and provided relevant arguments to support their stance.

- Suggested Band Score: 8.5

## Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay is well-organized and easy to follow. Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are clear, and connecting words and phrases are used effectively to maintain a smooth progression of ideas. The logical sequence and arrangement of information are appropriate for the task.

- Suggested Band Score: 8.5

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
The essay demonstrates a good range and accuracy of vocabulary. The candidate uses a variety of words to express their ideas and avoids repetition. However, there are a few minor mistakes in vocabulary, such as "overwhelming majority" instead of "vast majority" and "plethora of individuals" instead of "many people."

- Suggested Band Score: 8.0

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
The essay demonstrates a good variety of sentence structures and complexity. There are a few minor grammatical errors, such as "having worked, they are more likely to being interested" instead of "after working, they are more likely to be interested" and "they detrimentally affect teenagers’ psychology" instead of "they have a negative impact on teenagers' psychology."

- Suggested Band Score: 8.0

## Overall Band Score:
Considering the essay's performance across all criteria, the overall band score is 8.5. prompt: Some people say that playing computer games is bad for children in every aspect. Others say that playing computer games can have positive effects on the way children develop. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Nowadays, playing computer games is popular among adolescents some people argue that this situation has a detrimental effect on children, whereas others assert that computer games can be beneficial to the development of youth. In my view, some of the games such as puzzles can assist them to enhance their skills.

On the one hand, technological advancements have revolutionized people’s lives and youngsters have become the most overdependence users ,particularly in playing computer games. Due to the fact that becoming addicted to digital games might cause several mental and physical health issues. To put it another way, when youth spend abundant of their time playing digital games, they lose touch with friends and  become isolated. Therefore, this situation can lead to anxiety and depression as well as obesity. 

On the other hand, computer games have an essential role in the growth of youth and teach them valuable skills for their future. Problem-solving can be considered the main element that youth can be learned by playing games. To illustrate more, games teach them how to deal with challenges or learn novel techniques to overcome issues. For instance, brain games can be a great opportunity for them to make decisions rapidly and become faster than normal time. Furthermore, according to research which was released by Cambridge University brain games could improve productivity and multitasking. In my view, games can assist them to boost their soft skills.

To sum up, several citizens believe that games have not been a positive impact on youngsters while others argue that computer games have positively affected the cognitive development of children. From my perspective, I am in favour of the latter view.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:** 7.5
- The essay addresses the task prompt adequately, providing arguments for both sides of the debate.
- The response presents ideas clearly and coherently, supporting them with examples.
- However, the essay does not fully cover all parts of the task, as it does not discuss the potential negative effects of computer games on children's social and emotional development.

**Coherence and Cohesion:** 7.0
- The essay is well-organized, with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.
- The ideas are connected logically, using transition words and phrases.
- However, there are some instances of repetition and unnecessary details that could be streamlined for better coherence.

**Lexical Resource:** 6.5
- The essay demonstrates a range of vocabulary, but there are some errors in accuracy and usage.
- For example, "overdependence" should be "overdependent," and "abundant" should be "an excessive amount of."
- The vocabulary is generally appropriate for the context, but some more sophisticated terms could enhance the overall quality of the writing.

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy:** 6.5
- The essay demonstrates a variety of sentence structures, but there are some grammatical errors that affect the overall accuracy.
- For example, the sentence "To put it another way, when youth spend abundant of their time playing digital games, they lose touch with friends and become isolated" contains several errors, including the use of "abundant" and the missing subject in the dependent clause.
- The punctuation is generally correct, but there are a few instances of missing commas and misplaced apostrophes.

**Overall Band Score:** 7.0
- The essay demonstrates a good understanding of the task and provides some valid arguments for both sides of the debate.
- However, the writing is somewhat limited by errors in vocabulary and grammar, as well as a need for more thorough coverage of the task requirements.
- With further attention to these areas, the essay could potentially achieve a higher band score.

**Feedback and Additional Comments:**

Young people make the decision to spend more free time doing volunteer community work, instead of playing computer games and watching movies on the smartphone. I deeply agree that this kind of activities can definitely help adolescences collect many skills, knowledges and experiences.

To begin with, teenagers can help local communities do many volunteer activities as they are energetic and willing to learn communication skills and gain valuable experiences. In the nursing home, young people can read books, talk about news and walk with elderly people, assist the disabled people pushing wheelchairs. Therefore, they should give a hand to the others who are living around them.

Additionally, There are many juveniles who prefer spending their leisure time on computers and smartphones without face to face interacting with others. This kind of behavior may impair teenagers’ psychological health, including unsociability and indifference. When they grow up and earn a living, they may not able to adapt society and to fulfill their potentials. In contrast, doing volunteer works for the neighborhood will allow youngsters to confront different people and learning how to get along with them, to encounter different issues and gain knowledges and skills to address them.  As as result, It is a positive benefit for teenagers to do unpaid community works.

In conclusion, Contributing effort for the community brings many advantages to young people, and helps them to establish their goals in the future.

prompt: Some people think that the government should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles in order to solve environmental problems. To what extend to you agree or disagree?
essay:
Automobiles and other vehicles are essential part of transportation for majority of the people residing here in Pakistan. Most people think that the prices of the fuel should be raised by the government to solve the problems,related to the environment, persisting in our country . This essay will discuss that how i disagree, moderately, with the given statement.

First of all uses of the vehicles should be asscessed . Currently according to the statistics, 80% of the population own their own asset be it a car or a bike. The best advantage of owning a vehicle is that it is cheaper than renting a car or looking for some other alternative like taking service from Uber or Careem. So all of such things run on the fuel which in short becomes the basic necessity of every house hold.
Although usage of the fuel does cause damage to the environment but in my opinion the government should look in to the other important factors which are causing bigger problems to our environment. Problems created by the usage of fuel in the cars and other vehicles are very less as compared to the other factors which are contributing to ruin the air.  For example the refErigeators and the aerosol sprays that we use daily emits chloroflourocarbons (CFCs). The relese of this harmful chemical evolves in the air and effects our ozone layer , the layer which protects the planet earth from the damaging ultravoilet radiations ,which is depleting over the passage of time. The prices of such things should be raised because they are causing more damage to the environment.
It is concluded that the prices of the fuel should not be raised for the common means of commute , like cars and motor bikes etc ,as it is, nowadays , necessity for the layman and  instead the government should take appropriate measures to eradicate other problems which are much more harmful to our envoirnment.

Firstly, the government has the powers to control and maintain well all individuals. Government should give some extra facilities to big cities where there are a greater number of people. It’s the responsibility of the government to provide  job opportunities to everyone. So, that people can enjoy their life and has a proper house to build with sufficient money. Secondly, the government should take the land taxes less, so that it becomes easy for a person to maintain their financial levels, which means, a person can buy the land and make their house as they want. People do not have their homes which will impact  their lives as well as  their children. Those persons seem to be more mentally and physically ill.  

Furthermore, the government should construct a new buildings for those people who cannot afford to buy land or make their big houses. Due to the larger number of people, which give rise to expensive land and that land is not affordable for the common man which leads to a shortage of houses.  

In conclusion, it is clear that government have a major responsibility to tackle this issue. Government should build new buildings and townhouses that can afford people at a genuine price. Through this, people can live stress-free.

prompt:
Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to
increase the cost of fuels for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree
with this statement?
essay:
One of the most current major environmental problems is the air pollution caused mainly by vehicles exhaust fumes . It is often argued that in order to solve this problem , the government should raise the price of combustibles used by vehicles . In my opinion , I fully disagree with this view and believe that this method can be not an effective solution to this issue and there are other special measures that should be taken  .

On the one hand, the government should afford other convenient alternatives to use automobiles. For example , improving  public transportation and making it more  comfortable and affordable for individuals can be a useful idea  because the capacity of public transport such as trains and buses is enormous  and the number of  used automobiles will decrease significantly and the CO2 emissions will decline also rapidly . In addition , the government should establish public campaigns to aware people of the harmful dangers effects of air pollution on our nature and all of them have to take part of  the responsibility to protect the world by taking simple and healthy  habits such as using  cars only when needed and starting to walk or bike for going to work or study .

On the other hand, the high cost of fuel can discourage some persons especially those who are not rich in driving . However, the main issue is that some people have unhealthy attitudes toward the environment . For instance ,those  wealthy individuals would , most likely , still drive cars , even if the price of fuels become expensive . Moreover , individuals who work far away from their home ,  would obligatory drive cars . Therefore , despite the rise of fuels , the population still use them for their vehicles.

In conclusion, rising prices of combustibles do not seem to be an effective solution. Although it would alleviate the problem  in some cases , it would not suffice to solve it definitively . That is why governments should consider public awareness campaigns that would help the population to understand  the danger of an unhealthy environment and should make alternatives affordable and convenient .
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
The essay adequately addresses the given task by presenting a clear stance on the topic. The candidate effectively discusses the drawbacks of increasing fuel costs as a solution to environmental problems and suggests alternative measures. prompt: Some universities offer online courses as an alternative to classes delivered on campus. Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
essay:
E-learning is considered one of the most significant features for the contemporary technology. While some opponents are of the view that  attending face to face courses in universities campus pose more privileges, others argue that in today’s fast pace lifestyle, offering online courses holds  spectacular positivities. I am compatible with the believe that the remote studies provide with exceptional benefits.

 

At the outskirts, the far distance factor, depicts the positive image of the e-learning. In the past , it was implausible for students to enrol  in courses offered by  prestigious universities, due to the considerable distances between countries. Today, students can readily search online and select the best education systems, mentors or professors . Consequently, students can attend and enhance their education level. For example, there is  a mass of  competitive e- learning platforms, which provide a wide range of credential courses and  diploma certificates from the  wide world universities without any hindrance. Thus, online courses are rendering increasingly in altitude the proportion of high education levels for students around the world, neglecting the distance factor.

Furthermore, another positive factor, is the timing dilemma. When the universities offer remote classes,  this will abundant spare time. If the apprentice attends the campus lectures, wastes time in the transportation and the road,and this  may be more than the lecture period. In the contrary, the remote lectures save  spare time, whereas students can exploit this time in studies or even other activities. For instance,  some employees, because of their work timing, they cannot enhance their education level. However, with the advent of online courses, the breadwinner has become simplicitly registering  for university courses. In addition,  While daily commuting considers exhausting for student’s efforts, the presence of online courses serves as a harness for individuals’ energy. That is why offering online courses from universities holds a variety of positivities.

To conclude, this essay discussed different positive impacts, yield from the distance learning. Students can join easily any courses around the world and attain certificates from reputed universities, other positive features, students can retain more spare time as well as efforts for other beneficial activities. I firmly believe that providing online sessions from universities represents a positive phenomenon.
evaluation:

prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after graduating from high school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
It is thought that pursuing higher education leads to a successful career ladder, while others believe that getting a job right after high school would be better. This essay attempts to shed light on both perspectives before concluding that I am in favor of the latter notion.

On one hand, it is true that studying at a higher educational institution is one of the best ways to succeed. Firstly, university graduates tend to receive decent salaries. This is because they have equipped themselves with basic knowledge related to their career, which helps them to easily tackle unexpected problems and increase work productivity. Secondly, job seekers with a degree have higher chances to be selected into companies. For instance, several firms who have powerful impacts in Vietnam’s business tend to hire bachelor degree holders since they are trained in an academic environment for a quality time.

On the other hand, there are a host of compelling reasons as to why I am convinced that seeking for an occupation after graduating is also advantageous. The first reason is people will become more mature and independent. Having a well-earned job gives youngsters opportunities to become financially stable, this means that they can invest in themselves and help their family. Another reason is that they can be promoted easier. While others are studying, the ones who enter the workforce right after highschool are experiencing work realistically, they gain more experience and get more chances of promotions. 

In conclusion, while it is irrefutable that higher education is the best way to be successful, I would contend that getting a job right after high school would be beneficial.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has provided a balanced and comprehensive discussion of both viewpoints.
- All aspects of the task have been adequately covered, with relevant arguments and examples provided.
- The essay is well-organized and easy to follow, with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.
- **Suggested Band Score: 7**

## Coherence and Cohesion:
- The essay is well-written and easy to understand.
- Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are clear and logical.
- The candidate has used a variety of connecting words and phrases to maintain a smooth progression of ideas.
- **Suggested Band Score: 7**

- The candidate has used a wide range of vocabulary throughout the essay.

- However, overall, the candidate's vocabulary is appropriate for the context and adds to the clarity of the essay.

- The candidate has demonstrated a good understanding of grammar.
- There are a few minor grammatical errors, such as "While others are studying, the ones who enter the workforce right after highschool are experiencing work realistically" (instead of "While others are studying, those who enter the workforce right after high school experience work realistically").
- However, overall, the candidate's grammar is accurate and does not hinder the reader's understanding of the essay.
- **Suggested Band Score: 6**

## Overall Band Score:

- The candidate has demonstrated a good command of English and a clear understanding of the topic.

prompt: Interviews form the basic selection criteria for most large companies. However, some poeple think that interviews is not a reliable mthod of choosing whom to employ and there are other better methods. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is argued that the best method to recruit employees for the job is arranging interviewing sessions which are usually preferred by most large-scale companies, whereas the rest of the people have a strong faith in other ways of selecting workers. Although  the interview is an appropriate mode which allows one to check the individual's qualification level as well as background,  I believe that the other criteria are also significant for checking how much practical knowledge and skill is acquired by the recruiter.

To begin with, the first point viewpoint which is taking interviews can assist hiring managers to know the basic details about the person. This is because in the interviews manager has an opportunity to ask any questions regarding past experiences, certain backgrounds, qualifications and difficult questions relating to the certain field in which the employee wants to work in. For instance, the biggest Tata Steel company in the U.S. revealed that they are choosing the best employers from 10 out of 1 who do not lacks in any single question from the total questionnaire session. However, according to, my perspective interviews are not enough the other factors and capabilities required to run the business cannot be ignored.

Apart from this,  education is necessary but other practical knowledge is a must which can be checked by arranging demo sessions where the performance of the representative should be analysed. This is because the most essential abilities needed in an operator are leadership, coordination for teamwork, communication skills and independency which make a person an adequate employee and can be only experienced by the manager when analysing their trial during demo recruitment sessions. For example,  as per the news headlines in Argentina, the labourer's work is customised first before selecting the final workers. That is why if the person will already check it gives relief to the manager and no regret in future.

To conclude, it is clear that an interview is just like a discussion which does not disclose the inner abilities of human beings as I firmly opine that other ways are helpful for choosing skilled employees for the splendid earnings and growth of organisations.

prompt: As major cities in the world are growing today, so do their problems. What are problems for young people who are living in the cities as the result of continued growth? What are solutions for these problems?
essay:
As large cities in many parts of the world are increasingly developing these days, there are a lot of issues for the young generation who are urban citizens. Several problems result from this phenomenon and some solutions should be tackled by the government and individuals to improve the situation.

The growing population in the large city has brought two main problems. To begin with, many young people have difficulty getting employed due to the competitive job market. This is because rural people tend to migrate to urban areas for better job opportunities, leading to a large number of young job seekers struggling to find employment. Another issue worth mentioning is the high cost of living has put heavy pressure on young people to secure living expenses. A considerable rise in exorbitant prices of commodities has placed people who have a job with low compensation at a disadvantage, which lowers their living conditions.Taking HCM city as an example, The fresh graduates often struggles to maintain a good and stable job and quality of their living.

However, some measures could be implemented to alleviate these problems. Firstly, the government should put more resources into providing subsidies to companies that are willing to acquire young employees. These subsidies can be a great attraction that contributes to a boost in the hiring rate, making it easier than ever for young job seekers to find a well-paid job. Furthermore, it is vitally significant for individuals to upgrade their educational abilities by acquiring soft and communication skills, realistic experience and more advanced degrees. People who own these factors will be more likely to be hired in big companies.

In conclusion, there are various issues emerging from this trend. However, some steps could be taken by the government and individuals to ensure that solutions.
evaluation:

- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task.

prompt:
Historical objects should be brought back to their country of origin.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some people opine that the historical artefacts should be returned to the country of origin which were captured during wars or colonialization while others argue that it should remain where it is right now.  I agree with the former view and this essay will discuss the reasons in brief.

Firstly, many people have sentiments and emotions attached to the objects which were taken away from their country in the past. Besides, this also exhibits the nation history and cultural values. For example, during the British rule in India, the idol of Lord Vishnu was stolen from the temple and is now being displayed in a museum of London. Many people believe that the ideal place of the statue should be the temple from where it was stolen rather than a museum. Due to this many Indian citizens are putting pressure on the government to bring those items back.

Secondly, these items can be used as a remedy for building and improving the relationship between the two countries. Also, it helps to bring peace and harmony between them. For example, when the ties between France and Egypt were not at their best, Prime minister of France decided to return mummies which were captured during World War I to Egypt in order to normalise their relationship. Due to this gesture of goodwill, bilateral talks resumed between these two sovereign states after a decade.  

To conclude, bringing back the historical artefacts not only boost the relationship between states but also brings happiness in the society as many sentiments and culture values are attached to it.

prompt: Children find it difficult to concentrate on or pay attention to their studies in school. What are the reasons? How can we solve this problem?
essay:
Not being able to focus on class is one of the main concerns in the early-age learning journey. From educational perspectives, there are two main reasons which are the mismatched learning styles, and long-term exposure to poor nutrition and lack of sleep. 

Firstly, it is irrefutable that we all learn differently, and so do children. Some learn best by seeing, hearing or doing. Therefore, if the teachers only emphasize a specific learning style and apply it to all the children, this can result in a lack of focus and understanding. In this case, the solution is to ask the teachers to observe what are the options that they can choose to engage children in their learning experiences. For example, inquiry-based learning projects can be planned and adapted to search for the right methods. 

Secondly, it is sad to state, but, indeed, children cannot focus on their studies simply because they do not get enough sleep or nutrition. In fact, there are circumstances where many children do not have enough recommended sleeping hours or have to skip breakfast to be on time. Consequently, these children do not have energy and become distracted in class. As adults, we need to take our steps to reduce the numbers of children who have physical disadvantages. Government, schools and families have to work together to build up better schedules so children can have more time to sleep. Besides, they also must have free-food programs for poor children to make sure they are full when they study. 

In conclusion, there are many reasons which could lead to the failure of paying attention in the classroom. However, from my perspective, mismatched learning styles and lack of nutrition and sleep are the main causes. Together with families, governments and schools have to work on their policies in teaching methods and free-food programs to support children more.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by identifying two main reasons for children's inability to concentrate in school: mismatched learning styles and lack of nutrition and sleep.

prompt: Some countries have an ever-increasing proportion of population who are aged 15 and younger. What is your opinion of the current and future effects it may have in those countries ?
essay:
In some countries, the number of young people who are under 15 years old has a significant rise in recent years. In my opinion, this trend would influence the current and future times of these countries both in negative and positive ways.

Having more young people would bring various impacts on society such as allocation of educational resources and job opportunities. Firstly, if public schools have full enrollment, parents would have to send their children to private schools. This means parents need to pay higher tuition fees than the cost of going to public schools. It could largely increase the economic burdens for children’s families. Secondly, in the coming decades, it might be more challenging for these young people to secure jobs, especially when governments have trouble in offering sufficient job positions.

Meanwhile, a larger population of youth may also bring advantages to the nations. On the one hand, in order to ease the current pressure, governments need to invest more money in infrastructure, including public transportation, sports facilities, and school construction. This could create a better environment for teenagers. On the other hand, the younger generation tends to be energetic and creative, which is a useful source of innovation and evolution for their own countries. Therefore, a nation would be more advanced in the upcoming years by having more youngsters.

In general, when there are more young citizens who are aged 15 and younger in some nations, it has not only drawbacks but also benefits in the present and future time.

prompt: The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, children’s participation in sports at school is widely advocated and encouraged, as it is considered the most effective way for children to learn cooperation at an early age. However, I would argue that the value of sports activity in terms of facilitating collaboration is overestimated, and the adverse outcome may well appear.

It is recognized that children are naturally inclined to compete, and games are usually made to include a competitive factor. Sports, obviously and unfortunately, are competitive by nature: only one win and the rest lose. It adds to children’s stress by pressuring them to be outstanding within the team and win over the other side and undermines the accessibility of cooperative thoughts and behaviours. Especially in the current social context, winning has been widely accepted and allowed to become a prominent part of the mainstream. As is often the case in sports, parents or coaches or even the audience on the sidelines cannot help shouting to urge children to win and compete rather than cooperate.

Therefore, simply counting on sports to cultivate a sense of cooperation and collaboration seems to be far from satisfactory. Instead, more attention needs to be drawn to create an environment that inspires collaboration and a joyful experience. Children learn character mainly through imitation. They listen, observe and learn skills by watching the words and behaviours of parents, teachers and peers. Family and school projects could be devised to include everyone and make everyone feel needed. Parents and teachers could guide the children to recognize that everyone has something valuable to offer in a group, and show appreciation for their contributions. By deliberately practicing these skills and recreating such an atmosphere, we manage to teach children behaviours that will ultimately benefit themselves.

In conclusion, sports activities can be a platform for a negative type of competitiveness and sometimes exacerbate it. It is more effective to turn every day into boundless opportunities to emphasize the importance of cooperation and fuel children to exercise and practice the art of cooperation.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement: [6]**
- The candidate has effectively addressed the given task statement by discussing the extent to which team sports in school contribute to children learning cooperation.
- Ideas are presented with clarity, relevance, and coherence, as the essay follows a logical structure and provides arguments and evidence to support the main points.
- However, not all aspects of the task have been adequately covered, as the essay mainly focuses on the negative aspects of team sports in fostering cooperation and does not fully explore alternative ways to teach children cooperation.

**Coherence and Cohesion: [6]**
- The essay is well-organized, with clear transitions between sentences and paragraphs.
- Connecting words and phrases are used effectively to maintain a smooth progression of ideas.
- The logical sequence and arrangement of information is maintained throughout the essay, contributing to its overall coherence and readability.

**Lexical Resource (Vocabulary): [5.5]**

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy: [6]**

prompt: Some people think scientific research should focus on solving world health problems. Others think that there are more important issues. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Technology is progressing day by day that strives hard to make human lives comfortable. It is argued by many public that world well-being issues should be addressed by engineering sciences, whilst it is thought by others that there are a lot more crucial jobs to talk about. In this essay, I will highlight both sides of the arguments along with illustrations and at the end put a conclusion.

To begin with, It is thought by some masses that robotics should concentrate on world dwellers' wellness because people's longevity has fallen down. Since the planet is facing new diseases which are sometimes incurred due to improper medications or zero availability of medical equipment. Additionally, lack of research in a related field sometimes leads to no clue for health sectors to identify the illness at an early stage. Thus, it is found very common at current that minor health issues cause death. To cite an example, If there was a thorough study on viruses infection, the planet would never see a pandemic like this, As it has been experiencing since 2020.

Furthermore, It is considered by a group of people that the mechanics should focus on other important difficulties such as environmental degradations , Cheap transportation sources etc. Inasmuch, At the moment earth is facing worse climate conditions and the environmentalist is claiming; In fact,  it will be the worst in near future if not tackle down. Similarly, people are still using conventional transportation means which take hours and days to reach the destinations because the plane journey in terms of fare is too expensive. earth's average temperature is soaring by 2 degrees Celcius which is  alarming and if by 2050,  it will not let down then there will be a dominant warmer season and less rain that lead to scarcity of food, For example.

To conclude, Many people are saying that science focal point should be health issues, This is because people's lives span are decreased while others think the contrary, they are claiming that there are other problems on the table which should be picked, like nature abasement, low price transits and so on. However, I personally feel that  science should keep a balance between them and pay  even attention to both sides and the authority needs to  allocate equal funds.

essay:
In the realm of  children improvement,some people believe that guardians have the main effect on them,whereas the opponents have alleged that Tv and their friends are more powerful to influence them.However,in my point of view,they both are indispensable in forming the personality of the learners.mentioned sides are uttered here.

  One of the most highlighted discrepancies between parents and others has to do with their positions in the mind of their offspring,while they are usually looked up to as the heroes of their next generation,Therefore,they are pursued by toddlers as roleodes.For instance,based on the surveys that have taken place in this area,the majority of juveniles are similar to their parents in various sectors,such as either their character or even the same capabilities to encountering the issues.Furthermore,the bold roles of the elderly emerge in the situations that the young requires to be conducted via consultation or more harsh reactions.As a vivid case,the older not only are aware of the threats for the juveniles owing to the experiences that they used to have but also they have a better prospect of the conditions that appear while they are monitoring the activity of their adolescents,which can be exploited to control them in hazardous circumstances.In other words,they can assist their heir to opt for appropriate programs or even friends.

  On the other hand,owing to the close understanding that individuals have if they are in the same age,it is clear that babies are attracted to people in their age,hence they will learn a lot of things from them by mimicking their function,which has been released by the experts.For example,in the conditions that there are divergent toys,most of the unadult folks are absorbed in the ones that their patrons are using  and even if they change their mind regarding the utilisation of objects again the followers would strive to get the new one.Moreover,the broadcasted cartoons from Tv have the potential to penetrate their audiences as an offspring of the professional mindsets that have been exploited to build that.Namely,using scion to play opted roles in movies or even looking at the globe from the prospect that their followers can perceive,which stimulate the youngster to trust in and accept the issues that have been transmitted to them.

To recapitulate,although some individuals have claimed that friends and Tv have a stronger impression on  children due to the appealing energy that they have,the rest mentioned their guardians as the main manager,who can control the activity of their offspring.Anyway,to me they both have their share in the life of the young,so,a mixture of them should be considered to guide the juvenile toward the appropriate goals.

prompt: ; Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuels for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The past 50 years have seen a dramatic increase in the occurrence of environmental problems. Some individuals claim that this issue could be solved by raising the cost of fuel. While I partly agree with this statement, I do believe that there are many other ways to deal with this issue, instead of looking at only one aspect of the problem.

To begin with, it is an indisputable fact that after the industrial revolution, the number of car factories  increased. As a result, nowadays, the air is adversely affected by  car exhaust gases which cause a harsh climate. To explain, these gases contain a huge amount of toxic substances, chief among them is Co2. To illustrate, Tehran- the capital of Iran- is a salient example of a polluted city. I suggest that by raising the pay for gasoline and petroleum, presumably, people tend to use less their private cars. Nonetheless, reaching this aim needs pivotal infrasturactions like a good public transportation system as well as implementation such cultivation as car/bike-sharing schemes.

Equally importantly, the Earth suffer from some other problems more than just weather issues. Firstly, in recent days, more and more pollutants are discharged into the oceans. Thus, the lives of marine animals have become under threat of extinction. A salient instant is mass-stranding  in whales. Secondly, another major contributing factor is nature challenges. To explain, it might have been seen that more woodlands are recently destroyed by builders to build more houses and villas.

By way of conclusion, I once again reaffirm my position that whereas increasing the expense of fuel can be beneficial for the sake of air pollution,  there are a number of other problems which are pivotal as much as air contamination.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

The essay effectively addresses the given task and presents a clear stance on the topic. The candidate has identified the different aspects of the issue and provided relevant arguments and evidence to support their position. All aspects of the task have been adequately covered.

    * "mass-stranding" -> "mass strandings"

**Suggested Band Score:** 3.5

    * "car exhaust gases which cause" -> "car exhaust gases, which cause"

prompt: Leaders and directors in organizations are normally older people. Some people think having a younger leader would be better. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Society experiences a trend that the old in many organizations normally take over the leading and directing positions. Whereas, there is an opposite opinion to prefer to have a leader who is young. I totally agree with the idea that the people who lead and direct any organization should be the older generation.

On the one hand, working with a person that becomes the header of a company at an early age would have many merits. First, they might put less pressure on the industries’ members. This is because they are not as strict as the older so it could create a more comfortable atmosphere to work. Second, these teenagers are more likely to be open-minded so it is rather easy to collaborate. Moreover, whenever receiving either positive or negative comments, they are always willing to accumulate them and adjust properly to have a more well-rounded perspective of working. 

On the other hand, though there are plenty of benefits brought by the younger headers, it is unacceptable to underestimate the abilities of mature leaders as well as directors. All of them (Time’s up) have a certain wealth of experiences after overcoming a wide range of challenges, which helps them to acquire the flexibility in tackling tough problems. In addition, they work with their high responsibilities and well-manner personalities, especially in Japan. For instance, Japanese industries’ CEOs pay much attention to the honesty of workers and penalize those who avoid their own work.

In conclusion, despite the fact that it is quite good to have a young person  run a company, I still believe that the better controller should be the older people. This trend is easy to understand due to the experiences and the personal traits of the old outweigh the less pressure and opened-mindedness of the younger CEOs.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
- The candidate has effectively addressed the given task by providing a clear stance on the issue and supporting it with relevant arguments.
- The essay covers all aspects of the task, including the advantages and disadvantages of both younger and older leaders.
- The ideas are presented in a coherent and logical manner, demonstrating a good understanding of the topic.

prompt: In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?
essay:
In some nations, there are many people attracted to find out about the history of the building where they live. I really agree with this argument because this trend leads to positive impacts for homeowners to know about the capacity and safety of the house from professional analysis.

Learning about designed buildings plays a vital role in configuring the space area and preventing accidents in extreme conditions. Firstly, the strength of the building should be known by the home’s owner to adjust the function of rooms inside the building. It would be a danger, especially for buildings with a second floor or more if the building retains a load over the allowed capacity from the load of furniture, people, and household appliances. Then, it will end with structural failure. In addition, researching on building’s history can be a part of safety management because the owners gain experience with the building’s capacity under natural disasters such as heavy storms, or earthquakes.

On the other hand, the rule of building information can be tracked at the initial plan before it was built. Because of the limitation of knowledge about building design, the history of the building can be assessed by hiring a consultant engineer or contacting the developer, considered professional. As a result, the specialist will decide if the building conditions are still safe and serviceable or not. If it is not confirmed in good condition, the consultant can give some recommendations to maintain the building to be considered a good operation.

In conclusion, building information should be tracked by the owner because it provides safety information and reliable data for room configuration and building capacity under extreme conditions.
evaluation:

- The essay addresses the task by discussing the reasons why people are interested in finding out about the history of their homes and providing suggestions on how they can do so.
- However, the essay lacks depth and fails to fully explore the topic.
- The ideas presented are somewhat relevant and coherent, but the arguments are not fully developed.

prompt: Some people believe that all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent machines. What is your opinion?
essay:
many people claim that all job desks will be replaced by this artificial intelligence program. my own view on the matter is the situation depends on the job itself.

To begin with, it is true that nowadays many companies compete to make the smartest artificial intelligence in order to be well-known for the project they made. moreover, not all works are able to be done by machines. for example, for people who work for human health, this job apparently needs a real person to check their conditions. thus, until this present time, Doctor parts cannot be taken away and done by artificial intelligence. Although one part of the medical world is being seen as having huge potential for helping doctors to make diagnoses.

on the other hand, artificial intelligence is suited for automatic routine, formulaic which does not require creative thinking or human intuition. restaurant waitress could be a good idea example here. In addition in recent years, a lot of restaurants have used robots to deliver meals to the customers which this part would be an efficient way to serve the buyers. in contrast, chefs in restaurants have to not be replaced due to the skills they have to make the orders.

To draw the conclusion, artificial intelligence is great to have a work like humans do. even though, there are still exist the work which has to be done by human intuition. likewise, artificial intelligence and human collaboration could evolve into partnerships where artificial intelligence handles data processing and humans focus on strategy and service. to my way of thinking, the existence of artificial intelligence yet creates a wide range of new jobs.

prompt: Some people think that robots are important for human future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
It is ubiquitously seen these days that the use of robots has been intensified more than ever, given various emerging dynamics. For human future growth, some individuals believe that the use of robots is important. Contrastingly, others believe that robots have a negative impact on the society. However, I find myself standing tall with the latter viewpoint. In the section underneath, this piece of writing shall propagate both the merits and demerits of the use of robots in human lives and society.

Some people believe the use of robots has many downsides for human growth. 

First and foremost, with the increasing use of AI, almost in every field, the work which used to be performed by humans has been overtaken by robots and resulted in a loss of jobs and unemployment. Secondly, a lot of individuals are using it to perform fraud. Nevertheless, over-reliance on robots could suffocate human creativity and critical thinking, as people may become too dependent on AI to solve problems. Recently, a renowned newspaper published a news, with the use of an AI-drive robot, a person was able to hack bank account details to steal money. 

There are advantages to the use of robots. With the use of AI, productivity, and efficiency have increased and human error has exponentially decreased. Furthermore, AI-powered robots can analyze vast amounts of data and make complex decisions For example, the Tesla self-driving car uses vehicle sensors to mimic the human brain resulting in a decrease in accidents and is programmed to ensure human safety. Additionally, in the healthcare sector, robots can perform surgeries with reduced human error.

In conclusion, different people have different notions regarding the statement, but I have a plethora of reasons to advocate that although the use of robots has huge benefits. However, the challenges it poses should not be overlooked to prevent negative societal impacts.
evaluation:

           On the one hand, schoolers at high schools are not wise ample to attack the lack of educators. Furthermore, positive critical remarks assist  tutors to polish their lessons taking into account the enjoyment and recommendation of their pupils. In consequence, this helps to improve schoolers' interests toward gaining knowledge. Also, the bond becomes strong between the team and enlistment. Students can guide personnel toward providing educational experiences they truly enjoy. 

         In conclusion, although  there are several negative influences, I believe that enlistment should convey openly their comments.

prompt: Nowadays, celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree.
essay:
Today, celebrities are more popular for their financial state and stylish lifestyle than for their professional awards and achievements. Such a tendency negatively affects young people. I absolutely agree with this as the excessive demonstration of wealth and focusing only on materialistic things can raise selfish generations without values and principles.

First of all, boasting being a wrong pattern of behaviour is continuously shown by the media misleading many fans of young age around the world. Thus, youngsters start to think that such behaviour is a direct way to success and popularity among peers. Not only is it dangerous but also it sets the wrong mindset that hard work and high achievements in any sphere are not necessary. For instance, some popular bloggers from the internet claim that it is easy to become successful and financially independent without any efforts. A lot of teenagers are not aware of the fact that every famous blogger has a big team responsible for the content and marketing.

Furthermore, it is quite controversial that materialistic values are the most important ones and everyone should strive for them. Besides, spiritual development is as important as physical and materialistic ones. Without solid values and principles, people are likely to be disoriented in this fast-moving world as one trend can be easily substituted by another. In other words, the idea that money and popularity are tightly connected is detrimental, especially for young unformed minds. A prime example would be young singers. Some of them are known to be scandalous, while others take drugs because wealth and glamour changed their perception in a negative way.

In conclusion, I firmly believe that seeking wealth and glamour rather than high results is detrimental to young generations. I would recommend ignoring a wealthy lifestyle actively advertised by the media.

prompt: In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?
essay:
In the modern world, among the number of issues people have to deal with, the historical topic is one of them and along with it arises something more specific – there are more people, in some areas, are becoming concerned on researching about the past of the house or building they live in. Within the scope of this writing, some causes are discussed and from then the ways to look for information are mentioned.

As the beginning part of the discussion, the reasons are worth mentioning initially. Firstly, we can see that nowadays, culture plays an important role in human lives. It means, the more societies develop, the more people tend to appreciate ancient values. To illustrate, some old villas that were built in Da Lat city of Vietnam in the Indochina period were bought with a lot of money, even they are more expensive than modern houses. Secondly, finding out about the history of the house or building helps people learn about design styles. Through this result, more and more people want to show their knowledge to other people. Finally, most Asian people believe in the spirituality of a building. In detail, directions and constructions of rooms, as well as the history of a house,history of a residence can affect to owner’s life. For example, in some countries, it is wildly believed that people will meet numerous unlucky and difficulties if they live in a building that had some detrimental problems in the past such as accidents, illness, divorce…

Researching the history of the house or building, in some cases, is not simple. However, there are some steps for people to do. One recommendation is that they can chat with the previous owners of the building or receive advice from neighbours. Furthermore, there are forums or social groups on the Internet for people to get information about real estate. Thus, it is logical that we can share the story and discuss it in forums to collect more knowledge. In addition , a look further into this problem is that people can look for instruction from books, newspapers or experts.

In conclusion, some reasons for the issue can be identified and there are some ways for people to know about the history of constructions.

prompt: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In the eyes of some, businesses are not only economic units generating wealth; rather, they should shoulder social responsibilities. I agree with this opinion as when doing so, businesses are indeed investing in their sustainable development.

In the short term, shouldering social responsibilities, say social and environmental ones, could buy businesses opportunities to gain profit in turn. When fulfilling their tax obligations, businesses can improve their financial credit scores. This is because businesses can prove that their tax records are clean, thereby buying them opportunities to approach low-interest loans and raise funds more effectively. Thus, businesses can take this advantage of competitiveness over their rivals and gain more profits. Also adopting manufacturing practices that minimize environmental damage is financially beneficial for businesses. Accordingly, this strategy enables businesses to avoid huge environmental taxes and protects businesses from boycotting campaigns of environmental activists.

In the long term, This strategy could bring businesses both sustainable profits and new customers. Taking social responsibility, say philanthropic activities, means an investment in expanding the future's market. An explanation for this argument is when helping impoverished people escape ingrained poverty and have a higher standard of living, businesses are creating potential customers in the future, and in turn, selling more products to these new generations of customers. Furthermore, this strategy helps businesses draw new customers. In fact, when taking responsibility, businesses could establish a picture of themselves as economic units not only generating wealth but also willing to accompany society in reaching common goals and solving challenges. This helps build trust and bonds between businesses and the community, and new customers will come later. 

In conclusion, although businesses are economic units generating wealth, They should shoulder social responsibilities because this is a sapient investment in their sustainable development.

prompt:
Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well.
To what extent do you agree or disagree.
essay:
Nowadays, many volunteering activities spread over the internet, searching for participants. This activity has a lot of benefits for the participants and of course,  the neighbourhood. It might be the reason why some people think that is mandatory for adolescents to take part in  volunteering activity. In my view, I agree with that statement. So, in this essay, I will explain the reasons why I support that. 

The first reason is for  teenagers. The young generation can increase more social experience. This includes how to understand the problem, how to gain the idea to solve that issue, and how to take the actions. For example, there is a charity event that is conducted by the local church. The aim is to get money for people in East Indonesia, which suffered from an earthquake. Joining this program will increase our conscience about other people, and furthermore, it gives us a chance to take  humanitarian action. In addition, this experience can not be learned at school or by attending an academic course. 

Secondly, it is for the neighbourhood. First of all, many communities have their own problems  and many of which do not know what to do. Regarding that matter, many helpless people need some help because our government can not reach this issue. For instance,  there is a person, who has lived alone for more than 50 years in a hut. He also suffers from cancer since 10 years ago, and of course, he does not have money because he has lived under  poverty. Thence, you can see that this person really needs help. So, a particular organization, such as Tzu Chi, will get the doctor for this man and also renovate his hut. Finally, for over than 9 years, he can feel a decent life like other people. 

In conclusion, unpaid community service can be a platform for adolescents to expand their soft skill in humanity area. On the other hand, many helpless people also have the opportunity to feel happy.  Hence, in the end, I will totally agree with the idea of having  unpaid work as a compulsory matter for the adolescents, concerns  the benefits of it.
