prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.
What are the reasons for this?
How can people research this?
essay:
The prevalence of people searching for information about the history of the place where they are living is increasing. I believe there are several reasons and two main ways that help with research about it. 

 

The major cause is probably the satisfaction of people’s general curiosity, especially about the origin of their house or building, because for roughly two-thirds of the day they stay at home, so it is understandable if they want to know deeply about it. For example, they may want to know when it was constructed, who the former owners were, or what kind of materials were used for contracting. Furthermore, all this information may assist them in preparing a renovation plan for the future, such as which part of the house or building they should examine or the cost of the remodelling. That can make them feel more secure about their accommodation's condition. Finally, knowing about the history of their house or building may make them feel more appreciative of what they have, and in another situation, if they want to sell it, they can pass the information to the next owner because the purchaser might want to know. 

 

 

Turning to the ways to research information, first from the former owner or the landlord. For instance, if they just rent the accommodation, they can ask directly from the landlord. If they brought this place, they should get in touch with the person who was the former owner if they can get the address of her or his. The second way is by going to the local cadastral office. In this place, there will be employees working there to support the information fully. 

 

To summarize, the cause of this trend is primarily related to curiosity and the repair plan, and there are two ways to aid them: the landlord, the former owner, or the local cadastral office.

The innovation of the technology has been the highly debated topic since a decade. Some believe that numerous option among the electronic devices has raised the difference in between impoverished and wealthy civilian. Whereas, the rest of the folks argue that it has decreased the difference. Firstly, this essay will discuss the reason behind the thought of increasing the diversity and reason behind declining the same. Lastly, state the opinion in the favour of making equal status among the civilian.

On the one hand, the main reason behind the social status is the capacity to buy a latest electronic device. The wealthy folks have more money and tend to be eager to show off their strong financial status to the world. As a result, there is a clear line formed in between the impoverished and wealthy people as wealthy folks have the branded gadgets. For example, according to the apple company of the USA report, 70% buyer of the apple appliances  belonged to the wealthy family as they can able to buy those expensive appliances. 
On the other hand,  except for the renowned companies, many other offers the same device at a reasonable price. Consequently, all classes of people are able to buy those gadgets. For instance, as per the user data of the mobile phone offices,  there are almost 95% of the people have the electronic device due to the availability of more options in it.  
From my point of view, I believed, nowadays, just having a appliances, no one can identify whether the other person is from a wealthy family or poor. Due to having branded a phone with the impoverished people as well. 
In conclusion, having a latest device does not mean that the person is wealthy as now everyone has the range of new technology at their home. However, to identify the difference between poor and rich person, the best is the bank statement and their living style.

prompt:
The expansion of multinational companies and increase in globalization produces positive
effects to everyone. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement
essay:
Globalization and the flourishing of multinational enterprises is a ubiquitous phenomenon that is benefitting not just the nations but also inhabitants. Both these factors have completely flipped the image of society and its working bringing out positives as well as negatives. Nevertheless, I strongly concur with the idea that it showcases the positive developments. I will elucidate on my conviction with relevant examples.

To commence with, I believe that international migrations have significantly influenced the Education sector. Students are moving into other lands to fulfil their objectives and passions. For example, numerous pupils dream about pursuing degrees in the best universities of the world which is made easier due to globalization. Moreover, after ,studies they can opt to work in the second nation as indigenous corporations welcome overseas talents. Even the world has become a global village where everyone is living with integrity. Hence, such movements are glorifying the countries as well as scholars by giving limitless opportunities.

Furthermore, viewing the economic aspects of nations, I opine that tourism and the aviation industries are progressing boundlessly through which profits are generated and could be utilized in the uplift of the citizens. In the light of globalization, corporates can work globally by working on smooth norms helping other lands to alleviate unemployment rates. For instance, Google is operating in almost every part of the world linking discrete employees. Moving ahead, the social facet is inescapable. When people move  abroad, they meet up and become friends with locals which aids them to know and accept their culture. Therefore, multicultural societies are taking birth welcoming every religion and culture.

In conclusion, undoubtedly worldwide movements outshine and assisting the workforce to travel around the world to take every possible chance. I reckon that worldwide firms in connection with globalization have made the world a better place for everyone.

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.
Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
It is true, that art is depicted as one of the most crucial directions in the Humanities section. However, some sceptics insist on how meaningless this subject might be for children. Personally, I would support the idea of merging the disciplines into an upscale program for talented individuals. In the other words, my opinion is based on finding the balance between these groups.

On the one hand, not every child is keen on STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) subjects. For example, according to the worldwide statistics, 60% of primary school students, mostly enjoy moulding the clay figures and draw, as long as it brings the flow of relaxation. It is widely known, that working with scientific papers and other practical materials requires a high level of stress and anxiety, while the art-related subjects help the pupils expressing their emotions and feelings to the fullest. Moreover, the whole process is operated by the sense of creativity, which is a must-have job qualification nowadays. 

On the other hand, the parental concerns are welcomed to be acceptable, too. Although, the idea of releasing innovative potential may sound promising, the most desirable specialists in 2020 are the software and civil engineers. Having said that, the vast majority of adults are worried about the future perspectives of their children. Unluckily, hard work of, for instance,  graphic designers and book illustrators, is not being paid off well enough. Furthermore, a lot of artistic professions are not taken seriously and considered as not the best value for money, especially, for those parents, whose children are attending private schools.

In conclusion, both scientific and art directions should be highlighted as significant in 2020. I strongly believe, that despite their advantages and disadvantages, they can easily complement each other. In this case, the visual representation of objects can be a great inspiration for the future inventions.

prompt:
Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well.

To what extent do you agree or disagree.
essay:
offspring are the backbone of every country. So, there are communities who tend to believe that youngsters should be encouraged to initiate social work as it will result in flourished society and individualistic growth of youngsters themselves. I, too believe that this motivation has more benefits than its drawbacks.

To begin with,  social work by children can be easily associated with personality development because, during this drive, they tend to communicate with a variety of people, which leads to polished verbal skills. For example, if they start convincing rural people to send their children to school they have to be such a convincing attitude along with developed verbal skills to deal with diverse kinds of people there. This improved skill will help them lifelong in every arena. Apart from this, the true values of life like tolerance, patience, team spirit, cooperation can be learned. Besides that, the young minds serve the country with full enthusiasm that gives the feeling of fulfilment and self-satisfaction. This worthiness for themselves brims them with self-confidence and patriotic feeling. Moreover, going and experiencing multiple cultures and traditions make their horizon so broad that add one more feather to their cap.

However, It is truly said, no rose without thrones. Can the drawbacks of this initiation be ignored? Children go to school, participate in different curriculum activities, endure the pressure of peers, parents, and teachers and in the competitive world, they should not be expected to serve society without their self-benefits. This kind of pressure might bring resentment to their mind.

In conclusion, I believe, the notion of a teenager doing unpaid work is indeed good but proper monitoring and care should be given to avoid untoward consequences.

prompt: Many people use social media on regular basis in order to keep in touch with the news and with other people.Do you think that the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
Nowadays, social media has played a huge part in our lives. It is a platform that many people use to stay in touch with other people on a daily basis. However, social media has certain drawbacks too. This essay will explain the pros and cons of social media.

One of the major advantages of utilizing social media is connectivity. Social media is a platform that can connect people all over the world without having to worry about time and distance. By leveraging social media, we can share information and build relationships with friends, family, colleagues and even celebrities. It creates a sense of bond amongst each other.

Aside from connectivity, social media has been an essential platform for educational purposes. It makes learning easier and more accessible for many people. One-click away and 

we can acquire the knowledge to perform various tasks simply by following the instructions or tutorials available on social media platforms.

Nevertheless, social media has its disadvantages too such as spreading fake news and cyberbullying. It can be challenging to verify the accuracy of information found on social media platforms. The moment a piece of news became viral it spreads like wildfire. Aside from fake news, many people have become a victim of cyberbullying especially when it comes to public figures or celebrities that they despise. They usually create fake accounts just to hate, bully and threaten them which leads to an unhealthy environment in society.

In conclusion, social media has a deep impact on everyone's daily lives. Everything depends on how smart we can utilize it. If social media is being used wisely then the amount of benefits we can acquire is unlimited. I believe that the advantages of social media outweigh its drawbacks.

prompt: In some cities, public parks and open spaces are changed into gardens where local residents can grow their own fruit and vegetables. Do you think the benefits outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
In some urban areas , public parks and open areas  are replaced with  gardens where local people  can grow their own fruit and vegetables. Although this trend can bring advantages for local residents including, encourage people to eat healthy food. I believe demerits of this trend greater outweigh merits because it can have negative impacts on local people health, and make local people less social.  

On the one hand, the primary benefit of alter public parks and open spaces to gardens is motivate local inhabitants to eat healthy food. This is because this trend can increase availability  of fruit and vegetables for local people, which mean more a people will eat fruit and vegetables. Therefore, local inhabitants health will enhance. 

On the other hand, I would like to argue drawbacks of this development significantly far more than upsides. The first drawback of changing  public parks and open zones to gardens is can leads to adverse consequences on local people health. To illustrate, plant fruit and vegetables can attract many insects, which mean some insects can spread diseases namely, cancer, HIV, and Ebola among local inhabitants. Make local inhabitants less social is another downside of this development. This is because people often use public parks and open spaces to socialize with their friends or people on neighborhood. Consequently, replace public parks and open spaces with gardens can make local people more isolated, which this can make local people are more likely to get mental health issues namely, depression, anxiety, and stress. 

To sum up, Although altering public parks and open places to garden for  local inhabitants in order to  grow their own fruit and vegetables   can bring upsides  for local residents including, incentivies  people to eat healthy food. I think drawbacks  of this development outweigh advantages because it can have detrimental  influence on local people health, and make local people less social.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
One of the most conspicuous things in today's world is a discussion about whether adolescents should be involved in free association. Some advocates state that youngsters can have more experiences if they do community work in their spare time. Personally, I completely agree with this statement.

To begin with, allowing youngsters to have a job in association teaches them to communicate with people effectively. To illustrate, different job categories have their standards for negotiation, this gives the opportunity for minors to convince others of the reality. It is a practice for them before they enter society and start working. Secondly, while it can be beneficial to the young generation, it is also advantageous to the neighbourhood. Namely, when there are more young-blood assimilated into the culture, companies can have a broader view of the life values of the young people and have further improvements in their business, which can boost the economy.

On the other hand, there are some voices saying that this activity could have serious negative impacts on society. The first element is that there are some juveniles who are often against the law and they may force their job peers to join them. For instance, when a person sells cigarettes illegally and he/she encourages the workers that work with him/her to join, it can be a bad effect on the district. Furthermore, if a student goes to trial in his/her free time, it might cause a decrease in academic results. If they cannot have an accommodation between work and academics, it results in poor school results.

In conclusion, even though it is stated that there are some detrimental effects regarding this statement, I firmly believe that it would be more beneficial for both minors and society.

prompt: More and more people are becoming seriously overweight. Some people say that the price increase of fattening foods will solve this problem. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In the new era, a growing issue of people becoming dangerously overweight. To solve the above problem, one school of thought holds that some people propose increasing the cost of high-calorie foods. While I accept that their perception is somewhat justifiable, I believe that individuals should also be self-conscious about their own weight status.

On the one hand, the growth of fattening food prices is applied as a public policy in each country that could be beneficial to their society as a whole. This is because payable cost fluctuations affect people's consumption. Consumers tend to choose products based on their budget, so an increase in the payable cost of a product contributes to a decrease in consumer purchasing. However, fatty foods are mostly essential commodities, even if they increase, they are still affordable for families. For instance, according to a survey conducted by the Department of Consumer Protection, KFC fried chicken stores in Vietnam have increased their prices five times in a recent decade. Especially, its sales have not decreased, on the contrary, it has increased eight times since 2014. As a result, it is difficult to say that it helps to limit obesity in the community.

On the other hand, there are a host of compelling reasons as to why I am convinced that individuals should also be responsible for their weight status. First, each person must raise their awareness of products that they will buy and use. For example, consumers can look at the amount of fat recorded on the label of packages before purchasing to ensure their nutritional needs are in each meal. Furthermore, a healthy diet should be a considerable choice for every family, such as a combination of fibre, fats, and carbohydrates. We know that fat is also an important nutrient that has been proven necessary for the human body. Therefore, if it is removed from the menu, it is not necessarily a good thing.

In conclusion, whilst it is irrefutable that increasing the price of fattening foods is a simple solution to the problem of individuals becoming overweight, I would contend that it fails to address the root causes of the issue and some they should put effort into adjusting their diet.

prompt: Many people argue that in order to improve educational quality, high school students are encouraged to make comments or even criticism on their teachers. Other thinks it will lead to loss of respect and discipline in the classroom. Discuss both views
essay:
There has been a heated controversy on whether high school students should be free to evaluate and criticise their educators. While some people think that disrespect and indiscipline are the unavoidable aftermath of this approach, I would contend it would result in increased educational quality.


On the one hand, there is a common belief that enabling students to judge teachers may undermine students’ sense of respect and discipline. High school students are generally immature, inexperienced and impulsive; they tend to lose their temper and overreact each time they are disciplined by the teachers. The problem is even worse when all the students see their peers criticising the teachers. They may think of such action as a right way to behave and start to imitate it. As a result, the classroom learning environment can be filled with disrespect and indiscipline.


On the other hand, I side with those who believe that giving students the total freedom in expressing their thoughts and feelings towards teachers may enhance educational standards. Many countries are promoting students-centred teaching with two-way communication, where open discussions between teachers and students are encouraged. This approach has a clear advantage of making students become proactive in studying. It also provides teachers with a chance to better their pedagogical skills by receiving feedbacks from students. By this way, both the learners and the educators can achieve higher academically.


In conclusion, the educational of encouraging high school students to judge their teachers may undoubtedly lead to enhanced academic achievements, despite the possibility that a disrespectful and undisciplined attitude amongst the class.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**
The candidate has effectively addressed the given task by discussing both views on the topic. They have provided relevant arguments and examples to support their stance. However, the essay lacks depth and analysis, and the arguments could be further developed with more specific evidence and examples.

The essay is generally well-organized and easy to follow. Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are clear and logical. However, some sentences could be rephrased to improve clarity and flow.

prompt: Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid work in their free time to help the local community. They believe this would be benefit both the individual teenager and society as a whole.Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
People hold different views on whether teenagers should be required to do unpaid work in their free time to help their nation's society.  As far as I am concerned, my agreement outweighed the disagreement.

To begin with, doing work without a salary can easily cause boring and exhausting for  teenagers. This is because  they need to do the work for a long time without receiving any money when they can use their leisure time doing their hobbies or relaxing after school. As a result, this may lead to conflicts between the youth and their local government. An obvious example is that in many countries because the teen is requested to do voluntary work too much without remuneration, a lot of demonstrations have occurred. The reason for this is that they feel stressed when doing unpaid work.

However, by participating in unpaid work, can gain a large amount of  valuable experience before applying for a job. This can be explained by when commencing a job at an early age, they can have more time to do their work and gain knowledge which would be useful for their future employment. In addition, businesses could  benefit when the amount of money they need to invest in training  beginners will be decreased when they have a large of experience before doing a job. As a result, more money will be spent to increase the product's quality so that local people can buy them at an affordable price. For instance, nowadays many businesses accept the young who do voluntary tasks, this is because less time  is needed to train them and they can use that to enhance the quality of the products and gain more profit.

To sum up,  there are many advantages when requesting the young to do their local unpaid work. However,  governments need to take responsibility to avoid some unwanted conflicts between them and teenagers.

The candidate has adequately addressed the task by expressing their agreement with the idea of requiring teenagers to do unpaid work in their free time. prompt: Some universities offer online courses as an alternative to classes delivered on campus. Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
essay:
In parallel with the incredible development of technology, online curriculum has become one of the common features of university education, which is gradually replacing face-to-face classes. From my perspective, this movement brings about both positive and negative impacts to students.

On the one hand, offering online courses is considered to be very essential to students who always up to the ears with full-time learning schedule, especially those living far from the hall. In other words, online courses offer learners a flexible time to attend the lesson so that they can postpone the lessons to do their job or arrange it easily in their busy timetable without any worries about missing courses taught in the campus. This is extremely advantageous for students who have part-time job, which helps lighten their financial burden. Moreover, by purchasing online courses, students can have an access to the unlimited sources of accurate information which are provided by host academy. Thus, it is very beneficial for students who are seeking for crucial information for their essay, as well as those who slow on the uptake can replay the lesson as many times as they want.

On the other hand, online education still has some vital disadvantages which merely traditional classes can afford. Firstly, it is impossible for students to interact directly with their tutors and peers, which plays an integral part in their understanding the lessons. This is due to the large number of students studying online, it is time-lacking for both students and professors to communicate with each other. Secondly, the online learning solution requires lots of self-discipline to become effective, which just a small number of students can make it. For instance, first things may appear on the top are gaming badges, media, following are notifications from Facebook and pop-up advertises, which are real nuisances to the learning process.

In conclusion, having online tertiary education as an alternative choice is beneficial to some students. However, I think that the drawbacks are harmful in the long run and it should be taken into account.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

The candidate has adequately addressed the task by providing a clear and relevant response to the prompt. All aspects of the task have been covered, with the essay presenting both positive and negative impacts of online courses. The arguments and evidence presented are generally sound and support the candidate's position.

**Coherence and Cohesion:**

The essay is well-organized and flows smoothly from one idea to the next. Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are clear and effective, using connecting words and phrases appropriately. Overall, the vocabulary is appropriate for the context and enhances the essay's readability.

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy:**

The essay exhibits a good variety of sentence structures, including complex and compound sentences. However, there are some grammatical errors, such as "living far from the hall" (should be "living far from campus") and "it is time-lacking" (should be "there is not enough time"). These errors affect the clarity and precision of the writing.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?

It is true that volunteer work should be considered as the best way to utilize leisure time by the modern generation for the goodwill of society and themselves. In my opinion, this trend can have positive impacts on the community as well as youngsters. 

To commence with, working without salary benefits youngsters in many ways. Firstly, individuals can learn many skills while doing community work such as time management, teamwork and leadership. This is because they have to deal with numerous problems where these skills are required. At the societal level, it also contributes to the betterment of the community as well. In addition, it may help to improve the economy of the nation without spending extra money. For instance, governments have to spend a lot of money on hiring new employees if no one prefers volunteering. So that money can be used for the development of other facilities for the improvement of their lifestyle.

In conclusion, I would like to reiterate that the modern generation should be encouraged to participate in volunteer work for the benefit of society and themselves.

prompt: Nowadays many job seekers are finding jobs that force them to move for from their family and friends. Is it a positive or a negative trend? What can be done about it?
essay:
To begin with, a lot of people believe they can earn higher incomes by working overseas. As a result, living standards and economic conditions for their families will improve, especially for people who migrate to developed countries from third world countries. There are, by comparison, other negative aspects that people should remember. The family members have a chance of a cultural shock, because there could be certain rituals and practices that do not suit them. To overcome this problem, families should learn common language about the land to which they are going. It will minimize the "cultural shock" and help avoid unpleasant accidents. Family members should also have an idea about the country's laws and rules prior to travel. This should avoid law-related issues. Photography of government buildings or monuments, for example, is a criminal offence in some countries.
Second, living far away from your loved ones could cause depression in some people. It takes time to get to know an area and make friends, particularly at the start, so people begin to feel lonely. For example, if the person is older, beginning a relationship becomes much harder, because everyone else has already established their social circles. In this case, however, employers do play an important role. Since businesses recruit people from abroad they can plan for a smoother transition. Employers, for example, may require monthly offs for workers so they could visit families, at least for the first months.

prompt:
Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a
way to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is true that some people argue that instead of trying to stop climate change, we should learn to live with it. I completely disagree with this statement, because this issue is having a huge effect on the environment and we have to come up with ways to reduce it before it does serious damages to our planet.

It is true that technology developments will cause the loss of traditional cultures. I agree with this view because technology doesn't seem to be affecting other cultures.

It is true that the definition behind traditional and religious festival has been forgotten by many people, since nowadays most people only want to enjoy themselves. Although I am not against people having a good time, I completely disagree with the meanings of these festivals being forgotten.(all these festivals have special meanings and should not be forgotten)

In varies countries, a small amount of people earn extremely high salaries. While it is the belief of some people that this is beneficial for the country, I believe that salaries should be kept at a certain level.(everybody deserves equal pay)

It is believed that an academic degree leads to future job opportunities. I agree with the given assertion while there are also some other underlying reasons involved in this respect.  

I agree with the view that the importance of academic qualifications to find a good job cannot be ignored. It seems that university graduates are more likely to be recruited by other companies. That is to say, businesses show tendency to employ staff with academic backgrounds, since they have had theoretical information which is a basic need to start a career. Take a young person who has recently graduated, and had learned a various array of subjects related to his academic field as an example; this leads him to find more appropriate job with more favourable revenue. 

In addition, there are contributing factors that can be considered beneficial to get a more satisfying job. 

Firstly, if individuals attend courses related to their field to attain experience, they are more likely to be welcomed by more firms. Secondly, personal quality is an element that by no meant cannot be neglected. More precisely, those who work on their personal characteristics such as being well-mannered, responsible, and hardworking are more likely to be far more successful in the job market, and employers place a premium on this workforce. 

To conclude, I agree that having a satisfactory job requires academic qualifications, practical skills as well as productive qualities.

prompt: The increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment. What are the causes of this? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay:
The natural environment is harmed as a result of increased consumer goods manufacturing. The main reason for this is that the products which involve chemical materials are harmful to the environment and a viable solution is to make strict laws to protect the environment. 

First of all, one of the first problems of that the number of people consuming increases year after year, and some of them consume more than they need. In the other words, when people consume more products, they become product more goods. In addition, all manufacturers want to meet the demands of their consumers. As more goods are produced, toxic wastes are released from factories into nature. For example, more single-use products are introduced, most of which are non-biodegradable.  These products can remain as waste for thousands of years,  turning our planet into a huge landfill.

A solution that is some measures should be taken by the government. Manufacturers also  should be encouraged to use eco-friendlier materials. For example, the WWF which is a famous brand in Turkey has recently replaced nylon and polyester clothes with reusable alternatives made of materials like cotton or wool. Thus, the clothes which are produced by WWF can be recycled.  

To conclude, the major problem of damage to the natural environment caused by the excessive consumption of products can be partly alleviated by making laws. Furthermore, it is predictable that the number of factories which use eco-friendly materials will increase over time. . . .  . . .  . . .  .

By participating in social work, many young adolescents are instilled with a sense of  responsibility. Secondly, increased in teenagers who are responsible among the population could reduce the  rate of juvenile crime in the community. Thus, the juvenile crime rate in the  community eventually reduced with well raised teenagers.  In conclusion, it can be clearly deduced that crime rates could be reduced in community as  there are more responsible teenagers who are able to ensure a harmonious community.  Therefore, the occurrence of juvenile crime rate could be mitigated and that may benefit the  society.

prompt: Many countries spend large amounts of money on preparing competitors in major world sporting events such as the Olympic Games and football World Cup.  Instead, this money can be spent on encouraging children to take up sports at a young age.To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Investing in sports is an important part of the government’s business to improve the physical fitness of the population, particularly young children. While it is necessary to train a few selected individuals to compete in major world sporting events, the government should do more to provide young people with plenty of fun activities. There are a myriad of benefits to be gained from funding sports participation at grass-root levels and excellence in performance at elite levels.
To begin with, to motivate children to be physically fit, they should be physically active with a lot of fun at grass-root levels, and the key is investing in a variety of sports facilities.  Whatever their fitness personality, all young children can be physically fit through enjoying regular exercise, if only for the fun of it..  Generally speaking, if children start doing sports early enough, they will come to regard physical activity as a normal—and fun—part of everyday routine. The point is keeping the focus on fun because young children will not do something they do not enjoy.  If they enjoy a sport, they will do more of it; on the contrary, if they do not, they may be bored and frustrated and therefore reluctant to exercise. This shows why money should be spent on giving fun opportunities to children who begin taking up sports at an early age.
At elite levels, it is not a waste of money when it comes to preparing competitors in major world sporting events because athletes are allowed to experience the winning spirit of competition on the global stage. For that matter, every government has a duty to spend money on helping its people fulfill their potential, and such events as the Olympics and World Cup can give athletes a goal and young people a chance to believe in themselves. At this point, the question arises about the wisdom of a country (with limited resources) spending too much money and not getting a good return on investment, suggesting that this money should be put elsewhere instead. Although the answer to the question depends on who you ask, there is evidence that investing in elite athletes is gaining support from a country’s people who like to see their stars shining in international competitions. That in turn is an encouragement for young children to do sports at an early age.
In terms of policies, a county has nothing to lose when spending huge money on encouraging young children to be engaged in physical activities at grass-root levels as well as on preparing competitors at elite levels.  Both policies are worth investments from the government. And neither is a losing business.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement: (4)**
- The candidate has addressed the task prompt by discussing both sides of the argument.
- Ideas are presented clearly and are relevant to the topic.
- The essay covers all aspects of the task, providing arguments and evidence to support the points made.
- The candidate has fulfilled the requirements of the task by providing a balanced and well-structured response.

**Coherence and Cohesion: (4)**
- Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are generally clear and smooth.
- Connecting words and phrases are used effectively to maintain a logical flow of ideas.
- The essay is organized in a logical sequence, with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.
- Overall, the text is well-organized and easy to follow.

**Lexical Resource (Vocabulary): (4)**
- The candidate uses a range of vocabulary appropriate for the topic.
- Vocabulary is generally accurate, although there are a few minor mistakes (e.g., "a myriad of benefits" instead of "numerous benefits").
- The essay demonstrates a good understanding of vocabulary and uses it effectively to express ideas.

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy: (4)**
- The candidate uses a variety of sentence structures, including complex and compound sentences.
- There are a few grammatical errors (e.g., "the key is investing" instead of "the key is to invest," "if children start doing sports early enough" instead of "if children start doing sports at an early age"), but these do not significantly hinder comprehension.
- Overall, the essay is grammatically sound and easy to understand.

**Overall Band Score: 5**

- The essay meets all the criteria for a Band 5 score.
- It addresses the task prompt effectively, presents ideas clearly and coherently, uses appropriate vocabulary, and demonstrates a good grasp of grammar.
- While there are a few minor errors, these do not detract from the overall quality of the essay.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
One might think that enforcement of mandatory community service by youths during their free hours will be beneficial to them and the community. I highly disagree with this opinion, because teenagers have the right to choose which skill they want to progress in their free time. In addition to that, community development is the responsibility of the government.

Freedom to select what interesting thing to do on the youths precious time can further motivate them to excel. This is because every person is unique and has various points of preference. It drives them to invest time and focus in achieving certain tasks. A better approach is to present the tasks and programs that can help them hone their present skills. For example youths with anti-social behaviour, it will be unfair for them to be required to work in a community that requires social skills. Anti-social presons can be productive in solitary jobs like computer programming.

Obviously, teenagers development through forced labor in the community will never be productive for them. Since this is carried out in a way that youths dont have a choice, results are expected to be in low compliance. Only a low percentage of this age-group can tolerate uncompensated labor, most of them spends their time in social gatherings, games and even sports. In contrast, youths who work usually would expect to have salaries, as this will be the motivating factor for them to buy their needs and wants at this stage in life. As an example, nowadays, highschoolers are active with social media, they spent a huge number of hours on these platforms, learning, communicating, and at times take advantage to earn extra money, that is why community work will be the least option for them.  

In conclusion, there are much better alternatives in honing the youth, among those options, community required jobs are not the best. Teenagers can be productive and beneficial to the community by doing things where they excel and enjoy the most.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:** [6]

The essay partially addresses the given task. It provides some relevant points regarding the rights of teenagers and the responsibility of the government for community development. However, it does not adequately explore the potential benefits of mandatory community work for both teenagers and the community. The essay mainly focuses on arguing against the requirement of unpaid community work, which is only one aspect of the task.

The essay lacks a clear structure and logical flow of ideas. The transitions between sentences and paragraphs are not always smooth, and the essay jumps between different topics without proper衔接. The organization of information could be improved to enhance the overall coherence and readability.

For example, "anti-social" is not appropriate to describe individuals who are introverted or shy. Additionally, the essay could benefit from using more varied and sophisticated vocabulary to enhance the precision and clarity of the ideas.

The essay exhibits some grammatical errors in terms of sentence construction and verb forms. The use of punctuation is also inconsistent at times. For example, "uncompensated labor" should be hyphenated as "uncompensated-labor." The essay could be improved by carefully proofreading for grammatical accuracy and ensuring the correct use of punctuation and sentence structures.

**Overall Band Score:** [6]

Overall, the essay partially fulfills the task requirements and demonstrates some proficiency in language skills. However, it lacks a clear structure, coherence, and precision in language use. With further development and refinement, the essay could potentially achieve a higher band score.

Their acting skills might be mediocre, but they have become a sensation through the public display of their materialistic wealth and charming lifestyle. Besides the fact that certain good bigwigs like Bill Gates and Ratan Tata inspire  to  juvenile achieve their goals through hard work and dedication, there is a significant majority of superstars who is hypocritical.  

To sum up, famous big shots do negatively influence the youth through their public display of wealth and unhealthy habits which harm the mental health of the childhood.

prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while the other believe that it is better to get a job straight after graduating from high school. Discus both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Many people assume that studying at university or college is the best way to a successful career, while  others think that getting a job straight after graduating from high school is a better choice. This writer will show the point of view in this essay.

On the one hand, studying at a university or college has a variety of benefits for students. They will have degrees and knowledge after graduating. It leads to the increase of job opportunities to get a well-paid job. Moreover, spending four years at university or college helps students improve their presentation skills and their confidence.

On the other hand, entering the workforce right after high school bring a host of advantages to students. Firstly, they do not need to take four years in university or college and during that time, they will have leisure time to take care of their self and family. Not only that, the students who choose to work will be provided with more life experiences and these things might help their careers in the future. For example, Bill Gates one of the richest men in the world, dropped out of Harvard University to pursue both his talent and desire in the computer science field.

To conclude, learning at university and college brings many advantages back to students such as developing the opportunities of finding a high-quality job and earning more knowledge. However, I trust that getting a job right after school gives students more free time and it is better.
evaluation:

In many countries today, parents are able to choose to send their children to single-sex schools or co-educational schools. Some people think that children going to single-sex schools have disadvantages later in life.

prompt: Some people think that money spent on developing the technology for space exploration is not justified. There are more beneficial ways to spend this money. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The technology from the very beginning has two aspects, if it is used in the right way it is beneficial for survival, but if it is utilized in the wrong way it may be worse for the whole mankind. A  popular stratum of society believes that spending wealth in the development of space exploration is necessary. However, in its sharp contrast, others opine that it is the sheer wastage of money which could rather be used to eradicate other issues of the community. I would like to delve into both the arguments before making an opinion.

The first school of thought claims that evolution of space technology has brought humans the possibilities of life in outer space, which is a huge achievement. According to some researchers, the end of the earth can be expected as a consequence of factors like pollution, global warming, etc. So, the space scientists are working on projects to produce habitat on other planets. They believe that without exploring the space or other planet physically we cannot have any idea about it. Moreover, without having prior knowledge of other spheres we cannot live there. In addition to this, developing space technology is compulsory.

However, another group of person opines that spending wealth on space technology is surely a wastage of it. Every year a huge amount of money is spent on this by different countries to just prove their strength. They believe that as we live on earth humans should not face problems in their daily life to run their lives smoothly. Instead of spending too much money on space exploration program e governments should spend on social issues. For example, governments should provide jobs for their pupil, they should construct better infrastructure  for better development, they should provide better medical facilities and much more.

In the conclusion, I would conclude that developing automation for space exploration is good for mankind, but this fact cannot be denied that it requires a huge amount of fund. The governmental bodies should also keep a regular check on social issues to bring happiness into people's lives and on planet earth.

prompt:
Some people belive that robots are very important to human’s future development, whilw others believe they are dangerous and negatively affect society. 
Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
It is argued that robots will have significant value for our lives in the next future, while some people think that it will damage and giving a negative impact on society. In my opinion, the damage and a side effect that might affect our community need more concern to consider how to avoid it in forthcoming development.

On the one hand, the cutting-edge technology that creates robots that benefit our lives is also important. For example, the development of robots to cover some dangerous work, such as cleaning the window of high-rise buildings instead of some workers with cranes. It will increase the safety of the construction business subsequently. 

On the other hand, the danger of robot development will increase insecurity in our society, especially in terms of job opportunities in the future. For instance, some jobs have been replaced by robots, such as waiters in restaurants and receptionists in hotels hotel. If this condition keeps going for the next decade, It will affect some workers in these sectors sector, and they might lose their job and become unemployed. Although the existence of robot to help a certain business give more benefit to the owner,  it will create more social issues in society.

In conclusion, these issues should be something that we need be aware to think about it before the development affects more negative sides for our community. Being aware of the issues can be started by thinking about the idea of how to develop a robot that can help human work that is too dangerous to be done previously, then consider the effect on society when developing the idea also will limit the negative effect for us in future development.

 Conclusion, some advocaters might say that parents do not have enough time to tell stories, I believe parents by narrating stories can foster higher values in their offspring and prioritize a sense of morality in their future.

Viết cho Do Tuan Anh

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they lie in.

What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?
essay:
Nowadays, many individuals are showing attitudes towards the history of the place they live in. This phenomenon is rising globally and thus the need for finding proper ways to gather data. In this essay, I will explain  some major reasons behind this trend as well as how to search for related instruction. 

To begin with, a group of individuals are very interested in the background past of where they live. Firstly, having as much as possible information about a residence record in various items like the quality of its original materials and its durability over time makes the current owner of the house aware of the possible weaknesses and how to deal with them with regard to the previous possessor’s experiences. for example, a building made of strong materials and a history of good standing against environmental problems, especially destructive storms, could be a reliable place to live in harsh conditions. Secondly, some folks have special beliefs in Supernatural beings and their power to influence humans’ daily life lives. Thus, they might search for anything related to their concerns before buying a residence. For instance, if these people find out a building has so-called hunted in the past by some supernatural creatures, they would definitely hesitate to purchase it.

There are numerous ways in order to get a dossier almost about any topic. Firstly, it can be searched on social media and some platforms such as Google in order to gather data about the place they want to know. Secondly, asking  some of the old residents in neighbourhood neighbourhood could be a good idea as well.

In conclusion, people's tendency towards getting information about the history of the house they are living in is increasing. There are different reasons behind this phenomenon within the population. However, if they want to know about the background of a building, there are easy and available ways like using the World Wide Web and also in-person interviews.

prompt: In some countries celebrities complain about the way media publicize their private lives. Some people say that they should accept it as part of their fame. Do you agree or disagree ?
essay:
Media is playing an important role in our lives by publishing news through e-media or printed ones. Especially, when the media gives exaggerated focus on the personal lives of  famous people, sometimes it's  a curse for them. However, a few people believe that every celeb should bear with it as it's a part of their fame. I personally disagree with this statement. My inclination shall be explained in upcoming paragraphs.

There are many factors why publishing too much  news about celebs' personal lives should not be part of their fame. The primary one is it is harmful to people as well as those famous people. By that I mean, it diverts people’s attention away from  important topics such as politics, business or the environment. For Instance, the public knows more about Salman Khan and his broken relationship than the political issues. Apart from that, celebrities' bad actions or habits sometimes become negative inspirations for the public. For example, If some celebs drinks and smokes, it is copied by many youngsters as they think it's  glamorous to do so.

Furthermore, sometimes media also creates a detrimental effect on stars. In other words, when paparazzi follow them everywhere, it breaks down their peace of mind. They can not enjoy themselves like the common man, at  one ,point it will be stressful for them and their career also suffers. For example, a famous actor Sushant Shigh died because followed by the paparazzi.

However, the counterpart argues that it is part of their status. Mainly, famous person followed by many people as role models and want to be like them, that is why they want to know each and every detail about their personal lives. Moreover, Sometimes celebs themself want to be covered by the media all the time in order to survive in the cut-throat competition of this entertainment world. In this way, they can build their fame and gradually this becomes part of their life. But, this does not mean the media has all the right to publish anything about them, especially about their relationship or private movement of life, just to grab more public attention and increase their customers.

To conclude, although, stars are idols of many people and fame should be maintained by the media to survive in their careers, I believe, publicizing their personal lives is stressful, distracts people and gives some bad habits to  youngsters. Also, as human rights they can keep the privacy of their life and need not  share all the stuff, Media should also know where to draw the line.

prompt: A lot of old people are suffering from lonliness these days. They also lack physical fitness. What do you think are the reasons for this problem. Can you think of some possible solutions.
essay:
Nowadays a number of old people experience anxiety and prefer living in solitude rather than expressing their fears. As a result, they keep away from crowded areas, seldom stepping out for any physical activities thus spending a majority of their time indoors. Two of the majors reasons could be addiction to social media and age related problems. Two of the possible solutions are to disconnect from the virtual world and spend some time in the real world along with indulging in some light physical activities.

These days people spend most of their time surfing social media sites and crave validation along with trying to compare their lives with others. If they are lacking certain beauty standard or skills that are portrayed online many go into depression and isolate themselves from the world thus resulting in loneliness. Recently, the trend of body size zero is gaining popularity all over the internet and those aiming to achieve it resort to unhealthy methods such as harmful dieting or extreme exercise routine. People failing to keep up with these trends consider themselves to be failures and sometimes even contemplate suicide as they are unable to keep up with the pressure.


 
An important solution is to restrict the time spent online and meet and interact with more people around. Time limit should to be set for accessing social media and outdoors activities should be given paramount importance. According to a recent study many people felt less depressed and revitalized when they went for a jog or run as the fresh air and boost in blood flow increased their energy. Moreover, participating in outdoor activities helps you meet new people and enables you to share ideas and strategies for the well being of the team.

To conclude, the realms of your life is in your hand and no one can change your life but you! It is never too late to bring about a change in lifestyle and with the right amount of dedication and persistence anything is possible.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The essay effectively addresses the prompt by identifying the reasons for loneliness and lack of physical fitness among the elderly and proposing possible solutions.

prompt: Some experts believe that when a country is already rich, any additional increase in economic wealth does not make its citizens any more satisfied. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Several specialists think that when a nation is already prosperous, an added richness to the economy makes the people not satisfied anymore. This essay disagrees with this point of view.

In the current state of the global economy, wealthy states should never run out of funds for the welfare of the citizens. Therefore, I disagree with the thought that additional wealth will just make people unsatisfied. Moreover, it should always be the goal of rich countries to gain more in order to provide services for their people such as education, health, and entertainment. In the last two years, the whole world was devastated by the pandemic, and no one was spared. In fact, the global economic state was put into perils.

Moreover, many things had happened also in the past and no one can even predict the future. With the updated technologies and increased population, a more prosperous country should continue to invest and collect more financial profits to make the nation stable for the future. Furthermore, it is not to think that richer countries are greedy, but it is the fact that it got resources and backup for their people's needs. Famines, wars, and other pandemics can happen anytime in the future, and countries like the United States is expected to always extend their financial aids to those poorer ones. 

To summarise everything that has been stated so far, it is paramount for the wealthier and prosperous states to continue access to a lot more financial resource because it improves the economic stability of the country in the many more years to come.

prompt: Some people think that climate change could have a negative effect on business. Other people think that climate change could create more business opportunities. Discuss both views give your own opinion
essay:
Climate change is considered one of the most urgent and devastating topics that need an immediate action from everyone, world leaders, experts, and common people to find sustainable solutions.

To begin with, throughout the years, several elements had a negative impact on the environment which contributed to the climate change crisis. Such as the greenhouse effect and waste products. And it is worth mentioning that human beings have the lion's share of this dilemma. However, it is up to us to find the solutions to save our motherland and minimize the damage we have done so far.

Looking closely at climate change and what it holds of unfavourable outcomes for humankind I have to say that I agree that it will badly affect businesses ,especially in the long term. Looking at farms for instance, farmers will face a difficult time in planting seeds due to environmental changes , which, in turn, they will not be able to provide their products to the farmer markets, as a result, both the farmers and the sellers will face financial difficulties. Another example is industrial processes, if we didn't find alternative resources that hold lower negative impacts than today's resources, then, a lot of workers in factories will be at risk of losing their jobs.

 Having said that, I do not think that it will create more job opportunities. I can understand that some people think of this idea as a good opportunity but I think they only are looking at the short term.

To sum up, continuing on the same path as today will, eventually, result in business difficulties, thus putting workers and employers at risk of losing their jobs.

prompt: Some people think the main purpose of schools is to turn children into good citizens and workers, rather than to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
People have contrasting views about what would be the ultimate goal of an educational institution. While some people opine that school should prepare their pupils as a productive member of society, I think they also should help these children to grow as a person meanwhile.

Firstly, preparing children for employment will ensure their livelihood. If youngsters are provided market-based lectures & environments on their campus, it will create their base for professional life. Consequently, they will be competent by gaining the required knowledge and skills for being recruited by companies or start entrepreneurship. Thus, getting ready for future jobs at an early age helps the children to grasp opportunities in the future and earn their bread and butter. For example, in Bangladesh, the employment rate is 30% higher for the candidates who had graduated from the vocational training centre compared to general.

However, developing children's personality will make them a happy person. An individual may be very successful in life by having a progressive career, yet he may be unhappy and depressed for other internal concerns. Therefore, it is necessary to focus on child cognitive development and improvement of their interpersonal skill so that they could be able to make effective communication, differentiate right and wrong & tackle difficulties. As these young people spend a long time in school, soft skills would be effectively inculcated by them if they are being taught these in the classroom. For instance, punctuality and discipline, two vital qualities a pupil learn from their classroom, which benefits them life-long.

In conclusion, whether making students for future occupations or better characteristics should be the main target of an educational institution is a controversial issue. I think both should be the purpose of a teaching centre for building a complete personality.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The essay addresses the given task by presenting both sides of the argument, with a clear stance indicating partial agreement with the idea of schools benefiting individuals.
- Ideas are presented in a relevant and coherent manner, adequately covering the aspects of social and individual development.

prompt: Whether or not someone achieve their aims is mostly by a question of luck. To what  extent do you agree or disagree
essay: Many people claim that luck is the most crucial element contributing to a person's  success. While I accept that luck does have an important role in helping people reach  their targets, I would argue that hard work and determination are much more crucial  factors leading to the achievement of an individual.  On the one hand, I agree that luck can be an important factor. First, some people are  fortunate enough to be born in a wealthy family, which allows them to have better  education or to easily start their own business without having to borrow money from  someone else. As a result, these people tend to have better opportunities to succeed  than those coming from poor families. Furthermore, some individuals are lucky to be  given great talents which others do not have. For example, Mozart was able to play  music when he was very young, or Lionel Messi already had great football skills when  he was born.  However, I would argue that although luck can be necessary, it is not the most crucial  a factor leading to success. Firstly, people need to work really hard and put much effort  into their jobs if they want to be successful. For instance, before becoming one of the  best football players in the world, Cristiano Ronaldo had to go through intense training  hours every day for many years. Secondly, a person is less likely to reach his targets if  he does not have determination. On the way leading to success, there might be many  difficulties, and people need to keep moving forward to overcome those challenges.  In conclusion, while I agree that luck is important to some extent in helping people  become successful, I believe that hard work and determination are the most important  elements

prompt: It is important for all towns and cities to have large public spaces such as squares and parks. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay:
People have different views about the open areas such as squares and parks play a vital role in towns and cities. This essay will shed some light on why I am on the same page with those who support to this statement.

There are two reasons why it could be argued that public grounds should not be considered as the heart of the cities. The prominent reason is that the number of people migrate to cities increases remarkably due to overpopulation, so these metropolitans do not have available spaces to construct parks or squares. Hong Kong, where inhabitants even do not possess enough places for establishing accommodation, can be taken as an object lesson. Besides, the national authorities should expend the budget on other prospects such as healthcare, education and transportation systems instead of open spaces. 

Although the drawbacks of huge spaces are inevitable, their advantages are more significant. Firstly, public places are the ideal places for local citizens improving their well-being and lifting up their spirit. Particularly, residents tend to have stroll around these places to release stressful things after their hectic daily schedules, which can do wonder for them to recharge the battery. Secondly, the deterioration of air quality becomes an alarming trend in cities, so green regions such as parks are able to contribute to the environmental protection by diminishing the amount of greenhouse gases. Moreover, squares also preserve historical value that boosts the tourism industry through attracting visitors flock into this area annually. 

In conclusion, I personally support that public places brings more benefits for people and eco-systems that outweigh their demerits.

- The essay covers all aspects of the task, discussing both the advantages and disadvantages of large public spaces in towns and cities.

prompt:

What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?

Nowadays, the preferences of many people are increasing constantly regarding the historical background of their residence. This essay will explain  the causes and the method that they use searching in the following paragraphs.

There are two reasons for this phenomenon. First of all, they believe in faith in terms of religion. Most groups in Thailand are always interested in the places for avoiding the bad situation that goes against the traditional belief. For example, the position of the spirit house is the important rule of the building particularly in Buddhism, they will not be able to relocate automatically. Secondly, they are aware of the safety of their place. A few places might be established for a while and have not ever had any maintenance. As a result, they can perceive that information and find better materials or equipment to fix it as soon as possible.

There are many methods of discovering historical backgrounds. The primary one is questioning the neighbours. In many cases, these people have known the root information because they have been living there for a long time. Furthermore, they are able to examine the public record including the blueprint of the structure and the person who is the latest owner from the supervisor directly. These data can be  reliable and clear evidence to understand the related history. In other words, they could search by resources such as on the internet or  the library. This method will help them to know wider information in a limited time.

In conclusion, humans want to know the background of their living because of some belief to do the appropriate management and security through asking the people in the neighbourhood and checking from trustworthy resources

prompt:
"The shortage of housing in big cities can cause severe consequences. Only government action can solve this problem.
 
To what extent do you agree or disagree?"
essay:
With urbanisation, the population in cities is growing fast and so is the housing crisis, which brings along many other problems. Some argue that only government is the appropriate authority to deal with this rising problem. I strongly agree with this argument as governments can solve this growing issue by various steps, such as restricting new landed residential housing by encouraging vertical apartment buildings and gradually expanding cities.

First and foremost, the government is the right party to resolve this housing crisis issue by discouraging the building of new landed houses and encouraging vertical multi-storey apartment living with proper planning and infrastructure to deal with this space crunch. For example, Singapore and Hong Kong are cities on islands and they have proven to solve this crisis for their citizens by vertically building thousands of high-floor flats. These cities have proved to incorporate the best infrastructure for their ever-growing population by building multi-story apartments rather than new houses, which has resulted in economically affordable housing for their citizens in big cities. Further, to help the situation, the government can extend highways to help commuters access the cities in a country easily. This high level of planning can only be done by the government to help solve accommodation shortages for their citizenry.

Secondly, the government can help this situation by expanding cities and creating more residential properties on the outskirts of cities. In Noida, for instance, a fast-growing city in India, the housing development board has continuously helped accommodate the growing population by building more residential properties on the outskirts of the city which eventually became part of it and built metros and highways for commuters to make it easily accessible. Hence, this helped in controlling growing cramping and accommodation problems for their locals. 

In conclusion, it is clear that the government has a big role to play as an ultimate authority by taking appropriate measures to create highly planned inner-by city development and well-designed infrastructure to accommodate the growing needs of their citizens.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
The candidate has adequately addressed the task prompt by providing a clear stance on the role of government in solving the housing shortage issue in big cities. The essay covers all aspects of the task, providing relevant arguments and evidence to support the claim.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 8

### Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay is well-organized with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are smooth, using appropriate connecting words and phrases. The logical flow of ideas is maintained throughout the essay.

prompt: Some people say that playing computer games is bad for children in every aspect. Others say that playing computer games can have positive effects on the way children develop. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Our era has witnessed the explosive development of technology, and with it, the development of computer games. Gaming has become more popular among children and has become a widely debated topic. While many people state that games have negative effects on kids, others argue that there are some merits in playing video games. In the following essay, I would discuss both views of the argument and give my opinion. 

First of all, playing video games could have some downside effects and could be bad for a child’s evolution. One of those is video games containing violent scenes, which are usually seen in adventure and action games. An example of this is God of war, a game set in Greek and Norse mythology where the players use their characters to fight with gods and demons. In this game, blood is not censored and there are several cut scenes where the character’s entrail is ripped out and so on. These violent scenes could badly affect kids, as they could potentially apply the actions contained in the games to real life. Spending too much time on computer games could also create a distraction from important things in the daily life of juveniles. Children who spend too much time playing games could be distracted from studying or have their sleeping schedule messed up, thus reducing their academic performance. 

On the other hand, gaming could benefit some aspects of the development process of a child, as it improves not only critical thinking skills but also teamwork skills. Critical thinking skills could be improved through playing strategy games. For instance, when playing Age of Empires, children have to judge the strength and weaknesses of the civilization they choose, and diverse unique strategies to counter enemies and protect their base from being raided. Gaming also provides a chance to improve teamwork skills, which is an extremely valuable skill in daily life, among children. Games such as League of Legends and DOTA could be perfect examples of this, as players have to cooperate with others to defeat enemy teams and destroy their nexus. Spending time playing games could also strengthen problem-solving skills, as it would teach children to be decisive in crucial moments and create concentration power among children.

In conclusion, gaming has its own advantages and disadvantages, but the positive effects outweigh the negative effects, since playing video games helps juveniles improve their critical thinking, problem-solving and teamwork skills. But the amount of time that children spend on gaming should be limited and this process should be strictly supervised by parents to ensure kids stay away from violence and other negative effects.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement: 7.5
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task and presented a clear and coherent response.

prompt: The best way to solve the world's environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is prevalent for people to opine that increasing fuel prices for vehicles is the best way to address environmental issues. While, this school of thought is valid to some extent based on reducing the number of vehicles and alleviating the exploitation of fossil fuel, I am of the opinion that there are several ways to solve environmental problems besides that measure related to rules and public awareness. 

There are a variety of compelling reasons why higher fuel costs can deal with environmental problems. Firstly, this method may decrease fuel vehicle usage and ownership. If the price of fuel, which is needed for cars to activate, people tend to swift to transportation that requires less fuel such as buses or bicycles. In 2022, many surveys have indicated that since the cost of fuel peaked after 20 years due to the war, the rate of people taking public transportation and riding bicycles increased. Secondly, higher fuel charges might lessen the exploitation. When rising the fuel price, many companies lost their interest in  investing in the process of utilizing fossil fuel. Therefore, fewer and fewer minerals may be made use of and also devoted to preserving the variety of the world's minerals. 

Despite the aforementioned benefits, I believe that some other measures can be adopted to address ecological issues. One primary approach is  raising public awareness. Government can organise presentations and events to tell the community what problems can result from deteriorating environment. Protecting the environment is not only a duty of administrations but also the public as a whole. Moreover, authorities can impose regulations to improve waste treatment and reduce pollution. They can expand the landfills and waste disposal of factories and civilizations, hence several types of pollution such as air and water are eased. 

In conclusion, while some claim that a higher fuel fee is the ideal method to solve ecological problems based on lessening  fossil fuel usage and exploitation, it seems to me that other measures can be utilized such as  increasing societal consciousness and implementing rules to limit pollution.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
The essay adequately addresses the given task. The candidate presents a clear position and provides supporting arguments for their stance. All aspects of the task are covered, including the benefits of increasing fuel costs for environmental problem-solving and alternative approaches that can be considered. The essay fulfills the requirements of the task and demonstrates a good understanding of the topic.

There are no major vocabulary mistakes or inaccuracies. **Modified Versions:**

- "They can expand the landfills and waste disposal of factories and civilizations, hence several types of pollution such as air and water are eased." -> "They can expand landfills and improve waste disposal systems in factories and communities, thereby reducing various types of pollution, such as air and water pollution."
