prompt:
Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate.
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
There has been much discussion revolving around the issue of whether museums are places to spend your leisure time or the main purpose is education. In this essay I am going to present both views and give my opinion. 

Some people tend to think that the most important thing of the museums is to let everyone relax and enjoy, because it will let them overcome stress. One of the first things we need to take into consideration is that modern society have enough pressure in everyday life and information flow in erroneous, it all can even lead to depression, that’s why visiting cultural places like that may help to deal with it. For example, by looking at historical artifacts or art pieces person can abstract and forget about worries, it helps to rest and generate new powers to prevent emotional burnout. 

However, others insist that cultural institutions need to be visited, because of the importance of being educated. Modern technology is taking place over the world and people tend to spend their free time online rather than visiting museums, it mostly affects teenagers that’s why majority of them aren’t versed in history and art. Some people are afraid that growing generation will have nothing to tell their descendants due to the lack of education in culture.

Having considered both views, I am convinced that each statement is right and in my opinion it would be more useful if they were connected together. By doing that, it would be beneficial from the side of education and entertainment.

Providing affordable healthcare and education that can improve the quality of life is a priority for authorities. A country could invest money to offer health services that meet quality criteria. For instance, senior medical staff spends extra money to improve the quality of care and patient safety by reducing maternity and newborns mortality caused due to inadequate medication or unhygienic infrastructure. Administration in educational institutions consumes money to make it more accessible to a well-developed education system. That is to say, preparing a structured curriculum and hiring professional teachers contribute mainly to graduate skilled alumni for decent job opportunities. Thus, quality national health coverage and education boost public health and employability.


However, education and health are not more crucial than the arts. Art illustrates great importance in self-expression and fulfillment. In other words, art is the same as the language in describing imagination and ideas. Painting, sculpture, music, and literature are mediums that an artist chooses for his craft to convert his feelings and thoughts into tangible objects people can see and touch. Moreover, art is a form of presenting culture. When tourists visualize paintings made in caves and rocks by ancient people, they can develop a deeper understanding of ancestors' lifestyle and language evolution throughout time and space. It is; therefore, communication and culture are just two forms of art.

prompt: In some cities people are choosing cars instead of bicycles, while in other cities riding bikes is replacing cars. why is this the case? which development do you think this better?
essay:
In this contemporary era, people's preference over transportation is changing day by day. As a result, in some cities, they prefer bicycles to cars. While in other places, this trend is just the opposite. In my opinion, the former way is better than the latter. This essay shall discuss the reasons for this changing trend. 

On the one hand, the world as a global village is aware of the rising pollution level and the majority are concerned about its impact on the environment. This concern plays a major role when it comes to choosing bicycles instead of cars. For example, recent studies conducted in the USA has shown an increase in bicycle usage by 10% compared to last year. However, this change in attitude is mainly seen in developed countries as the majority of the population is literate and can easily acknowledge the future consequences of pollution. 

In addition to the above, nowadays everyone is concerned about their well-being and riding a bicycle is a proven way to improve and maintain physical fitness. Moreover, it gives them a choice to choose between health and comfort . For instance, those who choose fitness over convenience is proven to have  better health of the heart and even the Canadian president commute to his office using a bicycle. Even though only a few  are properly  following the trend. 

On the other hand, people choose their comfort over health and the environment by prioritising car as a mode of transport. Consequently, the traffic blocks increase along with air and noise pollution. For example, the level of carbon monoxide in Delhi is higher than in any other place in India as a result of plummed usage of private vehicles. Although it provides greater convenience , the damage it does to the environment is immeasurable. 

To conclude, I reiterate that, it's better to choose a pollution-free mode of transport like bicycles to provide a better tomorrow for the future generation. This can only be achieved through raising constant awareness among the public.

prompt: Most of the urgent problems can only be solved with international cooperation. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is true that some people believe that cross-national cooperation is the only measure that can be tackled the majority of the emergent issues. While I accept that this may suit many people, I believe that not all of acute problems can be coped with international organizations.
	On the one hand, it is widely agreed that many issues have reached a global level and only through the cooperation of a wide range of countries can be addressed. Firstly, global warming is an increasing concern for human around the world. For example, the famous Kyoto Protocol is the result of international cooperation, which has been implemented for many years in an attempt to reduce the emission of greenhouse gas. Secondly, our world is facing to lots of terrorism, there are many murders and bombing which need worldwide support and assistance. For instance, multi-national cooperation need to tackled terrorist acts from the Islamic State (IS), which has taken the lives of many innocent people in the world.
	On the other hand, most of alarming problems can solely be coped with the local authorities. First, education, health and poverty can only be solved by their own governments. In particular, the global support’s aid is temporary, therefore the governments have to implement the good policies to develop their countries, give poor people chance to improve their standard of living. Furthermore, corruption is the urgent issues that can only be deal with the independent development and reform of individual countries. The international organization has no authority to inquiry a country’s government, which can only be prevented by the local residents and officials.
	In conclusion, while cross-national organization is an effective way in dealing with many of acute problems, it seems to me that there are also a large number of urgent issues that require the domestic resolution and action instead of a global support.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:** 

- **Strengths:** 
    - The essay acknowledges the significance of international cooperation in addressing urgent global issues.
    - It provides relevant examples to support the argument, such as the Kyoto Protocol and the fight against terrorism.
    - The writer attempts to consider both sides of the argument by acknowledging that some problems may be better solved locally.

- **Weaknesses:**  
    - The essay fails to adequately address the prompt's question by not providing a clear stance on whether international cooperation is the only solution to most urgent problems.
    - The writer's position is not clearly stated and lacks focus, making it difficult for the reader to follow the argument.
    - The essay's structure and organization are weak, with ideas presented in a somewhat disjointed manner.

- **Suggested Band Score:** 5

**Coherence and Cohesion:** 

- **Strengths:** 
    - The essay uses transitional words and phrases to connect sentences and paragraphs, maintaining a somewhat logical flow.
    - The writer attempts to organize the essay into distinct paragraphs, each addressing a different aspect of the topic.

- **Weaknesses:** 
    - The transitions between paragraphs are not always smooth, and the essay lacks a clear structure and progression of ideas.
    - The writer relies heavily on repetition of certain phrases, such as "urgent problems" and "international cooperation," which can be monotonous and detract from the clarity of the writing.

- **Strengths:** 
    - The essay uses a range of vocabulary, including some complex and sophisticated words such as "emergent," "tackled," and "terrorism."
    - The writer demonstrates an understanding of the topic and uses relevant vocabulary related to global issues.

- **Weaknesses:**  
    - There are some errors in vocabulary usage, such as "coped with" instead of "addressed" and "lots of terrorism" instead of "numerous acts of terrorism."

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy:**

    - The writer demonstrates a good understanding of basic grammar rules.

- **Weaknesses:** 
   - There are some grammatical errors, such as "It is true that some people believe" (should be "Some people believe") and "there are many murders and bombing" (should be "there are many acts of murder and bombing").
    - The essay lacks variety in sentence structure, with most sentences following a simple subject-verb-object pattern.

- **Suggested Band Score:** 5.5

**Overall Band Score:** 5.5

- The essay demonstrates a fair attempt to address the topic, but it lacks a clear stance and focus. The writer should strive to develop a more coherent argument and provide stronger evidence to support their position.
- The essay could benefit from a more logical structure and better transitions between paragraphs. The writer should consider using a variety of sentence structures to make the writing more engaging.

prompt:
More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. Why?

Do advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?
essay:
Nowadays it seems to be a common trend that people decide to get children at a later age than in the past. But is this advantageous?

Previously women mainly had two duties; childbirth and raising offspring. They were wed at early ages and gave birth usually before becoming sixteen years old. In those days it was very advantageous. Most of the population didn’t get that old due to undeveloped medicine and the chance that the child grew up healthy was small. So the more offspring you had, the more they could provide for you later. However, all these things aren’t problems anymore in today’s society. People grow older, we have health care, pensions and kids don’t die as often.

Right now people seem to be more focused on themselves and their careers. This can be very advantageous since they are able to provide for their children so they e.g. are able to go to college. Furthermore, it helps them define more who they are and what they want in life. I have acquaintances who had kids before they were 20 and the child seemed to get in the way of their own life sometimes. They still want to travel, see the world and discover new cultures, which is harder when you have a child both from a financial and practical aspect.

Nevertheless, there are also disadvantages when people get pregnant later in life. The main problem is the health issues for females in labour. After 30 years old their bodies become less capable of giving birth and the chance of complications gets higher.

In conclusion, I think for our society nowadays it is more advantageous to have children at a later age. Our society has changed a lot and has laid the focus first on themselves.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement: 6.5**

The candidate has adequately addressed the task by providing a clear response to the prompt. They have identified two main reasons for people having children at a later age and discussed both the advantages and disadvantages. However, the response lacks depth and could have provided more specific examples and evidence to support the arguments.

**Coherence and Cohesion: 6.5**

The essay is generally well-organized and the ideas flow logically. However, there are some instances where the transitions could be smoother and the use of connecting words and phrases could be more effective. Additionally, the essay could benefit from a stronger introduction and conclusion that more effectively summarize the main points.

**Lexical Resource: 6.5**

The essay demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, but there are some instances where the words are not used accurately or in the most appropriate context. For example, the candidate uses the phrase "get in the way" to describe the impact of having a child on a parent's life, which is informal and not entirely appropriate for the academic context.

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy: 6.5**

The essay is generally grammatically accurate, but there are a few minor errors. For example, the candidate uses the phrase "the child seemed to get in the way of their own life sometimes," which is not grammatically correct. The sentence could be rephrased as "the child seemed to interfere with their own life sometimes."

**Overall Band Score: 6.5**

Overall, the essay meets the requirements of the task and demonstrates a good level of English proficiency. However, there are some areas where the essay could be improved, particularly in terms of depth of analysis, coherence, and accuracy of language use. With further practice and refinement, the candidate could achieve a higher band score.

**Feedback and Additional Comments:**

**Strengths:**

* Clear and concise response to the prompt
* Good organization and logical flow of ideas
* Use of a variety of sentence structures

**Areas for Improvement:**

* Provide more specific examples and evidence to support arguments
* Use more precise and appropriate vocabulary
* Improve grammatical accuracy in some areas
* Strengthen the introduction and conclusion to provide a more effective summary of the main points

prompt: Young people who commit crimes should be treated in the same way as adults who commit crimes. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some people argue that criminals that are minor should undergo the same treatment as adult criminals and, this essay shares the same opinion with their argument.

To begin with, there are some negative points in that argument. First and foremost, underage criminals might not fully understand the consequences of their crimes. To be specific, it is wrong to commit a crime in the first place but, there is a big difference between people committing a crime despite fully understanding the impact of crime and who do not. Underage criminals, considering their immature nature, are more likely, in the latter group. Moreover, It can be harsher punishment compared to adult criminals. To elaborate, younger criminals have more days to live after the punishment and, it would be difficult for them to be employed considering their formal convict status.

However, there are also some positive points to the argument. Firstly, the age of criminals does not change the severity of crimes. There is a reason for the Justice system installed a statue with a blindfold. It represents the just system should be fair and equal. Secondly, it can be unfair to the victims of the crime. For instance, there would be a situation where people who lost their family member to a minor might have to watch the convict gets away with relatively weak punishment.

In conclusion, there are some positives and negatives to the statement. Nevertheless, this essay argued that because of the fact that justice needs to be fair to all, youger criminals should be treated in the same way as adult criminals.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
The candidate has addressed the given task by expressing their agreement with the statement that young criminals should be treated equally to adult criminals. They have provided some points in support of their stance, but they have not fully covered all aspects of the task. For example, they have not discussed the potential impact on rehabilitation or the role of parental responsibility.

Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 6

### Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay is generally well-organized, with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. However, the ideas within the body paragraphs are not always well-connected, and the transitions between paragraphs could be smoother.

Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 6

### Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
The candidate's vocabulary is generally appropriate for the task and context. However, there are some instances where the vocabulary is not used accurately or effectively. For example, the candidate uses the word "harsher" incorrectly in the second paragraph.

```
Moreover, It can be harsher punishment compared to adult criminals.
```

A more appropriate word choice would be "more severe".

Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 6.5

### Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
The candidate's grammar is generally accurate, but there are some minor errors. For example, the candidate uses the incorrect verb tense in the following sentence:

```
It can be unfair to the victims of the crime.
```

The correct verb tense should be "would be".

Suggested Band Score (Grammatical Range and Accuracy): 6.5

### Overall Band Score:
Considering the essay's performance across all criteria, the suggested overall band score is 6.5.

### Feedback and Additional Comments:

**Strengths:**

* The essay is well-organized and generally clear.
* The candidate provides some valid points to support their stance.

**Areas for Improvement:**

* The candidate could provide a more comprehensive response by addressing all aspects of the task.
* The candidate could improve their use of transitions to make the flow of ideas smoother.
* The candidate could improve their vocabulary by using words more accurately and effectively.

prompt:
Some people think the best way to solve global environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Global warming is certainly the problem of the new millennium. The Major cause for this is the overuse of fossil fuels. The natural sources under the Earth's surface are used in various ways. However, the main demand is for the production of plastics and for vehicles. One of the suggested solution is the rise in the cost of this material. Although this could lower the consumption, I believe that this would not confront the current problem.
The usage of fuels created water and air pollution. Gas is commonly used in cars, which significantly increased the contamination of the air. Boats are major problem for water pollution, as they realise an enormous amount of oil into the ocean. Above that most of the plastics ends in the sea, endangering animals' lives. Rising the cost of fuels might lower the usage, but not prevent the global warming. Higher prices would not stop industries from trading and producing plastic materials. It would rather create greater monopoly and increase the gap between the rich and the poor. 
To solve the environmental issue, in my opinion, more attention should be pointed towards renewable resources. Lowering the costs in the latter would increase the usage of it even among the middle and the low-rank. Taking electric cars as an example, that do not realise any toxic gases, making them affordable would help reducing the air pollution. In addition, the government of each country should create standards for natural, renewable resources, defying how much renewable energy must be created per year.
In conclusion, the global warming is a huge issue, that must be confronted. Since the major cause for it is the high demand for fossil fuels, many believe that with the increase in costs would reduce the problem. I believe this is not the case and to truly solve the problem the renewable energy should become more affordable.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task and provided a clear stance on the issue.
- The essay presents relevant ideas and supports them with appropriate arguments.
- All aspects of the task have been covered, including the extent of agreement or disagreement with the prompt.
- The candidate has fulfilled the requirements of the task by providing a well-rounded response.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 7

## Coherence and Cohesion:
- The essay is well-organized and flows smoothly from one paragraph to the next.
- Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are clear and logical.
- Connecting words and phrases are used effectively to maintain a smooth progression of ideas.
- The overall structure of the essay is coherent and well-developed.
- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 7

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The candidate has used a range of vocabulary throughout the essay.

- The vocabulary used is generally appropriate for the context.
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 6.5

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
- The essay demonstrates a good range of sentence structures, including complex and compound sentences.
- Some grammatical errors have been identified:

prompt: Some people think that the main purpose of schools is to turn children into good citizens and workers, rather to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The role of schools in shaping individuals and citizens is a subject of debate. While some prioritize molding good citizens and workers, a balanced approach must also prioritize empowering students as unique individuals.

  Schools have a crucial responsibility in fostering good citizens. Through subjects like history and civics, students learn about social responsibility, diversity, and global issues. This cultivates a sense of civic duty, equipping them to become active participants in society. However, solely focusing on this aspect can neglect the diverse needs and aspirations of students.

  Simultaneously, schools must prioritize the development of individuals. Nurturing creativity, critical thinking, and emotional intelligence empowers students to excel in various fields and make unique contributions to society. Extracurricular activities, arts, and personalized learning approaches can help discover their passions and talents, fostering self-confidence.

  In conclusion, schools should strike a delicate balance between nurturing individuals and fostering good citizens. By empowering students as unique individuals, they can create a generation of proactive, empathetic citizens who contribute positively to society, thus achieving the dual purpose of education.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The essay effectively addresses the task by discussing both the role of schools in fostering good citizens and benefiting students as individuals.
- The ideas presented are clear, relevant, and coherent, addressing all aspects of the task.
- The candidate adequately supports arguments with examples of civic education and individual development opportunities.
- However, the essay could benefit from a more explicit statement of the candidate's stance on the issue.
- Suggested Band Score: 5

**Coherence and Cohesion:**

- The essay is well-organized and structured, with clear transitions between sentences and paragraphs.
- Connecting words and phrases effectively maintain a smooth progression of ideas.
- The logical sequence of information is easy to follow, with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.
- Overall, the essay demonstrates strong coherence and cohesion.
- Suggested Band Score: 5

**Lexical Resource:**

- The essay displays a good range of vocabulary, using appropriate terms to convey ideas.
- However, there are a few instances of repetitive or imprecise vocabulary choices. For example, "empower" is used twice in the first paragraph.
- The candidate could benefit from using more varied and specific vocabulary to enhance their writing.
- Suggested Band Score: 3

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy:**

- The essay exhibits a good variety of sentence structures, including complex sentences and compound sentences.
- There are some minor grammatical errors, such as "student" should be "students" in the first sentence.
- The candidate should carefully proofread their work to eliminate any errors in grammar or sentence formation.
- Suggested Band Score: 4

**Overall Band Score:**

- Considering the essay's overall performance across all criteria, a suggested overall band score would be **4**.
- The essay effectively addresses the task, demonstrates coherence and cohesion, and exhibits a good range of vocabulary.
- However, there is room for improvement in terms of using more precise vocabulary and eliminating grammatical errors.

**Feedback and Additional Comments:**

- The essay provides a balanced perspective on the role of schools in fostering both good citizens and individuals.
- To enhance their writing, the candidate should focus on expanding their vocabulary and eliminating grammatical errors.
- Additionally, providing specific examples or evidence to support their arguments would further strengthen the essay's credibility.

prompt: NOWADAYS, MORE AND MORE PEOPLE DECIDE TO HAVE CHILDREN  IN THEIR OLDER AGE. WHAT ARE THE REASONS? DO THE ADVANTAGES OF THIS OUTWEIGH DISADVANTAGES?
essay:
In the current era, Many individuals are prone to give birth in their older age for various reasons. Personally, If individuals are at an appropriate age to have a baby, negative outcomes would outweigh the advantages.

Firstly, The main reason for having a baby in an old life in the developed world is in order to provide job security and gain a better lifestyle by generating a bunch of income. Moreover, giving childbirth at a young age not only provides a number of responsibilities to them but also reduces the freedom, which allows them to hang out with their comrades and family. For instance, from the medical surveys, 80% of mothers in an elderly life spend most of their time on hectic work due to lack of income.   

However, common abnormalities of childbirth such as Down syndrome, heart problems and other issues as a result of lower nutrition in pregnancy brings the most horrible effect which affects both mother's and offsprings' lifestyle in the short-term and long-term. Furthermore, the ability to take care of offspring at that life significantly decreases as they are too old to carry their offspring and play with them. Most medical research shows that a large number of abnormal children mostly happened in this phenomenon and mothers experienced losing childbirth before giving birth as physical issues. 

 In conclusion, Although generating income is a vital reason for some communities, people should be more concerned about this since disadvantages affect either mother or children, which leads to physical and mental issues after give-birth.
evaluation:

The candidate has partially addressed the task by discussing the reasons why people choose to have children at an older age. The response lacks a clear structure and fails to provide a balanced perspective on the issue.

The essay contains numerous grammatical errors, including incorrect verb tenses, subject-verb agreement, and sentence structure. The response lacks grammatical complexity and accuracy, making it difficult to read and understand.

Suggested Band Score: 5

Based on the evaluation of the four criteria, the overall band score for this essay is **5**. The essay partially addresses the task, lacks coherence and cohesion, has limited vocabulary and accuracy, and contains numerous grammatical errors.

**Feedback and Additional Comments:**

The candidate needs to improve their ability to fulfill the requirements of the task and provide a balanced perspective on the issue. They should also focus on improving their vocabulary and grammatical range and accuracy. The essay would benefit from a clearer structure, smoother transitions, and more varied and precise language.

prompt:
Some people believe that robots will play an important role in future societies, while others argue that robots might have negative effects on society.

Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
A school of thought has a perception that all the jobs will be done by robots in the future. In my opinion, however, the speculation is not completely true. Although the major laborious work shall be done by robots, the jobs where human intelligence and human skills are required can never be replaced by machines. This essay will discuss why not all jobs can be done with artificial intelligence.
Although, many companies are going to make systems automated, and buying most efficient and smart machines to get the jobs done to eradicate human errors. In England, for example, almost all security guards have been replaced by hi-tech security systems. Moreover, almost in all over the world, conventional banking systems have been upgraded and ATMs have been installed for cash deposit and withdrawal, the major benefit of ATMs is that they serve their purpose twenty-four hours, seven days a week without breaks. Therefore, due to the clear advantages of artificial intelligence and foreseeable accuracy and efficiency, many jobs will be taken by machines from humans in the future. 
As per my speculations, a variety of jobs will still be done by humans only, because it is impossible to completely vanish humans to develop the world. Jobs like teaching, research work, engineering, and architectural planning are just a few examples of jobs which cannot be performed by machines. For instance, the machines work on predefined algorithms installed in it, therefore, a machine can never perform a task which is not defined in its algorithm. This limitation simply indicates that a robot is made to perform a certain task and cannot play smartly if needed to perform some out of the scope job.
At last, although many of the jobs where not much pondering is required will be done by robots. This will be economical for companies, and humans will be safe to do physically hard work. On the other hand, however, certain jobs can never be done by machines and humans will always supersede machines to be on the dominant point. Humans will be driving machines and will use it for their own sake.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:

The candidate has adequately addressed the given task. They have identified both views on the role of robots in future societies and have provided relevant arguments and evidence to support their own opinion. However, they could have explored the opposing view in more depth and provided more specific examples to support their claims.

Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): **6.0**

### Coherence and Cohesion:

The essay is generally well-organized and easy to follow. The candidate uses clear transitions between sentences and paragraphs, and the ideas flow logically from one to another. However, there are some instances where the writing could be more concise and the structure could be improved.

Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): **6.0**

### Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):

The candidate demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, but there are some inaccuracies and overuse of certain words. For example, the candidate uses the word "speculation" incorrectly in the first paragraph and the word "eradicate" incorrectly in the second paragraph. Additionally, the candidate overuses the word "however" throughout the essay.

Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): **6.0**

### Grammatical Range and Accuracy:

The candidate demonstrates a good range of grammatical structures, but there are some errors in sentence construction and punctuation. For example, in the second paragraph, the sentence "Moreover, almost in all over the world, conventional banking systems have been upgraded and ATMs have been installed for cash deposit and withdrawal, the major benefit of ATMs is that they serve their purpose twenty-four hours, seven days a week without breaks" is grammatically incorrect.

Suggested Band Score (Grammatical Range and Accuracy): **5.5**

### Overall Band Score:

Considering the synergy of the essay in meeting the task requirements cohesively, the suggested overall band score is **6.0**.

### Feedback and Additional Comments:

**Strengths:**

- The essay is well-organized and easy to follow.
- The candidate demonstrates a good range of vocabulary.
- The candidate provides relevant arguments and evidence to support their claims.

**Areas for Improvement:**

- The candidate could explore the opposing view in more depth and provide more specific examples to support their claims.
- The candidate could revise the essay to improve conciseness and structure.
- The candidate should proofread the essay carefully to identify and correct errors in vocabulary, grammar, and punctuation.

**Strategies for Enhancement:**

- To improve the depth of their analysis, the candidate should consider researching different perspectives on the topic and exploring the potential implications of robots playing a greater role in society.
- To enhance the coherence of their writing, the candidate should practice writing clear and concise sentences and paragraphs, and using appropriate transitions to connect ideas.
- To improve their accuracy in vocabulary and grammar, the candidate should regularly review grammar rules and practice using new vocabulary in context.

prompt: Some experts believe that when a country is already rich, any additional increase in economic wealth does not make its citizens any more satisfied. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
A significant number of researchers negate the reciprocal relationship between the affluence of a nation and the satisfaction of citizens in that country. However, this topic has become a controversial issue, and I think that this opinion is completely unreasonable. I will explain my viewpoint in the following paragraphs. 

On the first hand, supporters of this opinion have their rational grounds. Firstly, a state is increasingly prosperous, resulting in the cost which its civilians have to pay for living. In fact, the government of Korea, which has the leading economic development rate in the world, is extremely concerned about the surge of slums in the center of Seoul. The residents of this low-income neighbourhood said that they are unable to afford the consistent growth of the expenditure for basic needs, namely food and shelter. Therefore, they must opt for a shabby home in order to save money.  Secondly, the thriving of a nation is not the only measure of one’s satisfaction. To be specific, there are countless factors to take into account such as well-being, and the care of surrounding people, and each individual has diverse measurements of his happiness. In particular, many children of wealthy families committed suicide due to the lack of freedom and the care of their parents.  

On the other hand, the above arguments are insufficient to overshadow the pitfalls of this issue. First and foremost, while the affluent of a nation is not the only element that leads to satisfaction, it still plays an important role in it. In rich countries, economic growth can improve the quality of life through better public services or social welfare. That is why developed countries, including America and England, are always the dream living locations of most individuals around the world. Besides, despite the increased cost of living, residents in thriving nations fully enjoy modern public resources such as schools. Therefore, their offspring will have access to advanced educational programs, which are better than most other nations. 

In conclusion, this opinion of some experts is plausible because of the inaccurate measurement method and negative consequences of economic development such as the elevation of the cost of living. However, the indisputable benefits of prosperous nations offset the stated arguments.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by presenting a clear stance on the issue and supporting it with relevant arguments.
- The ideas presented are coherent and well-organized, covering all aspects of the task.
- However, the essay lacks a clear introduction and conclusion, which could have strengthened the overall response.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 6.5

- The logical sequence of information is clear, with paragraphs building upon each other effectively.

- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 6.5

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The candidate demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, including some complex and precise terms.
- However, there are occasional inaccuracies in vocabulary usage, such as "slums" instead of "low-income neighborhoods."
- The essay could benefit from more varied and sophisticated vocabulary throughout.
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 6.0

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
- The essay exhibits a good variety of sentence structures, demonstrating a range of grammatical knowledge.
- However, there are some grammatical errors, such as "The residents of this low-income neighbourhood said that they are unable to afford the consistent growth of the expenditure for basic needs" and "Therefore, they must opt for a shabby home in order to save money."
- The use of punctuation and sentence formation could be improved for greater clarity.
- Suggested Band Score (Grammatical Range and Accuracy): 6.0

## Overall Band Score:

prompt: Some people think that robots are very important to human’s future development. Others think that they are dangerous and have negative effects on society. Discuss both opinions and give your personal view.
essay:
In this modern era, various technologies have been developed which plays a significant role in humans life. Few individuals of society asserted that robots are imperative for the further growth of people whereas, another part of the nation racked that such machines create a number of detrimental effects on human's lives as well as on society. This essay intends to discuss both the ideology followed by my opinion and the reasons for my perspective will be elucidated in the forthcoming paragraphs with the relevant illustration.

To commence with, there are numerous advantages of robots which helps people in their future growth. First and foremost, robots work efficiently and quickly. To explicate, man made machine complete their task accurately without any interruption within a short period of time. As a result, it takes less time to execute the process. For instance, human being can work for 8 to 10 hours more effectively on the other hand robots can work full day perfectly. Hence, such technology can produce more products than employees. Therefore, it can be seen from the above point that it has various advantages which can help in the future development of the person. 

On the other hand, this technology has few repercussions due to which some part of society does not favour this notion. Firstly, it creates unemployment in the nation. To explain, when human will be replaced by robots then the opportunity for the job will be lessened. Consequently, youngsters need to face the problem of getting money for their survival. To exemplify, according to a survey conducted by London university in 2018, in topmost restaurants of Dubai robots served food to customers at their table quickly which declines the ratio of waiters by 80%. Thereby, it is great evidence that such devices will make generation jobless eventually, it will create a negative impact on mature beings' life. 

To conclude, although it has a few drawbacks such as it will be fewer job opportunity in the industries but due to having a myriad of benefits like effective and fast approach to do any task, I am in favour of those who opine that robots play a pivotal role in humans' future growth.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
The candidate has effectively addressed the given task by discussing both opinions on the importance of robots in human development and providing a personal view with supporting reasons. All aspects of the task have been adequately covered, and the essay demonstrates a clear understanding of the prompt.

**Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 8**

### Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay is well-organized and easy to follow. The transitions between sentences and paragraphs are clear, and the use of connecting words and phrases helps to maintain a smooth progression of ideas. The logical sequence and arrangement of information throughout the essay are appropriate.

**Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 8**

### Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
The candidate has used a range of vocabulary, including some sophisticated terms. However, there are some mistakes in vocabulary, such as "racked" instead of "argue" and "explicate" instead of "explain."

- **Mistake:** racked
  - **Suggestion:** argue
- **Mistake:** explicate
  - **Suggestion:** explain

**Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 7**

### Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
The candidate has used a variety of sentence structures, but there are some grammatical errors, such as "few individuals of society asserted that robots are imperative for the further growth of people" (subject-verb agreement error) and "To exemplify, according to a survey conducted by London university in 2018, in topmost restaurants of Dubai robots served food to customers at their table quickly which declines the ratio of waiters by 80%" (run-on sentence).

- **Mistake:** few individuals of society asserted that robots are imperative for the further growth of people
  - **Suggestion:** Few individuals in society assert that robots are imperative for people's further growth.
- **Mistake:** To exemplify, according to a survey conducted by London university in 2018, in topmost restaurants of Dubai robots served food to customers at their table quickly which declines the ratio of waiters by 80%
  - **Suggestion:** To exemplify, according to a survey conducted by London University in 2018, in topmost restaurants in Dubai, robots served food to customers at their tables quickly, which declined the ratio of waiters by 80%.

**Suggested Band Score (Grammatical Range and Accuracy): 7**

### Overall Band Score:
Considering the holistic performance across all criteria, the overall band score for the essay is **7.5**. The essay effectively addresses the task, is well-organized, and uses a range of vocabulary. However, there are some mistakes in vocabulary and grammar that could be improved.

### Feedback and Additional Comments:
**Strengths:**
- Clear and concise introduction
- Well-organized and logical structure
- Good use of examples to support arguments

**Areas for Improvement:**
- Improve vocabulary by using more sophisticated and accurate terms
- Correct grammatical errors, such as subject-verb agreement and run-on sentences
- Provide more specific evidence to support claims

prompt:
Some experts believe that when a country is already rich, any additional increase in economic wealth does not make its citizens any more satisfied. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

essay:
It is argue by some that developed country does not require any improvement in economic sector as their societes already feel satisfy with their current condition. I personally stand to this notion since mostly people from this country have a stable life. This essay will elaborate more about this issues on the following paragraph.

Rich country typically pay attention most on some basic needs of its dwellers such as salary, tax, education and health access in order to make sure all of the citizen have same treatment. This is why their citizent have a tendency to feel satisfy as long as their basic needs is provided by government. For example Swiss is categorized as some of happiest country in the world, as a result their dwellers even with regular job living in a happy and healthy life. Thus, they do not ask for another new improvement related to economic aspect.

Furthermore, as they already living in such a wealthy living condition, people from this country put their sight more entertaining themselves. This is mostly done with spending their time on vacation, learning new things and spend some time joining social organization such as involving in charity to support other people who struggle with economic matters. For instance, people in my village, receive donation from one social organisation in Finland, which focussed more on education with providing learning material, tools, uniform and even provide healthy food once i a week.

To conclude, as all the citizen has been living in decent life, government from rich country pay attention more on other aspects rather than economic aspect as their citizen mostly engaged in social things to satisfy themselves.

prompt: New technology has resulted in many jobs, which used to be performed by people, now being done by computers or robots. Do you think the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
The development in artificial intelalent field enable computers to conduct more and more sophistic tasks, including writing articles and collecting information in dangerous areas, which were performed by human being. Despite concerns are rise in public regarding a great amount of job opportunities is going to vanish, I personally believe it is a positive trend.

To begin with, there are various merits derived from applying modern technologies in widely professional aspects. First of all, robots which are able to replace human for doing high-risk missions, including exploring in extreme environments, could deter many safety hazards. For example, scientists nowadays are able to sent robots into deep ocean for finding new species, those robots could endure a long time remaining in the ocean, which allows researcher find more valuable data. Secondly, instead of simply complete repeatable works, AI technology nowadays are able to make a good use of its giant data base for creation. Take newspapers as an example, those reports which just simply elucidate facts are mainly done by computers, employees just need to provide key informations, such as dates and the name of people who involved in incidents. 

On the other hand, while a growing number of job positions are replaced by AI technology, some perspectives warning that it could provokes a growth in unemployeement rate. Furthermore, it will be harder for employees in the future to have a raise, since computers are able to tackle the most of hard works. However, those issues could be solved by governments with proper regulations, including providing regular financial subsidies to ensure the basic life quality of residents, and providing free services for medical cares. 

To summarise, it is inevitable that modern techonologies will demolish the majority of job positions in the future, since they are able to provide more stable and efficient services. In my perspective, even though it will cause many people lost their jobs, I still consider it as positive development, since our descendents may no longer need to work for money in the future, when technology could satisfy all the needs of human being.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by presenting clear and relevant ideas on both the advantages and disadvantages of technology replacing human jobs. However, there is a lack of depth in the arguments and evidence provided. The essay covers all aspects of the task but fails to provide substantial support or examples to strengthen the claims made.

There are incorrect verb forms, such as "is rise" instead of "are rising," and sentence construction issues, such as "instead of simply complete repeatable works" instead of "instead of simply completing repeatable works." The use of punctuation is inconsistent, and some sentences are poorly formed.

prompt: In some countries, people are having children at later age in life. What are the reasons? Do the advantage outweigh disadvantages?
essay:
In today's world childbirth is a huge problem for most women.Individuals are more inclined towards making their career than on giving birth to a child.Adapting this method has more negative impacts than positive.

Firstly, the reproductive age of a woman lies between 14yrs to 40yrs.Focusing on late childbirth has caused a rise in the infertility rate.Women undergo menopause early so they need to conceive early.Late born child brings many risks to the mother like,physical weakness and mental depression.

For instance,it has been reported that women are developing many obstetric and gynaecological problems as their age advances.PCOS, has been reported as the most common cause of infertility with advancing age,so doctors are recommending parents plan their family early to avoid such issues.

On the ,contrary there are some advantages of late pregnancy.Girls should not be forced to marry early instead they should be encouraged to study further and become independent.In doing so they will be capable of looking after their kids and giving them a bright future.For example,many individuals who have persuaded their higher degrees and then married have been shown to give a healthy and good life to their future kids.

To conclude,although the merits of late birthing is completing their studies but we cannot ignore the demerits it brings and its number has been enormously increasing.The biggest threat it causes risks to the mother and many women become infertile by the time they even think of becoming a parent.In my ,opinion women should plan early to become parents than to wait till they become independent.
evaluation:

However, it only partially fulfills the requirements of the task as it lacks depth and fails to adequately support its arguments with evidence. Suggested Band Score: 5.5

**Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):** The vocabulary used is limited and repetitive. The essay lacks variety and accuracy in vocabulary choices. For example, "problem" and "negative impacts" are used repeatedly, and "infertility rate" is used incorrectly. Suggested Band Score: 5.0

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy:** The essay exhibits errors in grammar and sentence construction. There are incorrect verb forms, missing conjunctions, and punctuation errors. For example, "Focusing on late childbirth has caused a rise in the infertility rate" should be "Focusing on late childbirth causes a rise in the infertility rate." Suggested Band Score: 5.0

**Overall Band Score:** 5.5
The essay partially addresses the task but lacks coherence, accuracy, and sophisticated language use. There is a need for improvement in all areas to achieve a higher band score.

**Feedback and Additional Comments:**

* Use more specific and varied vocabulary to enhance the lexical resource of the essay.
* Pay attention to grammar and sentence structure to improve accuracy and clarity.
* Ensure logical organization and smooth transitions between ideas to improve coherence and cohesion.
* Provide concrete examples and evidence to support arguments and make them more persuasive.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in

What are the reasons for this? 

How can people research this?
essay:
Over the last two or three decades, computer games are being played by adolescents all around the world. Some folks deem that these hobbies have negative Impacts on teenagers while others oppose this view and consider that these pastimes own positive aspects conversely. In this essay, I will look at both sides and try to draw some conclusions.

On the one hand, there is an exceedingly increasing number of nations who insist on several negative sides of play. In other words, the majority of games guide teenagers to violent behaviours since the players have villain roles who escape from the police and kill lots of victims on their way frequently. Moreover, proven by statistics, a high amount of cruel manners are observed among computer players who enthusiastically fight with others, and hence commend to attack even their parents and as a result, it is obvious that computer games have a major role in the shocking rate of juvenile crime. 

On the other hand, a tiny minority of communities ponder that technological games have numerous creative aspects which give a helping hand to the process of teens' development. In addition, these kinds of games is designed to make children  utilize their skills at which point the process gives rise to the attraction of different skill-related parts of the brain. What's more, Doctors always maintain that they are useful to enhance cleverness among children. For illustrate, youngsters who play nearly fifteen minutes each day show more Intelligent insights rather than others, and hence youths are now brilliant because of these well-designed games. 

In conclusion, although most city dwellers especially parents are worried about the devastating effects of violent hobbies, others explain the positive Impacts on the activity of the brain. Personally, in my opinion, both views are correct to some extent but the negative side seems to be severe and gets away from control.

The essay focuses primarily on the arguments for and against computer games, but does not fully explore the reasons why people are becoming more interested in researching the history of their homes or buildings.

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):

- **Range of vocabulary:** The essay uses a limited range of vocabulary, with frequent repetition of words such as "negative" and "positive."
- **Accuracy of vocabulary:** There are some errors in vocabulary usage, such as the use of the word "Impacts" instead of "effects."

Then by training teenagers for voluntary social activities.

To sum up, using teenagers spare time in different effective voluntary activities, have obvious benefits for their community as well as themselves. In my opinion, governers have to schaduled plans for using youths spare times in community.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In many communities, it is accepted that young people do free work for the community. I agree that this is correct, and in this essay I will try to explain it. 

As we know, humanity has lived in communities for many years. Traditional values are passed down from generation to generation. And one of the most important qualities is the ability to work, because this is what provides people with the necessary things for their existence. The older generation of people usually teach the younger ones, because the younger ones do not yet have enough experience to do the job well. For example, many schools offer work education classes where teenagers can do useful things for the community like birdhouses for birds or prepare simple meals for charity dinners. At the same time, teenagers feel needed for society, which increases their self-esteem. 

On the other hand, they gain useful experience and knowledge. For example, the ability to cook is always useful in the future. 

In conclusion I would like to say that unpaid work for the community among teenagers brings them together and distracts them from things like drugs and other addictions.

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.

Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
While some people believe that teaching art to children is important, others, think it is just a waste of time. In this essay I will discuss why studying art is important but also why some people think the opposite.

Teaching art in schools could have a positive impact in children as it helps them to develop creativity skills that are necessary in every activity or job later in life. In fact, especially at a young age, students needs to express their emotions and characters through artistic activities. Moreover, studying ancient art as well as contemporary art might motivate some of them to become artists or art professors at university.

However, in todays world most of the job positions require a strong knowledge in mathematics. 

Because of this, it is surely more important for young students to spend more time studying other 

topics instead of learning ancient art. For example, if you are very good at math you can apply for universities such as software engineering and you will probably find a job right after your studies. In addition to that, it gives you a better salary which in turn will allow you to be indipentend at a young age. 

To conclude, it is importnat for children to study art and develop creativity, however, in this modern world it is advantageous to spend more time learning math and other scientific topic as it will be easier to apply for a job.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by providing arguments for both views on whether art is an essential subject for children at school.
- The ideas presented in the essay are generally clear and relevant to the topic, although the transition between paragraphs could be improved to enhance coherence.
- The essay covers all aspects of the task by discussing the importance of creativity skills, the potential for artistic careers, and the need for scientific knowledge in today's job market.

**Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 3**

**Coherence and Cohesion:**

- The essay lacks a clear and logical sequence of ideas, with transitions between sentences and paragraphs being somewhat disjointed.
- Connecting words and phrases are used sparingly, which hinders the smooth progression of ideas.
- The organization of the essay is not entirely effective, as the first paragraph primarily focuses on the benefits of studying art, while the second paragraph abruptly shifts to emphasizing the importance of scientific subjects.

**Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 2**

**Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):**

- The essay uses a limited range of vocabulary, with some inaccuracies and overuse of certain words.
- For example, the repeated use of "important" could be replaced with more precise or varied vocabulary choices.
- The candidate demonstrates a basic understanding of vocabulary related to the topic, but there is room for improvement in both accuracy and variety.

**Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 2**

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy:**

- The essay exhibits a limited range of sentence structures, primarily relying on simple sentences.
- There are several grammatical errors throughout the essay, such as incorrect verb forms and sentence construction.
- For instance, "needs" should be "need" and "indipentend" should be "independent."
- The use of punctuation is inconsistent, which affects the clarity of the writing.

**Suggested Band Score (Grammatical Range and Accuracy): 2**

prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a  successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after  school.  Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: When they finish school, teenagers face the dilemma of whether to get a job or  continue their education. While there are some benefits to getting a job straight after  school, I would argue that it is better to go to college or university.        The option to start work straight after school is attractive for several reasons. Many  young people want to start earning money as soon as possible. In this way, they can  become independent, and they will be able to afford their own house or start a family.  In terms of their career, young people who decide to find work, rather than continue  their studies, may progress more quickly. They will have the chance to gain real  experience and learn practical skills related to their chosen profession. This may lead  to promotions and a successful career.         On the other hand, I believe that it is more beneficial for students to continue their  studies. Firstly, academic qualifications are required in many professions. For  example, it is impossible to become a doctor, teacher or lawyer without having the  relevant degree. As a result, university graduates have access to more and better job  opportunities, and they tend to earn higher salaries than those with fewer  qualifications. Secondly, the job market is becoming increasingly competitive, and  sometimes there are hundreds of applicants for one position in a company. Young  people who do not have qualifications from a university or college will not be able to  compete.        For the reasons mentioned above, it seems to me that students are more likely to be  successful in their careers if they continue their studies beyond school level.

prompt: Advertisements are becoming more and more common in everyday life. Is it a positive or negative development
essay:
It has long been debated over the growing popularity of advertisements in daily life. While this phenomenon is beneficial to some extent, especially companies, I would contend that this is a negative development due to the annoyance these adverts cause to people.

It is true that the ever-growing appearance of adverts may benefit corporations. This is because the more advertisements there are, the more customers are attracted to the products they advertise, meaning that buyers are more likely to purchase these products. For example, adverts of Coca-cola, which is a carbonated sugary drink, appears on television, social networking sites, and numerous restaurants on a frequent basis, resulting in lucrative profits for Coca-Cola enterprise.

While the advantages of the growing popularity of adverts are widely acknowledged, it is unfair if its downsides are neglected, which is its annoyance. This can be explained by the fact that commercials and other forms of advertising often spring up in every corner of life, which may cause disturbance for people by hindering them from their daily activities. For example, Youtube users often have to watch a few adverts before their videos start to play, or they often have to cope with constant advertising every 15 minutes when seeing a movie on television. As a result, people are likely to get irritated and disturbed by such frequent adverts, ushering in their decisions not to purchase advertised products.

In conclusion, the ever-growing existence of adverts tremendously benefits enterprises by drawing customers' attention, yet it is a major cause of irritation, causing them not to buy advertised products. It is recommended that the frequency of advertising should be limited in an attempt not to disturb people.

Young people often face the dilemma of whether to seek a job or enrol in university degrees after graduating from high school. This essay will discuss both views and into consideration.

To begin with, some people claim that starting working straight after finishing high school would give them more life experience about the work environment. They believe that learning skills while working are far better than attending college. For example, Steve - one of my friends who thought that starting working would give him more experiences and skills in real life rather than learning theories in college, and he is still able to be successful in the future. Moreover, young people want to have free and live independently instead of relying on their parents to meet their living expenses. In addition, they also can earn some saving money from the early jobs and spend them for their higher education or future career. Thus, I believe that gaining some life experiences and saving money in the early stage is beneficial for young people in the future. 

On the other hand, many people seek admission in higher education and get more appropriate knowledge for their dream job. Young people assert that university is the best place to provide them with the major of appropriate knowledge and well-preparedness, leading to a promising career. For instance, plenty of people became successful after graduating and achieved their goals in life. Furthermore, a degree makes you more competitive and gain more basic needs for your future career. 

In conclusion, there are some positive points in both views. Whether starting working early or going to university is the springboard for their future.

prompt:
The housing shortage in big cities can cause severe social consequences. Some people think only government action can solve this problem. 

To what extent do you agree or disagree with the above statement?
essay:
These days as the population is increasing at an unprecedented pace, the housing shortage has become one of the main consequences. It is concerned whether it is an obligation of the government to alleviate this issue or whether the nation is responsible for the lack of accommodation. I firmly believe that both parties should integrate and contribute to the solutions. 

To begin with, there is ample evidence that sustainable housing is strongly due to government regulations. That is to say, political houses should establish certain restrictions on the numbers of people and land that is distributed to each citizen. For instance, a recent survey has revealed that 25 countries had a scarcity of land to construct new houses because of the fact that government didn't allocate the land properly and residents were prone to build large houses in order to outperform one another, which later caused housing shortages in multifold metropolitan cities. 

Secondly, it is explicit that because of the nation's unprofitable purchase of lands and housing facilities, it has become prevalent to some citizens to inevitably live in flats and accommodations. It can be solved by public organisations that can share and divide some houses, which indicates that the government is not fully liable for such an issue. For example, several cities concluded that this problem is partly due to people's actions, 45 per cent of which could solve this problem by uniting both the government and the nation. 

To conclude, it can be clearly seen that I strongly advocate that it is not only feasible for the government to come up with a solution, but also citizens of the city are able to resolve the scarcity of housing.

prompt: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animal species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action to improve the situation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion. ??
essay:
There are controversial perspectives heating up a debate over how to solve the negative effect issue caused by human activities on plant and animal species. While some hold a strong view that it is too late to measure the problem, the opposite makes a statement that we should enhance the situation with effective actions. I would contend that take effective actions to revamp the matters, which do more good than harm.

 It is obvious to note that there are many reasons to convince that it is too late in order to solve the negative effect of human activities on plant and animal species, one of them is deforestation. Having an ever-growing demand for land to live and wood to consume, humans decide on deforestation to serve their purpose. Therefore, it leads to flora and fauna being indiscriminately destroyed and lost completely instead of being replaced and it pushes many categories of species on the verge of extinction.  For example, Panda is China’s national treasure, but this species is on the brink of extinction because of deforestation. There is a wealth of animals in the world that are dying out because of human activities, which is the reason people doubt that it is too late to tackle the problem. 

 While the redeeming features of negative effects of human activities on flora and fauna species are widely acknowledged, we will find an address in order to enhance the issue. Plant and animal species play a paramount significant role in human’s life, so we should find a solution as soon as possible. One of the remedies is to build a reserve to create a safe habitat for endangered animals. For instance, Cuc Phuong national park in Vietnam is built and overseen by the authorities, which is home for a wave of precious animals. Hence, the situation will be resolved and revamped if people actively implement it.             

 In conclusion, although there are many reasons to prove that it is too late to deal with the negative effect on plant and animal species caused by human activities, people should take effective action to improve the problem.

prompt: Some people argue that climate change has negative effects on business, while other people believe that climate change could create more opportunities to business. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Currently,the climate change is becoming increasingly serious due to the unlimited resources excavation.This has triggered an intense discussion.Some people believe that climate change may negatively influence the economic development,whereas,some other people advocate that a greater amount of opportunities would be exerted.Personally,I strongly agree that the adverse effects outweigh the advantage for larger business odds.

To begin with, the changing climate could result in a lower production of planting.According to the research,by 2030,the total production of wheat,rice and corn may decline by almost 5%~10% due to the global warming which is a kind of climate change.Moreover,in arid areas,a great amount of engineerings in factories that require plentiful water could conceivably be forced to terminate the operation because of the lack of water source.Therefore,uncertain climate conditions presumably lead to the serious falling economy.

On the other hand,more business opportunities are potentially to be accompanied with the natural catastrophe and damages to human health.This means that more artificial food might be produced to replace the decreased plantings.What’s more,it is undoubtedly that climate change will be detrimental to individual’s health.It perhaps rises the probability of disease and death rate and thus elevates the infections.In light of this,more advanced medical machines tend to be generated and lots of relevant medical staffs are of great inportance for treatment.Similarly,more precaution works for avoiding the disease like masks towards haze weather or related measures would be in demand.Hence,this tends to boost the development in economy.

In conclusion,although the economic prosperity whatever from human’s daily life or health issue would be brought,however,in my opinion,the disadvantages involved in environmental damage and worse physical conditions for humans should be in deeper consideration and these factors are inevitable.

prompt: Some people believe that the time spent on television, video and computer games can be valuable for children. Others believe this may have negative effects on a child's development. Discuss both of these views and give your own opinion.
essay:
In recent years, there has been a profound increase in the number of people questioning whether the time children spend on their electronics can be beneficial for their intellectual growth. On the other hand, many people believe that excessive usage of technology can be detrimental. However, critics, myself included, are of strong belief that moderate screen time can be valuable for juveniles.

To begin, there is an argument to be made that the increased time children spend watching television and playing video games can stymie their growth and development in a number of ways. To illustrate this point, kids require a certain amount of physical interaction with other youths of the same age group to acquire a specific level of social skills. For this reason, it is evident that there should be a schedule in place for schoolchildren to obtain interpersonal skills to a certain degree. What is more, unrestrained hours spent on such gadgets can impair their sleep and inevitably, their cognitive functioning. This being the case, it is not unreasonable to assume that the extent to which children spend using electronics can determine the after-effect.

Despite the previously stated argument, there are immense benefits to using screens as a tool for learning in young children. For instance, early reading and promoting family relationships is the cornerstone of healthy brain development. Furthermore, technology offers many applications to foster proper speech through singing and storytelling, as well as providing several platforms for literacy due to the advanced access to electronic books. Moreover, choosing high-quality applications helps kids fully engage in their education. 

To conclude from the aforementioned discussion, while some are under the impression that screens are harmful to juvenile development, others, myself included, would strongly argue that technological resources used for educational purposes are instrumental for learning. From my perspective, a refined timetable for the usage of electronic devices would enhance intellectual growth in today’s youth.

prompt:
Only 20% of Tech Jobs are Held by Women.
What problems do women face that prevent them from getting these jobs and what must be done to change this situation?

Generally, only one-fifth of the women can hold the career in the technical domain/technical domains. The problems faced by females to get employment or be sustained in technical area and its solutions will be discussed in the following text. 

The foremost problem caused by the ladies is the gender discrimination. Inequality due to gender, although illegal, exist prominently in many tech companies and does not allow females to work independently. In addition to this, lack of assistance and understanding is another major issue faced by most of them. The mindset of masculine stereotypes is that the women should do the job like nursing and teaching which suits to their basic nature and do not provide their support for the ones who opt for techy jobs.

A possible solution to this problem would be to erase gender-based attitude from a company’s culture. Reinforcing the healthy attitude towards women by every individual of the company can help to overcome this problem. Secondly, the support of people in woman's life is extremely necessary. Aiding in the form of selecting subjects in school and choosing jobs in the industry should be their own evaluation instead of any forceful decision. For example, a recent report published in the Guardian shows that there has been increase in the 20% of females opting for technical jobs from the last two years.

In conclusion, females can opt for the techie jobs more if gender discrimination has been reduced and encouragement  from the families and coworkers can be enhanced. It is predicted that more organization can opt for the culture of equality in order to attract female staff, as the demand of technical jobs are more compared to the employees working currently in this sector.

prompt: Some people believe that teenager should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time . This can be benefit teenagers and the community as well . To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, teenagers are supported to do the community work in their free time which is made some people think that youngsters should not get a wage from this kind of job. And this might be beneficial for them. From my judging, I believe that people should get paid whatever the job is.

Firstly, doing the community work without pay might teach young adults about sharing and caring but it would be better if they earn what they have done. Some rewards can teach them to know how to manage money as well. Furthermore, this might be the opportunity for them to find their pathway about what to do in the future such as social worker, teacher or career that be relevant.

Secondly, as I mentioned earlier, everybody needs to be paid when it is working. Even it is community work or charity stuff, there is a lot of costs that have been devoted. For instance, they need to give their time to taking care of children with special needs, elders, disabilities or they have spent their time studying about working methods carefully. Obviously, there are expenses for travelling to the workplace.

However, It's a highly debated topic, Some believe that it should be taught by schools and others think that it might be more effective if learn at home by parents. On the one hand, some group of people agrees that like other learnings, the value of recycled material and rubbish should teach at the house. Therefore, they argue that home is a good place to learn about recycling things and waste.

On the other hand, I would stand by the former view that an institution is a more effective place for aware children to grasp habits of reuse the things. Firstly, It's well established fact that, students more listen to their teachers to parents. Secondly, They can learn from other peers by watching them. Last but not the least, If schools provide learning through practical examples, then children can more retain information for a long time. For example, One recent European study demonstrates that, Learning at school is far more impactful than home.
