prompt: The increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment. What are the causes of this? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay:
Due to industrialization and advanced technologies, today's factories are able to produce a huge amount of goods. Therefore, producing myriad commodities also means that mankind is damaging the planet. The causes of this issue and feasible solutions will be explained in this essay.

To begin with, producing goods will damage the environment. To explain, factories emit a large sum of Co2 during the fabricating process and, in turn, will have a negative impact on the globe such as global warming and natural disasters. Take China as an example, the world's biggest developing country, which is called the world factory, in this country are located myriad factories so air pollution is a very severe concern. In fact, in several cities in China, the air quality is quite bad and rarely people can see a blue sky. Another cause worth mentioning is deforestation, individuals every day cut down countless trees to produce commodities and furniture.

Moving further, feasible solutions to the problem mentioned above could be the fast switch to renewable energies. To elaborate, if the world's energies come from eco-friendly sources, then producing commodities will not release Co2 anymore. For example, once factories receive energy from renewable ones such as solar, and wind, they will not damage the environment because these energies are eco-friendly. In fact, most developed countries like Europe and America, are setting up some targets to achieve. To be more specific, Their goal is to reach carbon neutrality in the near future.

In conclusion, industrialization is inevitable and irrevocable since human beings every day have to consume large sums of goods to fulfil their needs. However, there are several feasible solutions to solve the pollution problem. Hence, people should make a great effort to strike a balance between these two variables.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement: 8.5**
The essay effectively addresses the given task by presenting relevant ideas and arguments. The candidate has identified the causes of environmental damage caused by consumer goods production and has suggested feasible solutions. prompt: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people while others believe that the purpose of museum is to educate. Discuss both views and give you own opinion.
essay:
People have different views about the role and function of museums, whether those places should be enjoyable and entertaining or be educational places only. In my personal opinion, museums should be both a place to gain knowledge and enjoyable enough to attract the public’s interest.

On the one hand, operating a museum just for sharing knowledge will not reach its purpose efficiently. Thus, some people suggest making museums create events and plan projects through which visitors can learn about the history and enjoy those activities actively. Average visitors may get bored if they have to read or listen to too much educational content thus, thinking of education through enjoyable events can be more attractive to potential visitors. Consequently, the management team could earn more funds and can invest them in maintaining and expansion of the museum.

On the other hand, some people argue that museums should only focus on their main function, sharing knowledge about historical and cultural things. Visitors should be educated about the things that they did not know previously. Thus, some experienced guides will explain to a group of visitors or offer leaflets and hangouts in which general information about the exhibition is written. In this way, museums can carry out their main task of teaching people about history, culture, and many other knowledgeable things.

In conclusion, it seems to me that a good museum should be able to offer an enjoyable and educational experience so that more visitors will come and learn new things while having fun at the same time.

prompt: Many university graduates cannot find a job in their chosen profession, what factors may have caused this situation and what, in your opnion, should be done about it? 2
essay:
A section of University degree holders fails to receive their dream jobs. The foremost reason behind this, to me, is the casual behaviour of most of the higher secondary school students while selecting the subjects. To handle this problem, pupils should analyze their career prospects prior to selecting the subjects.

 As far as underlying factors are concerned, most importantly,  It might be due to unawareness about their natural aptitude for subjects and associated job opportunities in the market. Apart from this, most of the school graduates are teenagers and this is the stage when children are the most adamant. This fact leads to several confusions in their minds.  For instance, taking physics and chemistry just because of peer pressure, will not allow one to compete with his  counterparts. So, as a result of which  many graduates face frustration when they are forced to do work that they do not appreciate. 

With regard to solutions, It is extremely essential that school authorities organize counselling sessions for higher secondary students to make them aware of further career prospects, and also assist them to understand their strong areas. These types of programs provide individuals to opt for appropriate subjects for their tertiary studies. This further helps them to excel in their performances in university. Finally, dedicated university graduates succeed in achieving their chosen profession.

 In conclusion, I would subscribe to the view that an unguided and unassisted way of learning is a major factor towards job frustration, and one of the effective ways out is to avoid this situation is to assist school graduates in setting a clear and achievable goal.

It is often said that nowadays the population who live in the world are interested in finding out more report about homes and buildings they settle in. There are multiple reasons for this. Different types of methods can be used to investigate this trend.

Firstly ,some reasons for this can be considered. For example ,we all know most old buildings are destroying these days and replacing with high rise flats and apartment blocks. It would seem that most of these places were historical places where people can find the history of their countries. The reason why they decided to know more about these buildings is to improve recognition of the past. Moreover ,there is enough information that can be found in these constructions about classical architecture. Understanding  old methods of architecture can be helpful to shap new homes and accommodations. Therefore ,this makes it clear there are many reasons for this trend that can not be ignored. 

Secondly , there are multiple ways to collect information. For instance ,a common mean in today's modern world is the internet. Needless to say ,all sorts of things can be found on websites that have some essays related to the history of some constructions. Additionally ,another way is digging up. Some people opine excavating the homes can help to know more about things that they are required. However ,this can not be a successful way because of requiring noteworthy money to spend. As a result ,it becomes apparent ways that can be used to collect reports about this trend are different and various. 

To summarise ,this issue has numerous causes as well as existing many means to know more about it. It is predicted that to continue searching the history of human's building they will inform about all items in the near future.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement: 7**
- The essay adequately addresses the given task by discussing the reasons for the growing interest in researching the history of residences and providing methods to conduct such research.
- The response covers all aspects of the task and provides relevant examples and explanations.
- However, the essay lacks depth and analysis, and the ideas presented could be more clearly organized and supported with more specific evidence.

**Coherence and Cohesion: 6.5**
- The essay is generally coherent, with clear transitions between sentences and paragraphs.
- Connecting words and phrases are used effectively to maintain a logical flow of ideas.
- However, the essay could benefit from a stronger introduction and conclusion that more explicitly links the main ideas and provides a sense of closure.

**Lexical Resource (Vocabulary): 6**
- The essay demonstrates a fair range of vocabulary, but some words and phrases are used inaccurately or inappropriately.
- There are instances of repetition and a lack of variety in word choice.
- Specific mistakes include:
    - "report" should be replaced with "information" or "history"
    - "settle" should be replaced with "live" or "reside"
    - "opine" should be replaced with "believe" or "think"
    - "noteworthy" should be replaced with "significant" or "substantial"

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy: 6**
- The essay exhibits a limited range of sentence structures and grammatical complexity.
- There are some grammatical errors, including:
    - "It is often said that nowadays the population who live in the world are interested in finding out more report about homes and buildings they settle in." should be "Nowadays, more and more people around the world are interested in finding out about the history of the houses or buildings they live in."
    - "there is enough information that can be found in these constructions about classical architecture." should be "These buildings often contain valuable information about classical architecture."
    - "this makes it clear there are many reasons for this trend that can not be ignored." should be "This highlights the growing importance of understanding the history of our built environment."

**Overall Band Score: 7**
- The essay meets the basic requirements of the task but could be improved in terms of task achievement, coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, and grammatical range and accuracy.
- With further development and refinement, the essay could potentially achieve a higher band score.

**Feedback and Additional Comments:**
- Strengths:
    - The essay clearly identifies the reasons for the growing interest in researching the history of residences.
    - The essay provides several methods for conducting such research.
- Areas for improvement:
    - The essay could benefit from a more in-depth analysis of the reasons for this trend, supported by specific examples and evidence.
    - The essay could be more effectively organized, with a stronger introduction and conclusion that clearly connects the main ideas.
    - The vocabulary used in the essay could be more precise and varied, with a wider range of words and phrases.
    - The essay could improve grammatical accuracy and complexity by using a wider range of sentence structures and avoiding grammatical errors.

**Suggestions for Enhancement:**
- Read widely and expose yourself to a variety of vocabulary and grammatical structures.
- Practice writing essays on similar topics to improve your writing skills.
- Seek feedback from a teacher or tutor to identify areas for improvement and refine your writing style.

And another hand, I believe that it's more beneficial to your students to continue their studies because there are getting better jobs, opportunities and higher salaries and gain knowledge some jobs require academic qualifications and become useful members of society.

For the reason mentioned above, it seems to me that students are more likely to be successful in their lives, and if there continue their studies beyond  the school level.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.
What are the reasons for this?
How can people research this?
essay:
History plays a great role in terms of enhancing knowledge. In some countries,an increasing number of residents has become curious to know about the history of their homes.Below,the reasons behind this development will be discussed along with some ways through which citizens can research this.

To begin with,there are quite a few reasons for which people feel the necessity to know about the past story of their homes.First of all,humans have the tendency to feel curious about their surroundings and the prime reasoning behind this development might be their nature of feeling curious.To illustrate,when people move into a new house and the house is a century old,they become excited to know about what happened in the past.After learning about the history they share this information with their friends and family,thus it becomes a topic to gossip about for them .Another reason is sometimes people want to sense a connection to their living areas and therefore,they feel interested in this development.For example,in cities,houses and buildings are all quite similar and residents do not feel connected to their homes. That is to say, through this development they try to find a connection so that they feel fulfilled.

In this advanced era,it is quite easy to find out the past stories.For instance, the Internet is a great resource to learn about anything,whether it's the history of the place or about what people assume about that place. Citizens can simply search on the internet and from there they can find tremendous information.Another way to find out is asking in the neighbourhood,the residents who have been living in that area or building for a long time can give so much information about its history.

To sum up,people have found it exciting to learn history,therefore,residents nowadays are more likely to research and technology have made it easier for them to conduct their research.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Teenagers can learn a lot through working in the community in their free time. Many people believe that this can be advantageous to the community and the children because services like picking up garbage and helping elders can teach teenagers to keep the place clean and tidy and respect their elders. I believe, however, that they should be paid for their work and time rather than doing it for free. 

Children do have free time compared to adults. It can motivate them to participate in these activities, utilized time appropriately, and get paid.  In other words, knowing that they will earn through their hard work without even pushing them, they will participate voluntarily. For instance, if a teenager wants to buy pair of sports shoes, he will work in the community and earn that money rather than asking his parents. However, if asked to work for free, they might end up not performing the tasks well. They will find reasons to avoid performing services to the community. When forced to do the job, the outcome might turn out to be poor. For example, when rewarded, the child will be willing to do duty with utmost care. Therefore, it should be compulsory to pay, when they are working in their leisure time.

In conclusion, the community should pay children for working because it will motivate them. In addition, there would not be any need to force them because they will voluntarily participate considering the reward they will earn.
evaluation:

To regard with some possible factors of this trend. Firstly.In an earlier time , people used to less transpiration services and they covered long and short distance through domestic animals,sometimes by walking as well.Whereas,these days  everyone has their private vehicles and they reliably on it for moving  far-away and nearest destination.Thus ,this practice act as promote traffic level on roads.One further point is that the public transportation systemshipping system is less effective because human beings does not reach at their locations on time as a consequence, they have to use private vehicles which leads to influx . Another reason is behind that many people who travel rural areas to urban areas for obtaining education,work , medical services ,which helps to increase transportation because they also use private vehicles instead of public shipment.
Moving further with possible action in the favour of address this practice. Primary and strong action should be taken by government is that the authorities provide extra and improve public transit facilities in order to reduce private vehicle on the roads along with encourage people use public shipping and spread awareness regarding health issues which may be occurred in the future due to gridlock. Moreover,companies should allow cab for their employees and people must walk for short distance which may help reducefreight level.
In conclusion.I reiterate that service has very diverse outcomes like increase accident rate, pollution,health problems.Therefore, the government and humanity can be reduced it with conscious steps.

prompt: Some believe that people should make efforts to fight climate change while others think it is better to learn to live with it.Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
The issue of climate change was always debatable and has sparked controversy over the potential impact in recent years. Many people claim that people have more responsibility to fight climate change, while others reject this notion. In my opinion, we should work more to fight against climate change to be more rational. 

There are myriad reasons that will further explain this argument. Still, the most predominant one stems from the fact that the environment has significant influences on our wellbeing, and hurting the earth means hurting ourselves. The Covid-19 pandemic has vividly demonstrated this. The virus can spread due to our poaching of wild primates' nature. As a result, many countries took damaging blows to their economies and the life of their citizens. Furthermore, many prominent business chains do not have to spend significant money on carbon emissions. In that situation, if citizens do not raise their voices against pollution, the government does not follow the legislation to protect the environment.

On the other hand, some others believe that global warming is most appealing for economic practices. Poor communities are unable to afford environment-friendly methods of production. For example, from 2020, The tech- giant company Apple did not provide charging adapters with iPhones upon purchase. Because they have avoided mining a significant amount of materials from the earth and conserved copper, zinc, and many metals used for manufacturing a charging adapter, this decision by the technology giant had caused a furore among buyers. Another pivotal aspect of this argument is that people use lots of fossil fuels for their everyday work, detrimental to the environment.

In conclusion, according to the arguments mentioned above, I feel that to save our planet and secure our next generation, scientists, policymakers, social workers, and the government should take several steps to overcome the situation and make the world a better place.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by discussing both views on climate change and presenting their own opinion.
- The essay is clear, relevant, and coherent in its ideas.
- All aspects of the task have been covered with appropriate arguments and evidence.
- The candidate has fulfilled the requirements of the task.

- Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are generally clear and smooth.
- Connecting words and phrases are used effectively to maintain a logical progression of ideas.
- The essay is well-organized and structurally sound.
- Suggested Band Score: 7

**Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):**
- The candidate has used a variety of vocabulary throughout the essay.
- There are minor inaccuracies in vocabulary, such as "myriad" being used incorrectly.
- The vocabulary is generally appropriate for the given context.
- Suggested Band Score: 6

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy:**
- The essay exhibits a variety of sentence structures.
- There are some grammatical errors, such as "Still, the most predominant one stems from the fact" and "For example, from 2020."
- Punctuation and sentence formation are generally correct.
- Suggested Band Score: 6

**Overall Band Score:**
- Considering the holistic performance across all criteria, the overall band score for the essay is **9**.
- The essay effectively addresses the task, is coherent and cohesive, and demonstrates a good range of vocabulary and grammatical accuracy.

**Feedback and Additional Comments:**

prompt: Environmental damage is a problem in most countries. What factors damage the environment and who should take responsibility?
essay:
In today's modern society, environmental pollution is not a new phenomenon, yet it remains the world's greatest problem facing humanity. From my perspective, man's activities through urbanization, industrialization, mining, and exploration are at the forefront of global environmental pollution. And both individuals and communities are responsible for this and they have to take practical actions to solve this pressing issue.   

There are numerous factors attributed to environmental degradation. However, the principal one is the industrial waster discharged from manufacturing. More specifically,     chemical effluents, which are by-product of industries, are discharged into bodies of water without having undergone proper treatment methods, causing water pollution and subcequently harm to aquatic life. Another influence is people's travel needs. The dependence on cars has given rise to major problems, including air pollution, a depletion of natural resources and habitat losses. The overuse of private means of transport can emit an excessive level of fumes and smoke, which make the air quality unpleasant. On top of that, deforestation for agriculture and infrastructure cause ecological imbalance and the extinction of many endangered species.

The responsibility belong to everyone and the companies. In spite of the difficulties, some actions need to be accomplished by both the government and individuals to permanent tackle this issue. On the one hand, it is necessary for individuals to collect and recycle plastic items and use public means of transport instead of private ones. Even the smallest actions can significantly improve living habitats. On the other hand, the government's involvement is therefore vital as they can launch propagation campaigns to heighten social awareness of the importance of the protecting ecosystem or establish more environmental events such as monthly green days. Furthermore, the investigation into sustainable transport and renewable resources should also be implemented by communities. For instance, many developed countries have made a lot of processes in sustainable substances and energy, which helps reduce the rapid climate change and greenhouse effects. 

In conclusion, our environment is badly damaged because of human day-to-day activities and modern lifestyles, and we and the goverment share this responsibility and we need to do something for the sake of the environment and ecosystem such as collecting litter, changing harmful habits or finding out alternative energy.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

The candidate has addressed the task prompt by identifying the factors contributing to environmental damage (industrialization, transportation, and deforestation) and discussing the shared responsibility between individuals and communities in addressing the issue. The essay covers all aspects of the task and provides relevant arguments and examples to support the claims.

**Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 5**

**Coherence and Cohesion:**

The essay is generally well-organized and easy to follow. Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are smooth, and connecting words and phrases are used effectively to maintain the flow of ideas. The logical sequence of information is clear, with a coherent introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.

**Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 5**

**Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):**

The essay demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, using a variety of words to express ideas and avoid repetition. While there are a few instances of inaccuracies or overuse of certain words, the overall vocabulary is appropriate for the context.

**Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 5**

prompt: Some people believe that children should learn to paint or draw as a subject in their school curriculum. Others think that it is a waste of time and that there are more important subjects that should be taught. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Children’s education in school has always highly concerned the parents of children. Some parents may hold the opinions that students need to be taught painting and drawing at school, while some other parents believe that it is useless to engage in painting or drawing curricula, as it is a waste of valuable time. Personally, I am for the former perspective and the reasons for it will be given with examples in this essay.

First of all, art classes such as drawing and painting are educational technical curricula that are originated from our lives. Drawing, as an artistic curriculum, imparts sense of aesthetic feeling to the students from a very young age if they start drawing courses from the beginning of school. As the children grow up, they gradually obtain knowledge about art, and at the same time, they might  consider pursuing further as their future career if they have the desires and the talents. In this case, learning how to draw and paint is not just doing a course, it is learning a necessary skill for the students to make a living on in the future.

Secondly, there is no a more important course than any other courses. The reason why children need to attend school is that they need to develop to full scale and develop comprehensively, which means that they should be educated with both academic content and edified with artistic courses. A student without the cultivation of aesthetics and art may influence the development of his or her other filed of study. For example, the student may lack of perspectives or ideas in composing an article when he or she is doing an English assignment. 

To sum up, it is unfounded to say that learn to draw and paint in school is a time-wasting thing for students. I firmly believe that students should be encouraged to get themselves more involved in artistic courses in school, rather than focusing on only a few academic subjects which are more considered compulsory and important at school.

As a  the results , it is likely that residents in the surviving  buildings can't help finding out more about them,  such as when they were built and why they look  the way they do.  There are also people who do research to find a  sense of connection. With concrete residential  buildings everywhere, neighbourhoods nowadays  look very alike and, therefore, it is hard for people  to feel something special about where they live.  However, by learning about the buildings that once  stood there and the people who lived in them, for  example, a sense of connection and involvement  may be fostered.  The best way for people to explore, I believe, is to  ask the elderly in their neighbourhood. Many seniors  have lived in the same neighbourhood all their lives.  They have seen it change around them. They have  witnessed people coming and going. Talking to them can definitely help one uncover some  intriguing stories of the place where one lives.  In conclusion, curiosity and a desire to seek a  connection are two possible reasons why people  investigate the history of their homes. To find  answers, they should ask the old people in their  neighbourhood for help

prompt: In some cities, public parks and open spaces are changed into gardens where local residents can grow their own fruit and vegetables. Do you think the benefits outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
There is now a proclivity in several cities to convert public places as parks into gardens, supporting the locals to plant fruit and vegetables. From my perspective, the merits are overshadowed by the demerits in this trend.

To commence with, it is true that this change can bring several advantages for residents’ life. First of all, citizens can achieve enormous food resources by growing in open spaces. If all the public space can be utilized for gardening, a huge amount of food sources such as fruits and vegetables can be harvested, serving citizens’ demands. To be more specific, the locals can either consume the food for themself or use it as a source to make a living. The second rationale for this trend is that it can create a much more favourable environment for the community. Granted, gardens can create such a picturesque and fresh view that everyone loves to enjoy it in their neighbourhood. As a positive result, a healthy and clean lifestyle is created in society, making a worth-living space.

In my opinion, I strongly believe that the disadvantages surpass the benefits of this regulation. The reason why I advocate this view is that pulling down parks and other public places can create a society that lacks communal activities. It is acknowledged that destroying open spaces means that residents do not have any area for doing community activities outdoor as exercises, walking or playing team-building games. Given the lack of places for the public, it is much easier to have poor mental health and spiritual life. For instance, kids can easily be stressed or inactive if there are no playgrounds for them to play in. Additionally, there are several places where the locals can create their own gardens instead of parks. Alternative places such as balconies or terraces in the individuals’ houses should be taken into consideration so that citizens can have their personal spaces to grow fruits and vegetables. Hence, the officials can balance demands for parks and gardens at the same time.

In conclusion, both open areas and private gardens bring a plethora of benefits for city dwellers. Thus, solutions and regulations should be taken to serve the community.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The candidate has effectively addressed the given task by providing a clear position on the topic and supporting arguments.

prompt:
In many countries, the government likes to spend more money on the arts. Some people agree with this. However, others think the government should spend more on health and education.

Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay:
These days, some argue that the government should invest more money in medical care and education while others think money should be spent on the arts. In my opinion, both are important aspects of citizens and the country’s development and equal funds should be allocated to them.

On the one hand, there are certain reasons that the government should spend money on art. To begin with, art is the soul of a nation. This is mainly because future generations need the ancient quintessence and cultural traditions of the country. Thus, the nation's ancient and cultural heritage should have a budget from the government to maintain and preserve it. For example, Hue royal court music, which is known as an intangible cultural heritage recognized by the world, is being invested annually to develop and preserve by the government. Moreover, art is used for recreational purposes. In other words, nowadays, art is a marvellous source of entertainment. For instance, comedy is a kind of art that helps viewers relax and relieve stress. 

On the other hand, it is my firm belief that investing money in education and health is equally necessary. Firstly, health is one of the factors that affect the advancement/development/progress of the economy. Residents can only work effectively if they have good health, which brings a good impact on the economy of the country. For example, in Covid19 pandemic, the Vietnamese government spent a huge amount of money on medical care to buy vaccines for residents. Thanks to that, people could work normally and focus on improving the economy. Secondly, it is believed that education is the backbone of all developments. People with proper education will contribute to the development of the country in terms of economy, science, politics and other aspects. Also, it is evident that most developed countries are countries that focus on education.

In conclusion, to maintain and develop the country, I think the government should not only invest money in the arts but also in education and healthcare.

prompt: More and more people are seriously overweight. Some people suggest the solution to this problem is to increase the price of fattening foods. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The downside of modernization and convenience is the increase in unhealthy lifestyles and poor eating habits. That can cause a variety of health issues. Some people suggest that the government should raise the tax on fattening foods in order to address these concerns. However, I disagree with this proposal.

Nowadays, the number of people who are overweight or even obese is on the rise. One of the reasons is supposed to derive from the fattening foods that are commonly known as “fast food,” such as French fries, soft drinks, and hamburgers. Besides, these foods are inexpensive and simple to obtain. They are also well-liked by a large number of consumers. These temptations make them unable to stop buying. As a result, they gain weight. However, the crucial reason for weight problems is unhealthy lifestyles. For example, people tend to spend numerous hours sitting when they use computers or smartphones for work or recreation, which can lead to a sedentary lifestyle. This will facilitate fat accumulation in their bodies, which is a source of different weight-related ailments, such as heart disease, diabetes, and obesity. If they have fast food with a reasonable portion combined with regular exercise, diseases related to weight will be decreased. Furthermore, educating people about a healthy diet and lifestyle through the media or in schools can help to reduce weight problems effectively. With the provided information, they will be aware of the pros and cons of the problem and can choose the best way to deal with it.

Admittedly, increasing taxes on fattening foods can have a certain effect on the buying rate. However, the fast-food industry contributes a large proportion to the revenue and employment of a country. If this industry declines in production, the government may face various negative consequences.

In conclusion, the most effective way to limit weight problems is through a positive lifestyle and a proper perspective on dieting.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
- The candidate has effectively addressed the given task by providing relevant arguments and examples in response to the prompt.
- The ideas presented are clear and relevant to the topic, demonstrating a good understanding of the issue.

prompt: Nowadays people use social media to keep in touch with others and be aware of news. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages
essay:
In this contemporary era, the hitches allied to social media are mounting dangerously. controversy exists as to whether social media should be used in order to be in touch with friends and family as well as to be updated with current affairs is beneficial or is an impediment. Although using these applications might have some adverse ramifications, I believe the upside of this trend far outweighs the downside. 

To begin with, there are myriad points to agree with the meritorious side. The first and most prominent one is that these apps have made people's way of communication easy and convenient. To elucidate further, a person can not only communicate with others who live in another corner of the World but also send any news or information within a moment. for instance, by using WhatsApp, a social networking  application, we can send a  message to another portion of the world within 10 nanoseconds. Therefore, it is indisputable that social networks can help us to get the breaking news as well as  contact other people.

On the other hand, are there any drawbacks related to this issue? certainly, there are. The most worrying object is that the masses are getting away from the real world and being involved in the virtual one. To decipher this, populations, nowadays, are quite keen on making friends online rather than in real life. Moreover, they are engaging a huge amount of time on these platforms which is harmful to their study and living style as well. A survey conducted by ILO in the UK in 2015, for example, revealed that on average, 36% of the total population in the UK are a victim of insomnia as a result of overusing Facebook, Whatsapp and Instagram. Hence, the pitfalls of using these platforms are Lucid.

To conclude the main propositions, this critique elucidated the virtues and hiccups of social networking apps. Owing to these stated reasons, I am profoundly convinced that the pros of this phenomenon overshadow the Cons.

prompt:
As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. To

what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Businesses are earning money but they also should follow social resposiblities. I completely agree that business people should have responsibilities towards society well-being.

Nowadays, most of the textile companies are making a lot of money. The bi-products generated by these companies are very harmful for humans so it is the duty of owners to reduce such waste and find a better solution for decomposing waste. For instance, one company situated in Bangalore produced a lot of textile waste which was dumped directly in river. The Government took quick actions and fined the company which led to lesser waste and clean river water. Protecting our environment should be the first most priority for any business companies. Thus, owner's should be held responsible for such things and strict actions should be taken by the government.

On the other hand, companies should not only focus on profit but also on the employees they have.

To deliver the deliverables on time companies are making the employee work day and night. This results in bad health of employees. The people should be treated nicely and work life balance should be maintained. For example, organizing fun activities should be encouraged at work place. It is said that if one keeps their employee's happy then the projects are delivered on time. If the business people are taking care of the folks around them then that company is considered as friendly. Hence, company should be socially responsible because it is beneficial to employee's and company itself.

In conclusion, I adhere that businesses should follow social responsibilities to keep their employees healthy and happy.

prompt: Many people argue that in order to improve the quality of education, high school students should be encouraged to make comments or even critism of their teachers. Others think it will lead to loss of respects and discipline in the classroom. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
While some adopt the view that students ought to be entitled to comment or even criticize their professor so as to enhance educational quality, others think that respect and discipline loss will be a result of that. I will discuss both sides of the essay before my point is drawn at the end. 

On the one hand, it is generally believed that learners had better be empowered to evaluate their teachers for educational growth. In fact, in  modern days, pupils are inclined to be the centre of the class, which empowers them to raise their voices over their studying issues comprising teachers. If the instructors compelled their learners to follow their path, the youngsters' confidence and creativity would suffer. Thus, it is essential that schoolteachers should encourage children to give feedback, which would help them look back and move forwards. Without such  assessments, the lecturer couldn't internalize new insights from children, contributing to diminishing teaching and learning quality. 

On the other hand, however, there is a widely held view among people that cultural values would be a negative consequence. Having said that, the Asian countries, especially Vietnam, traditionally teaching is considered to be the best career, therefore, it is true that pupils had better listen to and comply with their instructors. Nevertheless, that has not been compatible with  modern educative innovation  these days. If individuals still remained that belief, they would not meet the requirements of the globally general growth, which inspires the youth to debate and express their thoughts freely. 

In conclusion, human beings deem that the young generation should be supported to evaluate their teachers. Meanwhile, others believe that this will mitigate the intrinsically cultural belief. I strongly think that educators had better listen to learners' ideas to have a far superior tendency of their cultivation while students ought to think over before commenting.

prompt:
Some people think that instead of preventing the climate change, we need to find a way to live with it. 
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
A section of the society believes that in spite of putting a stop to environmental crises, they think to adjust to the change. I unequivocally disagree with such an opinion because it will cause several health issues in people and it will also increase the temperature.

The first reason for my disagreement is that climate emergency will make people ill. It generally occurs due to the toxic gases released in the air such as carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and helium, breathing such harmful substances makes a person suffer multifarious health issues. Moreover, it decreases the life span of an individual because of not getting sufficient oxygen. For example, a recent article in Times Now revealed that 27 per cent of people leaving in urban areas suffer Lung dysfunction at their early age. 

The further reason is that global warming is a life-threatening problem. The rise in temperature  is a menace to the vegetables growing, as a ,result there will be very little food available for the individuals. Further, the meltdown of glaciers will raise the sea level, and many islands will soon be drowned in water. To illustrate, a survey by the University of Dubai revealed that  95 per cent of the country is dependent on the import of food due to global warming.

To conclude, I firmly believe that change in environment will lead to various diseases in human and it will also increase the degree celsius of the country.

prompt: Newspapers have an enormous influence on people’s opinions and ideas. Do you think it is a positive or negative situation?
essay:
Newspapers have a huge impact on people's belief and the way they perceive things. In my opinion, this phenomenon is a positive one because it enlightens people with happenings around the globe and at the same time educates the public and provide opportunities such as job offers to them.

Firstly, Newspaper is a medium through which people can get aquatinted with adequate knowledge of what goes around. This is because apart from television, radio and the internet, newspapers are another effective media platform that carries informative news about current happenings in the local and international scene. In addition, the newspaper is beneficial to people who do not have access to other media platforms and they can be equally informed as others. For example, people in Nigeria where there is a constant interrupted power supply, now rely on newspapers as a source of information in other to be updated with the ongoing pandemic.

Secondly, people have been educated and enlightened through newspapers. Method of hand washing has been taught since the beginning of the pandemic and people have learnt how to avoid direct contact with people. Finally, jobs have been advertised in newspapers as well as scholarships, which has created opportunities for the people. Several businesses have gained customers as well as employed more people to their company. For example, 56% of the employees of NNPC confirmed that they got to know about its vacancy through their adverts on newspapers.

In conclusion, newspapers have had positive effects on people's judgement and belief and at the same time, it has created job opportunities and enlightened the public.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement: 8**
The essay effectively addresses the task by discussing both positive and negative aspects of newspapers' influence on people's opinions and ideas. The candidate provides relevant and coherent arguments, supporting their position with examples and evidence. However, the introduction could be improved by providing a clearer thesis statement.

**Coherence and Cohesion: 8**
The essay is well-organized and easy to follow. Transitions between sentences and paragraphs are smooth, and connecting words and phrases are used effectively. The essay flows logically and maintains a clear progression of ideas.

**Lexical Resource: 7**
The essay demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, but there are some errors in usage and accuracy. For example, "enlightens" and "educates" are used repeatedly, and the phrase "adequate knowledge" could be replaced with a more precise term.

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy: 7**
The essay exhibits a variety of sentence structures, but there are some grammatical errors. For example, "aquatinted" should be "acquainted," and "other media platforms" should be "other media sources." The use of punctuation is generally correct, but there are some missing commas.

**Overall Band Score: 8**
Overall, the essay is well-written and effectively addresses the task. It demonstrates a good level of coherence, cohesion, and lexical resource. However, there are some grammatical errors and inaccuracies in vocabulary usage that prevent it from achieving a higher band score.

**Feedback and Additional Comments:**

**Strengths:**

- Clear and concise thesis statement
- Well-organized and coherent structure
- Good range of vocabulary

**Areas for Improvement:**

- Use more precise and varied vocabulary
- Correct grammatical errors (e.g., "aquatinted" -> "acquainted")
- Improve sentence structure and punctuation

**Strategies for Enhancement:**

- Expand vocabulary by reading widely and using a dictionary or thesaurus
- Practice writing complex sentence structures
- Review grammar rules and practice using them in writing

prompt:
men and women are different in terms of their characteristics and abilities. for this reason, their jobs are better done by men and other by women.
to what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, much concern has been directed to the differences between males and females. Indeed, these differences lead to sort some jobs, according to gender. It has been stated that men are better to perform specific tasks, while other tasks can be done by the soft gender.  In my opinion, I totally agree that some types of work require a specific gender.

First of all, men's characteristics make them suitable for hard jobs. Physically, a man's body is much stronger than a woman. For example, in the United States of America, around 98% of the construction labourers are male. Such workers can take the difficult job situations.  In addition, the females' ability to work under pressure is less than males. It can be seen that a woman can be stressed because of a small amount of pressure. Meanwhile, males are able to face stress in a better way.

Secondly, a male cannot take much emotional responsibility as a female does. In jobs that require significant emotional aspects, women have proved to be a better fit. For instance, a recent study in Canadian schools shows that the top 20 teachers in Canada are females. A teacher needs to emotionally understand students to help them in the educational process. However, female teachers can easily build a good relationship with students. Thus, women are able to handle jobs that need emotional.

To conclude, hard jobs need a person who is strong both physically and mentally. In contrast, some jobs require someone who has inspiring feelings. Hence, men are better at some jobs, while women are better in other jobs.

In addition, a multitude of problems need prioritising to solve at locals are not doing, either. As a result, it does not have high effects on the economy, wastes, and not help populations, and gains a lot of against from the community.

On the other hand, training the types of art and artists brings a lot of huge benefits when using it the correct way. Standing in the perspective of the leader of provinces, depending on the special of their local, they can give the right viewpoints for their local economy by growing professions and advertising them. This can be seen, in a multitude of places that have special cultural heritage, investing and support by the authority for art types and training artists to advertise them that help their local economy to develop, and it has harvested giant profits. For example, a number of lands have some places recognized as cultural heritage in the world, the government invested in performing arts and it gives a giant profit which helps to solve a couple of urgent issues in society.

In conclusion, it’s not wasted when we develop the art right way and the heart of the issue lies in the perspective of the manager. Besides, the authorities should have suitable and sustainable policies that help the purpose of creating a society better and better.

prompt: In some countries, celebrities complain about the way the media publicize their private lives. Some people say that they should accept it as part of their fame. Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
These days, the media intrusion of celebrities’ privacy is becoming more popular in some parts of the world. It is argued by some that famous people have to embrace this trend as a price for their fame. However, in my opinion, I totally disagree with this view on account of some reasons below.

There are many reasons why I strongly believe that it is unjustifiable for the private lives of well-known people to be widely publicized through means of mass media. First of all, the privacy of personal information should be respected as a human right regardless of who they are. Celebrities are also humans, and they should have their own life or their own freedom. Secondly, when the private lives of influential people appear on social media, this can somehow cause some controversy among some groups of people. In fact, some anti-fans or uncivil people can unconsciously post some negative comments which make loyal fans become angry. This would be worse if those people have heated debates and intentional insulation, which leads to utter chaos in society to some extent.

Some people hold an argument that the loss of privacy is an unavoidable part of becoming a famous celebrity. This is because human beings are undoubtedly a curious species, and headlines about well-known stars’ private lives can catch the attention of many viewers, making the publicity of celebrities become greater at the same time. Having said that, I still argue that the personal lives of famous people should not be published in the media due to tremendous negative effects on their mental health. To be more specific, being famous stars can be pressured and stressful since they always have to worry about others’ opinions or be careful in every action when the paparazzi can follow them at any time. For instance, many K-pop stars cannot put up with criticism of Internet users when their private lives are reported on articles, leading them to depression or even suicide.

In conclusion, because of the aforementioned reasons  in terms of human rights and detrimental effects on celebrities’ mental well-being in particular and society in general, I disagree with the view that famous people should accept privacy invasion as a part of their reputation.

### Grammatical Range and Accuracy
- The essay exhibits a variety of sentence structures, demonstrating a good command of grammatical range.

prompt: In some countries more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?
essay:
The number of residents who are interested in exploring the past of dwellings they live in is increasing in some regions. In this essay, I will describe the reasons and the way residents find history.

 There are some reasons why the occupants tend to explore the past of their living places. Firstly, people consider that the history of their house is important because the location has been culturally impacted by circumstances and neighbours. To be more specific, residents need to assimilate into that culture once they move to the place. Therefore, they check whether the culture is the one they like. Another reason is that residents prefer to stay in a dwelling that has great stories. For instance, if renowned persons such as presidents' families, leaders for revolution, skilled professors used the residence, dwellers can enjoy by imagining how the notables contributed to nations and became famous.

 Several methods to search histories are available. Nowadays, the internet has a greater impact on searching histories than paper books. As anyone can write articles on the internet without restrictions, it is possible to search both the bright and negative sides of history and reputation about dwellings. Additionally, there is a strong possibility that beneficial stories have been handed down by the local people. 

 In conclusion, some locals are attracted to studying histories around their dwellings because their preferred cultures and respectable histories provide the residents with conformable lives and infinite imagination. In order to explore histories, citizens take advantage of not only the internet but neighbours’ historical stories.

prompt:
Some people think that the best way to solve global environment problems is to increase the cost of fuel. 
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The continuous burning of fossil fuels is the major contributor to the environmental problem plaguing mother earth over the last decade. Society feels that the best way to tackle this problem is to increase the cost of fuel. However, I feel that is not the only way to relieve this planet of this problem. I will substantiate my reasoning in the course of this essay.

	First and foremost, increasing fuel costs will create a change in the transportation sector. Many people will choose to take alternate mediums of transport. They will be encouraged to carpool, use public transport and even in the case of short-distance travel, walk or use a bicycle. However, there is still no guarantee for this. For example, in my hometown Trivandrum, the price is currently INR. 104/- per litre, and keeps rising every week. Considering, that travel by car and bike is the easiest mode of transportation because of the distance between the different requirements in the city, and the lack of a reliable public transport system, individuals are still forced to rely on their cars to move from place to place.

	Alternately, what the government needs to do, is to strengthen the public transport sectors, impose heavy fines on the number of vehicles a family can posse, and in addition, they must thrust onto the public fines for using vehicles after a certain hour. Furthermore, they should encourage local bicycle businesses, by creating more bicycle lanes and parks, which will in turn help to boost their business. Car manufacturers, must look into the possibility of producing greener cars, and slowly phase out the production of petrol and diesel vehicles. Once this happens, more and more petrol stations will cater to the new requirements by vehicle owners. These are some of the changes that the administration can enforce.

	In conclusion, I believe the increase in fuel price is not the only answer for this problem, but in fact, the government has to invest heavily in renewable forms of energy if any sustainable and lasting change needs to be made.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
The essay adequately addresses the given task. The candidate has clearly understood the prompt and has provided a response that covers all the aspects of the task. The ideas presented are relevant to the topic and are supported with logical arguments. However, the essay lacks depth in analysis and could have explored the topic in more detail.

- Suggested Band Score (Grammatical Range and Accuracy): 7

prompt:
More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. Why?
Do advantage of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
Recently, increasing number of the population have concluded that it is better to have children at advanced age than in the past. This essay will suggest that this is in order to gain financial stability and career advancement. This essay will argue that the these advantages outweigh the primary disadvantage of menopause.

In today's world, it is only paramount to be financially stable. This is because the best of everything comes with a price. Education, which is said to be the key to success, have over the years, become rather too expensive, and have made majority of the people make the decision of being financially stable before raising a family. This is to enable them carter for the kids and provide them with the best there is to offer. For example, a recent survey in Lagos, Nigeria illustrates that 75% of the uneducated adults have poor background. Furthermore, most adults loose their life purpose to parenting as more women transition from working class women to housewives. Consequently, this have informed the decision of attaining a certain level in one's career before deciding to become a parent. For instance, 90% of the working class adults are better parents than the unemployed ones.

Despite these advantages, some people believe that the drawback of menopause should be highly taken into consideration. However, this is not an issue because with the advancement in medical science, women of advanced ages are able to birth children through IVF. The medical records of Ivy hospital is a prime example, they have successfully reported 60 successful cases of invitro fertilization in women aged 40 years and above.

In conclusion, it is wise to be financially independent and employed before becoming a parent. This reason outweigh the flawed argument of being unable to put to birth at advanced age.

prompt: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by the artificially intelligent robots? what is your opinion?
essay:
The artificially intelligent robots have been part of the society since it was created and today many of our daily tasks are possible because of it.  Some people argue that this field would overtake all the work done by humans. In my opinion, to an extent, it can be possible, however, there are some jobs that will still use the human labour  rather than using robots. 

To begin with, robots have overtaken many job positions currently. When it comes to companies which produce cars, technology and food, it is pretty likely to see robots in their production lines  performing  most of the duties,  because of the accuracy and  the efficiency that they have. One robot might do several tasks at the same time, whereas one person can possibly do only one task and require more time. Furthermore, the artificially intelligent robots provide various benefits. While employees need to get paid, vacations and insurances, robots will only require installation process and maintenance, which is pretty convenient for the company cost.

However, I believe that there are still some jobs that cannot be done by artificially intelligent robots. Firstly, the medical field is likely to remain requiring doctors. For instance, Although there are some robots that can undertake a surgery, the doctors are still domain most of the medical procedures and researches due to the complexity of the human body and their experience.  Secondly, the jobs regarding with the economy and administration are more likely to require people who can predict future crisis and economical approaches. In my opinion, robots are not prepared to undertake the duties of a project manager or stock analysis yet.  

In conclusion, although robots can be useful in production processes, I believe that some jobs will still remain done by humans. However, there is no doubt that in the future, artificial intelligence  will be a treat for the humanity.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by providing a clear stance on the topic and supporting it with relevant arguments.
- The essay covers all aspects of the task, addressing the potential replacement of human workers by artificially intelligent robots and acknowledging the limitations of robots in certain fields.
- The ideas are presented in a logical and coherent manner, with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 7

## Coherence and Cohesion:
- The transitions between sentences and paragraphs are clear and fluid, maintaining a smooth progression of ideas.
- Connecting words and phrases are used effectively to guide the reader through the essay's structure.
- The logical sequence and arrangement of information enhance the overall organization and structural integrity of the text.
- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 7

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The essay demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, with a mix of simple and complex words.
- There are a few instances of inaccuracies or overuse of certain words, such as "overtake" and "require."
- The vocabulary used is generally appropriate for the context of the essay.
- **Mistakes:**
    - "overtake" could be replaced with "replace" or "automate"
    - "require" could be replaced with "necessitate" or "demand"
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 6.5

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
- The essay exhibits a variety of sentence structures, including simple, compound, and complex sentences.
- There are a few grammatical errors, such as incorrect verb forms and sentence construction.
- **Mistakes:**
    - "When it comes to companies which produce cars, technology and food, it is pretty likely to see robots in their production lines performing most of the duties" could be improved to "In companies that produce cars, technology and food, it is highly likely that robots will be seen performing most of the duties in their production lines."
    - "robots are not prepared to undertake the duties of a project manager or stock analysis yet" could be improved to "robots are not yet equipped to undertake the duties of a project manager or stock analyst."

- However, there are a few areas where the essay could be improved, such as the precision of vocabulary and the elimination of grammatical errors.
- Suggested Overall Band Score: 7

prompt: Employees should not work in jobs they don’t enjoy.  To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some people think that employees need not continue in their current occupations if they do not love what they do. I completely agree with the above statement, and this essay further discusses the reasons for supporting the above statement.

To begin with, Job satisfaction is significantly important and plays a vital role in everyone’s Job. People who work in their desired positions always tend to perform well and achieve not only their goals but also the company's targets, which will eventually lead to an increase in the company’s year-over-year revenue and success. For example, a recent survey was conducted at the University of Waterloo to analyze the percentage of young entrepreneurs in the 21st century. Fortunately, the results were astonishing, and it was found that this generation's youngsters follow their passion by having their own start-ups, instead of working on the jobs that they were not interested in.

Furthermore, employees who perform their duties with dissatisfaction are highly prone to health-related issues. This is due to the fact that work done without interest can cause stress and mental illness, which in turn affects the mental stability of workers on a daily basis. For instance, there was an article written in Times Now magazine about the health topic. It states that, nowadays people who are forcefully working on their jobs without enjoying show an increase in mental health-related issues such as anxiety, depression, and so on.

To summarize, it is very important that employees should take up the jobs which they love. This not only helps the company but also benefits each individual worker. In addition, mental peace and health are more important than performing tasks with dissatisfaction.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement: 7**

The essay adequately addresses the task by providing a clear stance on the topic and discussing the reasons for supporting it. The ideas presented are generally relevant and coherent, but some aspects of the task are not fully covered. For instance, the essay does not discuss the potential drawbacks of employees not working in jobs they enjoy, which is an important consideration in the context of the prompt.

**Coherence and Cohesion: 6.5**

The essay is generally well-organized and easy to follow, with clear transitions between sentences and paragraphs. However, there are some instances of abrupt shifts in ideas, such as the transition from the first paragraph to the second, which could be smoother. Additionally, the essay could benefit from more explicit connecting words and phrases to enhance cohesion.

**Lexical Resource: 6**

The essay demonstrates a limited range of vocabulary, with some inaccuracies and overuse of certain words. For example, the word "important" is used three times in the first paragraph, which could be replaced with more precise or varied vocabulary. Additionally, the essay contains some grammatical errors, such as the use of "work done without interest can cause stress" instead of "work done without interest can lead to stress."

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy: 6**

The essay exhibits a limited range of sentence structures and makes some grammatical errors. For example, the sentence "People who work in their desired positions always tend to perform well and achieve not only their goals but also the company's targets" could be improved by using a more complex sentence structure and precise vocabulary. Additionally, there are some punctuation errors, such as the missing comma after "For example" in the second paragraph.

**Overall Band Score: 8**

The overall essay performance aligns with the provided score of 8. The essay adequately addresses the task, provides relevant and coherent ideas, demonstrates a basic level of vocabulary and grammar, but has some areas for improvement in terms of cohesion, lexical resource, and grammatical accuracy. prompt: The education of young people is highly prioritized in many countries. However, educating adults who cannot write or read is even more important and governments should spend more money on this. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In the present competitive era, a large number of  countries consider the importance of  young people education rather than illiterate grownups. On that, they spent huge amounts on the new generation. However, I strongly agree with the requirement of elder people education also having  equal importance to develop the nations. Below I describe  both categories requirements.

The younger generation is the future of  all countries and in this technology developed , the world they have the key role to take up the nations to stand up on the world’s top list. In view of that, Nations are concentrating on allocating hefty budgets to increase their skills and achieve the literacy rate of 100% in the current generation. Moreover, most of the countries providing subsidies on youth education also increase education facilities within the government institutions to improve knowledge rate. In addition to this, so many developing countries have a very high percentile of younger generation comparatively adults.

In my opinion, earlier generation people have  very limited resources in learning and it was so costly for the poverty people. Also, there is a limited interest of the governments to spend the money on education facilities which cause more illiteracy in elder community and also affected to increase poor nations in the world. To counter this situation, they have to learn the new skills and technology, to take up the nation to its heights. Otherwise, this will lead to a gain in  poverty and an increase in unemployment of elder people. In addition to that, there will be a chance of increasing  thefts, crimes on the lack of income resources, this will lead the nation into a crisis and un-stability in the global outlook.

In conclusion, Nations need to understand the country will develop if all the people develop, it is not that one category of people will lead the nation. So their attention should be balanced all groups development simultaneously and according to that nations has to develop their policies on their spending.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some people hold the opinion that asking teenagers to do community work with no salary when they are available could both have a beneficial influence on teenagers and the community. From my perspective, I totally agree with that opinion and I will give several reasons to support it as follows.

There are several reasons why those young generations could receive positive feedback in  community work. Firstly, through a volunteer job, they can enrich their free time which may be wasted on some boring issues as usual, and be more resourceful by cultivating some important or daily skills and gaining valuable experiences. Besides, being a volunteer in  society, their CV tends to be more plentiful instead of sole, prosaic academic grades,  which brings more opportunities to them in university or job enrollment. For example, universities have a higher propensity for candidates with rich experience.

Undoubtedly, the community itself would be benefited from teenagers’unpaid tasks. It is obvious that it can save a lot of money for the expansion is massive to employ paid adult workers. Society can use the money saved to improve citizens life quality through establishing more fundamental facilities and enhancing the environment. What’s more, the relationships of the neighbours tend to be more closer for most of the community issues are very simple and daily works such as newspaper delivery. The community will solve fewer emotional problems due to the curtailing of the distance between residents’ hearts.

In conclusion, unsalaried community work done by teenagers will absolutely generate salutary impacts not only on those teenager volunteers and on the community as well.

prompt:
The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To

what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The most effective method to teach a child cooperation is through sports in their learning institution. I strongly agree with this idea because they are opportune to work with different personalities to achieve a specific goal, as well as learn conflict resolution skills.

To begin with, they are actively working to accomplish a task. In games like football along with basketball, each team is composed of more than four players, they each have separate opinions, personalities, and skills while wanting to play the game how each of them best fit. However, when this happens the outcome is often disastrous, for this reason, there has to be a plan, and all teammates stick to following it during the game, only then will they be able to succeed. For instance, when a team of footballers was asked how they had been able to win a majority of their games, they all mentioned the same thing, teamwork! Hence, portraying the importance of sports in fostering cooperation.

 Furthermore, sports play a role in advocating for conflict resolution. With everyone having different ideas together, they are bound to arguments. Nevertheless, these types of situations are able to teach them skills on how to handle misunderstandings effectively. To illustrate, at a younger age, I was part of a sports team where the coach tutored us on how to handle disagreements. Moreover, when an issue arose, we were able to practicalize this which led to quick resolution of any quarrel. This supports the notion that sports is an effective method of teaching children cooperation.

To sum it up, this essay has discussed the importance of physical education in teaching children how to cooperate through working together with different people to reach one goal and learning how to resolve conflict.

prompt: Some people believe that robots will play an important role in future society while others argue that robots might have negative effects on society.  Discuss both of view and give your opinion.
essay:
Robots are likely to become more prevalent in people's daily lives just like other technological devices. People have different views about whether this change would be beneficial, or it could impact our lives in a bad way. Personally, I would side with those who believe that robots' role could be detrimental.
 
On the one hand, technological developments, including robots, would make a great contribution to societies. Firstly, they could operate in locations that humans cannot reach or could be dangerous for them. They could be sent to outer space to explore the other planets or could be replace humans to do mining in order to reduce the risk of getting killed or injured for individuals, for example. Secondly, one of the impressive roles that robots play is providing more free time by helping in manual daily works such as washing, cleaning and shopping. Besides, since they do what they are asked to do without any complaint, and are available 24/7, people can spend their spare time on reading or exercising which brings about personal growth.
However, there are several underlying reasons why robots could have adverse effects on our lives in the coming years. Robots could change the workforce's structure. Humans would be replaced by machines which will increase unemployment rate. Subsequently, societies will suffer from poverty and crime. Furthermore, these human-made machines can only do what they are planned to do. As a result, they could make mistakes while working which not only could have negative impacts but also could jeopardize people's lives. For instance, robots are used in hospitals as nurses, which could put individuals' lives in danger by injecting wrong medicine.
 
In conclusion, although robots could become dominant in the future due to the benefits they offer, I think their existence would have disastrous consequences for societies.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**
- The essay addresses the given task by discussing both views on the role of robots in future society and providing an opinion.
- The ideas presented are clear and relevant, covering all aspects of the task.

prompt: Some believe that people are naturally born as leaders while others feel that leadership skills can develop. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
It is under question that leadership ability is either innate or nurtured. Some people believe that it is only natural talent while others hold an opposite side that it can be learned. In my opinion, people can develop these skills thanks to learning and working progress and this essay will focus on this issue.
First of all, it is undeniable that there are many children born with superior abilities that can allow them to become talented leaders. Leaders are usually charismatic, confident and persuasive, without these things, it is very difficult to be an inspirational and leading person. For instance, salesman who often fails to persuade customers to sign contracts or make purchases have little chance of becoming a team leader or higher positions. This failure shows that the ability to make others trust and feel convinced of them is very low. 
However, there are many people who have demonstrated that leadership skills are achieved through training and effort. That is why there is a large number of courses are organized to help those who need to improve the skills required to become a successful leader as well as manager. People, especially who are shy and lack convenient, can learn about public speaking instead of good body language, pronunciation and so on and it will make them better leaders. Besides, needed skills such as how to communicate better, persuade others, be more confident and teamwork can also be cultivated and practiced. 
In conclusion, although some of the factors related to leadership such as attraction are innate, human can still try to develop other skills to compensate for our weaknesses. Thereby meeting the requirements to become a great leader.
